d.crumb: The Root Tantra of the Glorious Chakrasamvara in Fifty-One Chapters

f.d: Herein Is Contained the Great Tantra of the Great Yogini, the Root Tantra of the Bhagawan Glorious Chakrasamvara in Fifty-One Chapters
Translated by David Gonsalez
@##/ /rgya gar skad du/ tan+t+ra rA dza shrI la g+hu sam+ba ra nA ma/ bod skad du/ rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal bde mchog nyung ngu zhes bya ba/

(Shri-heruka-chakrasamvara-vidhana-yogi-niruttara-sarvatantra-uttara-samvara-samgraha-nama) The King of Blood Drinkers who is called Chakrasamvara, the unexcelled tantra of all the yogini tantras, guru Heruka, will be briefly explained.

d.crumb: 1. Entering the Mandala

f.d: 1. Entering the Mandala
bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
I prostrate to the Blessed One, glorious Vajrasattva.
de nas gsang ba bshad par bya/ / mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas par min/ /
Now I will explain the great secret, Briefly but not extensively.
dpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor/ / 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed yin/ / bla ma las kyang bla ma ste/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom/ /
By the excellent union of Shri Heruka, All of the desired aims will be obtained. He surpasses the unsurpassed: The net binding the dakinis.
gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na/ / thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs/ /
If [you] delight in this supreme secret, I will abide in the nature of all things.
mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni/ / rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba'i mchog / 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan dpa'/ / mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sdom pa yin/ /
The actual hero of all the dakinis, Vajrasattva — Supreme Bliss — [He] is the self-arisen Bhagavan Hero, The net binding the dakinis.
sgra yi tshul las nges 'byung rnams/ / dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul yin/ / 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' ba/ / thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas/ /

It has arisen from the source of sound. The sphere of activity is the practice of the commitments. Abiding perfectly in the beginning, middle, and end, In the three worlds [this tantra] is difficult to find.
bsrub bya srub byed yang dag sbyar/ / ji lta ba ni de bzhin du/ /
The perfect union of the churner and the churned — The mode of existence is like that.

sngags bzlas bsam gtan la sogs ldan/ / sbyor nyid cho ga'i ye shes ni/ / rnal 'byor bla na med pa yi/ / rgyud las gsungs pa mnyan par gyis/ / dbugs 'byin bar ma mchog dag dang / / dri yi chu dang bcas pas kyang / / rnal 'byor pas dus khyad par du/ / rigs ldan rtag tu mchod par bya/ /

Endowed with recitation of mantra and concentration, Union itself is the ritual of exalted wisdom. By listening to the explanation of The yoga of this unexcelled tantra, At special times the yogi should always Make offerings to those endowed with the lineage, The central, supreme, and pure breath,[10] Together with scented water and so forth.
pho nya lhan cig skyes grub ma/ / mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma ste/ / yid ni nang du chud pa yis/ / 'dod pa yi ni dngos grub bya/ /
Accomplish the simultaneously born messengers, Supreme, middling, or inferior; By directing the mind inward One should accomplish desire.
rang rdzas thig les sangs rgyas dang / / byang chub sems dpa' mchod par bya/ /
Make offerings with one’s own substance, the drops, To the buddhas and bodhisattvas.
mthong ba dang ni reg pa dang / / thos pa 'am ni dran pa yis/ / sdig pa kun las grol 'gyur ba/ / de lta nyid du the tshom med/ / rnal 'byor pa nyid bsod nams mchog /
The yogi himself is the supreme [field of] merit, Since by seeing, touching, Hearing, or remembering [him], [One] becomes liberated from all nonvirtues. About this itself you should have no doubt.
dag byed sdig pa 'joms byed pa/ / gsang sngags zlos dang bsam gtan dang / / bde bas kyang ni 'grub par 'gyur/ /
dam tshig rtag tu bskyang bar bya/ / shin tu mnyam bzhag sgrub pa pos/ / dam tshig nyams pas dkyil 'khor du/ / dbang bskur dngos grub thob mi 'gyur/ /

The practitioner with perfect mental stabilization Should always protect the spiritual commitments. By damaging the commitments, [One] will not attain the realizations From empowerment in the mandala.
sbrang rtsi mar dang ga pur bcas/ / tsan+dan dmar po dang sbyar ba/ / tshogs kyi nang du bzhag pa ni/ / thams cad rdor mtshan mtshan ma 'dzin/ /
By mixing honey, vermillion,[11] Camphor, and red sandalwood And placing [them] within the collection, Hold the sign that represents all vajras.
ming med mthe bo rtse sbyar bas/ / rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu spyad/ / myangs pas zhi ba'i btung ba bzhin/ / dngos grub rtag pa thob par 'gyur/ /
By joining the tip of the thick with the back side,[12] With knowledge of yoga, always enjoy [them]. By tasting it as if it were the peaceful drink[13] Everlasting attainments will be obtained.
'di ni mi 'chi bcu phyed 'gyur/ / dngos grub thams cad 'jug byed yin/ /
This [person] will not die for five [years]; It is the means of engaging all the attainments.
mchod bzhi dpa' bo chen po ni/ / yid la 'dod pa byed pa ste/ / dbang gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa yi/ / snyoms par zhugs pa'ang de nyid 'dzin/ /
With the four offerings the great hero [Fulfills] the wishes of the mind through The two organs engaging in union; Thus [you will] enter into union and sustain bliss.
lha dang mi yi bde ba ni/ / bsdus byas rdo rje 'dzin pa yis/ / de lta bur ni byed pa yi/ / bcu drug char ni mi phod do/ /
The happiness of gods and humans gathered together Could not compare to even a sixteenth Of that produced in such a way By the vajra holder.
ri bo tshang tshing sman ljongs sam/ / chu bo che rnams ngogs dag dang / / gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du/ / der ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bya/ /
The mountain, a jungle, a medicinal valley, The banks of a great river, and In a primordial charnel ground: In these [places] draw the mandala.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i le'u ste dang po'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “ENTERING THE MANDALA” IS THE FIRST CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 2. The Ritual for Making Offerings to the Mandala

f.d: 2. The Ritual for Making Offerings to the Mandala
der ni lci ba ma lhung bas/ / dkyil 'khor sa ni nye bar byug / dur khrod thal bar ldan pa dang / / bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa yis/ /
In that place anoint the ground of The mandala with the unfallen cow dung And the ashes of the charnel ground Together with the five nectars.[14]
dkyil 'khor sa ni nyer byugs te/ / der ni dkyil 'khor yang dag brtsam/ / gnas de ru ni bsgoms pa yis/ / dur khrod du ni kun tu brtag /
After anointing the ground, In that place correctly construct the mandala, And by means of visualizing that place, [imagine] Everything is being performed in the charnel grounds.

ro bsregs sol ba'i phye ma dang / / dur khrod so phag ldan pa yis/ / dkyil 'khor bzang po bri bar bya/ / slob dpon dge ba'i mtshan nyid can/ / yang dag shes shing rgyud shes pa/ / dpal ldan khrag 'thung gsang sngags shes/ / khro med gtsang shing mkhas pa dang / / sbyor shes ye shes pha rol 'gro/ /

A master endowed with all qualities should Draw an excellent mandala With powder from a charred, burned corpse And bricks of a charnel ground. One should have proper knowledge and understanding of tantra And know the secret mantra of the Glorious Drinker of Blood. Without anger, one should be clean, neat, learned, and Know how to practice the perfection of wisdom.
thod pas spyi bor brgyan byas shing / / yan lag thal bas byugs pa dang / / gug skyed dag gis lus brgyan cing / / rus pa'i phreng la sogs pas brgyan/ /
With skulls adorning the crown of [your] head, Smear [your] limbs with ash And adorn your body with pure ornaments And a bone rosary possessing the proper bones.
dum gcig spyi bor brgyan pa dang / / rus pa'i phreng ba rnam par 'phyang / / kha T+wA~M ga ni lag na gnas/ / bdag nyid khrag 'thung dpal byas nas/ /
With one piece adorning your crown And with the bone rosary hanging down, Holding the khatvanga staff in [your] hand, You are the Glorious Drinker of Blood.
de 'og khrag 'thung dpal dran bya/ / 'khor lo 'di ni snying gar dgod/ / bdag nyid de ltar go bgos nas/ / ra ba rnams ni phyogs su dgod/ /
With mindfulness of the Glorious Drinker of Blood Arrange a chakra at your heart. Having armored oneself in such a way, Arrange the fences in the directions.
'og tu yang ni mtshon cha dgod/ / 'khor lo mtshon cha'i phreng ba dag / steng du mda' yi dra ba nyid/ / slar yang bdag nyid mkha' spyod du/ /
Below that, arrange the weapons as well. Place oneself within the mandala and Above create a web of arrows. Again, it is the nature of a dakini land.
gur byas de ni go char 'gyur/ / de ltar go cha de bgos nas/ / skabs gsum pas kyang mi phyed do/ /
Make a tent that becomes armor. If [one] wears the armor in that way, It cannot be destroyed even by the thirty-three [gods].
de ltar bdag nyid rab bsrungs shing / / sngags dang phyag rgyas rnam brgyan nas/ / dngos grub chen po rab ster ba'i/ / dkyil 'khor 'jigs pa bri bar bya/ /
Thus, by being adorned with mantra and mudra One has the supreme protection. Draw the terrifying mandala That bestows the supreme attainments.
de nas sems med srad bu'am/ / ru d+hi ra ni chen pos brlan/ / he ru ka dpal grong khyer mchog / dkyil 'khor 'jigs pa thig gdab bya/ / khru gang khru bzhi 'am khru brgyad pa/ /
Then, with a corpse-thread or one moistened with great blood, Draw the lines of the terrifying mandala, The supreme palace of glorious Heruka, One cubit, four cubits, or eight cubits.
sgo bzhi kun nas zur bzhi pa/ / rta babs bzhi yis rnam par brgyan/ / sngags pas nyis 'gyur rnam par spyad/ / mkha' 'gro dra ba'i bde mchog mchod/ /
All four doors have four corners, And it is adorned with four gates. The tantric practitioner should utilize a double [thread] And make offerings to Heruka, The net [binding] the dakinis.

de yi dbus su pad+ma ni/ / 'dab bcas lte ba 'bar dang bcas/ / ge sar yang dag ldan par gzhag / lte bar dgod bya dpa' bo ni/ / 'jigs byed kyang ni 'jigs par mdzad/ / mdangs dang ldan zhing rab tu 'bar/ / ha ha zhes pa'i sgra cher bzhad/ /

In the center of that is a lotus With petals, a blazing navel, and corolla. The hero arranged in the center Can terrify even Bhairava. He is ablaze with extreme splendor And the great laughter of HA HA,

thod pa'i phreng ba'i rgyan dang ldan/ / bzang po spyan gsum zhal bzhi mnga'/ / glang bo'i pags pa rnam par bgos/ / smin ma bzang po rdo rje dbyes/ / phyag na kha T+wAM mi thod bsnams/ / brgya phyed phreng bas rnam par brgyan/ /

Adorned with a rosary of human heads, Three excellent eyes, and four powerful faces, Gracefully wearing an elephant skin, and Good eyebrows separated by a vajra, His hands hold a katvanga and a human skull, And he is gracefully adorned with a rosary of fifty [heads].
de mdun gnas pa'i lha mo ni/ / rdo rje phag mo rab 'jigs ma/ / he ru ka dpal che la phyogs/ / spyan gsum drag po'i gzugs can yin/ /
In front of glorious Heruka Is the goddess Vajravarahi — The most terrifying goddess — With three wrathful eyes and a wrathful form.
ka pA la ni an+t+ras bkang / / kha nas ru d+hi ra 'dzag cing / / lha dang lha min mir bcas pa/ / phyogs kun tu ni sdigs mdzub byed/ /
Her skullcup is filled with intestines and From her mouth blood drips out. With a mudra she threatens in all directions Gods, demigods, and humans.
mkha' 'gro ma ni nyi shu bzhi/ / phag mo yi ni rigs las byung / / phyogs dang phyogs kyi mtshams rnams dang / / 'khor lo'i dbus su mchod par bya/ /
Make offerings to the twenty-four dakinis Who have arisen from the lineage of Vajravarahi And abide in the center And in the cardinal and intermediate directions.
de bzhin 'dir ni dpa' bo yang / / 'khor lor yang dag gnas pa mchod/ / sgrub po gal te dngos grub 'dod/ / gnyis med dpa' bo mchod par bya/ /
Make offerings to the heroes as well Who abide here perfectly in the mandala. The practitioner who desires spiritual attainments Should perform offerings to the nondual hero.
de nas bum pa bya ba ni/ / rtsa ba nag po la sogs med/ /
Next, accomplishing the vase: Not being black, without a base, and so forth,
mu tig gser dang rin chen dang / / byi ru dngul dang zangs ma ste/ / bza' ba kun gyis legs bkang ba'i/ /
Fill it completely with such things as pearl, gold, jewels, Coral, silver, copper, and all kinds of food.
snod ni steng du gzhag par bya/ / mgrin pa srad bus dkri ba dang / / kha ni 'dab mas brgyan par bya/ /
Place a vessel upon it, Tie a long thread around the neck, and Adorn the mouth with a leaf.

gos zung gis ni legs dkris pa/ / brgyad ni sgo ru rnam par dgod/ / gos zung gis ni legs dkris pa'i/ / bum pa dgu pa dbus su gzhag / gser ram dngul lam rin chen nam/ / mu tig rnams kyis mdzes par bya/ /

Wrap each well with a pair of garments and Arrange eight of them nicely at the doors, placing The ninth in the center, Well wrapped with a pair of garments. Beautify each with gold or silver, Pearl, or other jewels.
dkyil 'khor kun tu rin chen dang / / gser gyis mdzes par spras par bya/ /
Beautify the mandala with gold And every precious ornament.
grong mchog yid 'ong mchod na ni/ / grub pa nyid du the tshom med/ / bdag nyid kun nas zhal la ni/ / dri yi chu yis legs par gdab/ / gal te dngos grub mchog 'dod na/ / mar me brgya ni dbul bar bya/ /

If [you] worship in a delightful, supreme place, Have no doubts [about] the attainments themselves. With oneself in the door sprinkle perfectly scented water. If you desire the supreme attainments, Offer a hundred butter lamps.

nam mkha'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni/ / yid kyis thams cad steng du dgod/ / sa steng mkha' 'gro ma gang yin/ / dkyil 'khor kun tu dgod par bya/ / gang yang sa 'og mkha' 'gro ma/ / de ni sa 'og rnams su dgod/ / ma mo thams cad phyogs dang ni/ / phyogs mtshams rnams su dgod par bya/ /

The dakinis of the sky Are arranged above by the mind. Whichever dakinis are of the ground Should all be arranged in the mandala. Whichever dakinis go below the ground, Arrange them below the ground. Arrange all the female spirits in The cardinal and intermediate directions.
gal te dngos grub mchog 'dod na/ / dri dang me tog de bzhin spos/ / cho ga bzhin du de bzhin mchod/ /
If you desire the supreme attainments, Offer incense, perfume, flowers and the like According to the rituals.
mar me brgya yang dbul bya zhing / / dpal he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gnas/ / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams mchod/ /
Offer as well a hundred butter lamps [To] Heruka abiding in the mandala, Together with the heroes and yoginis.[15]

rgyal mtshan dmar dang de bzhin ser/ / dkar dang nag dang ser skya dang / / me tog phreng ba du ma dang / / de bzhin gos ni sna tshogs dang / / bla re dang ni yol ba dag / mdzes pa ji lta de bzhin te/ /

Offer red victory banners, yellow ones, and so forth, As well as a variety of clothing in White, black, and pale yellow, And various flower garlands with Canopies and pure vessel [cups]. In this way beautify [the mandala].
de bzhin bza' bca' btung ba yis/ / rab mnyam bzhag ste mchod par bya/ /
Thus with food and drink And perfect concentration perform the offerings.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las 'khor lo mchod pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL FOR MAKING OFFERINGS TO THE MANDALA” IS THE SECOND CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 3. The Good Qualities of the Ritual of Bestowing Empowerment

f.d: 3. The Good Qualities of the Ritual of Bestowing Empowerment
de nas sgrub pos dngos kun gyis/ / dang por slob dpon mnyes par bya/ / grub 'dod shin tu mnyam bzhag pas/ / ci nus pas ni bla ma mchod/ /
Next, the practitioner [should] First please the spiritual master with all things. Desiring attainments and with strong concentration Make as many offerings to the guru as you are able.
dril bu sgra ldan dpyangs pa dang / / me tog spos rnams kyis brgyan cing / / shin tu sgra snyan dril bu dkrol/ / sgrub pa po yis rnga brdung zhing / / ha ha zhes ni brjod par bya/ /
Hanging the resounding bell, Adorned with flowers and incense, Cause the sweet sound of the bell to be heard. The practitioner beats the drum And proclaims HA HA.
de ltar cho ga bzhin dkyil 'khor/ / 'dod pa kun ldan mchod nas ni/ / bu sdug de dag gdong pa la/ / dar ras legs par bkab nas su/ / thal mo me tog gis bkang ste/ / yang dag par ni zhugs pa dag /

Having made offerings to the mandala With all desires, according to the ritual, The face of that beautiful son should be Covered with an excellent silken cloth And his palms filled with flowers, Then he should perfectly enter [the mandala].
sgrub po shin tu mnyam bzhag pas/ / de nas bskor ba byas nas ni/ / blo bzang yid ni mnyam bzhag pa/ / pho brang nyams dgar gzhug par bya/ /
With the practitioner in meditative stabilization He should circumambulate [the mandala] With a good mind of mental stabilization And enter the magnificent palace.
lho yi phyogs su lus bstan la/ / thal mo'i me tog de nas dor/ / dkyil 'khor steng du dor bar bya/ /
With your body in the southern direction Toss the flower with your hands And cast it over the mandala.
gang du me tog de lhung ba/ / shrI he ru ka'i gnas sogs bstan/ / de yi rigs ni rnam bstan te/ /
Wherever the flower drops, That reveals the place of Shri Heruka, [Your] spiritual lineage and so forth.
de ni rigs de'i ming 'gyur bar/ / slob dpon gyis ni ming bstan no/ /
Your name is then revealed by the master and The name of that lineage becomes your name.
de nas slob dpon legs par ni/ / mnyam par bzhag ste phyag rgya mchod/ / de nas slob ma phyi de nyin/ / las ni yang dag spyad par bya/ /
After that the excellent master abiding in Meditative stabilization makes the offering of the mudra, And on the next day the disciple Should perfectly perform the actions.
mtshal chen lan gsum bzlas pa yis/ / de rnams su ni thig le bya/ / slob ma yi ni gdong phye la/ / de nas dkyil 'khor bstan par bya/ / lha gang gi ni gnas gang yin/ / der de yang dag bstan par bya/ /

By reciting three times over blood [The master] forms it into a drop And uncovers the face of the disciple And should then reveal the mandala, Showing perfectly the correct place Of each deity of the palace.

slob dpon dang bcas pho brang la/ / de nas slob mas rab btud nas/ / phyir yang g.yon nas brtsams pa yis/ / de nas bskor ba byas nas ni/ / dkyil 'khor dang ni bla ma la/ / ji bzhin cho gas phyag bya'o/ /

Next the disciple perfectly bows And once again circumambulates the master Together with the palace, Beginning from the left. Afterward according to the ritual Pay obeisance to the mandala and the guru.

de nas bla ma dag la yon/ / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa dbul/ / gser ni brgya stong dbul ba dang / / rin chen rnam pa sna tshogs dang / / ras ni zung gyur brgya nyid dang / / glang po rta dang yul 'khor dang / / rna rgyan dang ni gdu bu dang / / mgul gdub sor gdub dam pa dang / / gser las byas pa'i mchod phyir thogs/ / chung ma bzang dang bu mo nyid/ / bran pho bran mo sring mo rnams/ /

Then make excellent offerings to the guru. As in the teachings by the Tathagata, offer One hundred thousand gold [coins] And a variety of precious things, A hundred pairs of clothing, Horses, elephants, and the kingdom, Earrings, bangles, Necklaces, and excellent rings for the fingers, A sacrificial thread made of gold, Your excellent wife and daughter herself, Male and female servants and [even] your sisters.
phyag btsal nas ni dbul bar bya/ / ji skad gsungs bzhin slob ma ni/ / blo dang ldan pas bla ma la/ / dngos po kun gyis bdag nyid ni/ / de bzhin du ni dbul bar bya/ /
After making prostrations offer [these]. Thus according to the teachings the disciple Should thoughtfully offer oneself to the guru As well as all the other offerings.

deng nas brtsams te bran du bdag / khyed la bdag gis phul ba lags/ / de nas sgrub pos rab nges par/ / de ltar cho ga byas na ni/ / de nas de la mkha' 'gro ma/ / rnal 'byor ma mo rnams mnyes 'gyur/ / mkha' 'gro ma dang lA ma dang / / khaN+Da ro hA gzugs can ma/ /

From that time on you become a servant [of the Guru] [Saying] “I offer myself to you as your servant.” Then things are perfectly arranged By the practitioner according to the ritual, Which pleases the dakinis and yoginis [Such as] Dakini, Lama, Khandaroha, and Rupini.
sgrub po mkha' 'gro ma lhan cig / de dang rnam spyod kun tu 'gro/ / thams cad sgrub po de yi ni/ / ci bgyi byed par the tshom med/ / rnal 'byor 'di ni sgrub 'gyur na/ /
Whatever action you do and wherever you go The practitioner should go together with dakinis. If you accomplish this yoga Have no doubt that whatever you do, It will all be accomplished.
'jig rten gsum du mi bzlogs shing / / mi snang phug dang nam mkhar rgyu/ / rkang mgyogs de bzhin bcud kyis len/ / sgrub pa po ni 'dod tsam gyis/ / rtag par rgyun du bskyed par 'gyur/ /

You will be unencumbered in the three worlds, Become invisible, go underground and in the sky, take the essence and be swift-footed. Through merely wishing it, the practitioner Can take rebirth as anything.
gzugs ni du ma byed pa dang / / nam mkha' la ni 'gro bar 'gyur/ / mkha' 'gro rnams kyang khyad par du/ / skad cig de la sbyor bskyed de/ / 'gro ba rnams kyang nges gnon par/ /
He can change his form into many things And travel through space. Even for the dakinis in particular, if the practitioner merely Looks once at a migrating being That being will certainly be subdued.
lan cig bltas pas rnal 'byor pas/ / sngags pa dkyil 'khor ma mthong bar/ / gang zhig rnal 'byor pa nyid 'dod/ / mkha' la khu tshur gyis brdeg dang / / smig rgyu'i chu ni 'thungs dang mtshungs/ /
If the mantrika has not seen the mandala Yet wishes to be a yogi, This is like trying to strike the sky with his fist Or drinking the water of a mirage.
rnal 'byor 'di ni mchog rab dang / / sbyor ba kun gyi dam pa yin/ / gang zhig rtag tu 'dod gyur pa/ / lha dang lha min mi rnams te/ / 'di dag zil gyis gnon par 'gyur/ /
This yoga is excellent and supreme. It is the most sacred of all practices; Whatever one desires will always arise. You will be able to overpower[16] Gods, demigods, and men.
rgyud 'di ru ni dbang bskur bas/ / thams cad kyi ni sgrub pa po/ /
It is said that [those who are bestowed] Empowerment into this tantra Will all become siddhas.
rgod dang lta dang lag 'dzin gyis/ / 'khyud dang gnyis sprad la sogs la/ / dbang bskur bar ni gyur pa yin/ / thams cad rgyud las dam pa'o/ / 'di ni lha mi zil gnon 'gro/ /

Through seeing, laughing, and holding hands, Embracing each other and so forth One should receive empowerment On the crown of the head in This most sacred of all tantras. The glory of this [tantra] subdues gods and men.

de nyid bsdus pa'am sdom pa'am/ / gsang ba'am rdo rje 'jigs byed las/ / dkyil 'khor rnams kyi rgyal po 'di/ / ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro/ / bshad dang ma bshad gang ci'ang rung / / de kun he ru ka la gnas/ /

This is the king of mandalas That has not emerged nor will emerge in The Tattvasamgraha, Samvara, Guhyasamaja, or Vajrabhairava.[17] Whatever is taught or not taught, It all resides in the Glorious Drinker of Blood.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las yon tan dang bcas pa'i dbang bskur ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste gsum pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE GOOD QUALITIES OF THE RITUAL OF BESTOWING EMPOWERMENT” IS THE THIRD CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 4. Establishing the Inseparability of the Heroes and Yoginis

f.d: 4. Establishing the Inseparability of the Heroes and Yoginis

de nas mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni/ / gnas na rnam par 'gying ba ste/ / brtson chen 'khor los sgyur ma dang / / stobs chen ma dang rab dpa' mo/ / 'khor lo'i go cha chang 'tshong ma/ / khaN+Da ro hA 'khor lo'i shugs/ /

Next the dakinis Who abide magnificently: Tsönchen (Mahavirya), Khorlo Gyurma (Chakravartini), Tobchenma (Mahabala), Rab Pamo (Suvira), Khorlö Gocha (Chakravarmini), Chang Tsongma (Shaundini), Dum Kyema (Khandaroha), Korlö Shuk (Cakravega).
bya gdong ma dang rta rna mo/ / shin tu bzang mo ljang lha mo/ / chang 'thung ma dang rlung shugs ma/ / de bzhin 'jigs byed chen mo dang / / sa srung ma dang shing grib ma/ /

Cha Dongma (Khaganana), Ta Namo (Hayakarna), Shintu Sangmo (Subhadra), Jang Lhamo (Shyamadevi), Chang Thungma (Surabhakshi), Lung Shukma (Vayuvega), Likewise, Jikché Chenmo (Mahabhairava) and Sa Sungma (Airavati). Shing Dribma (Drumacchaya),
lang ka'i dbang phyug mi'u thung ma/ / dpa' bo'i blo ma sna chen ma/ / 'od ldan ma dang gtum mig ma/ / rab gtum ma ste sgrub byed yin/ /
Langkai Wangchuk (Lankeshvari), Mi-u Tungma (Kharvari), Pawö Loma (Viramati), As well as Na Chenma (Mahanasa), Ödenma (Prabhavati), Tum Mikma (Chandakshi), And Rab Tumma (Prachanda).
mkha' 'gro ma ni nyi shu bzhi/ / 'di dag sngon nyid grub pa yin/ / sku gsung thugs kyi dbus su ni/ / ji ltar phyi rol nang de bzhin/ /
These are the twenty-four dakinis That have been previously established In the centers of body, speech, and mind, Internally just as they are externally.[18]
rang ming brjod pa'i sngags la ni/ / mthar ni hU~M hU~M phaT sbyar te/ /
Recite the mantras which are their own names and Attach HUM HUM PHAT at the end.
rnal 'byor rab mchog 'di mthong na/ / me ste gzhan dag sog mar mtshungs/ / o~M ni kun la gsal byed de/ / grub stsol 'dod pa thams cad byed/ /
Seeing this excellent supreme yoga Is like comparing fire to straw. OM illuminates all [the mantras]. It bestows all the desired attainments.
dpa' bo nyid 'gyur grub pa ni/ / khyim du dkyil 'khor mthong ba yin/ / de nas de rtag bsgom par bya/ / dngos grub de bzhin gshegs gsungs bzhin/ /
Accomplish the hero himself And view him within the mandala in a house, And then by continuously meditating [You] will accomplish the teachings of the Tathagata.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma gnyis su med par dgod pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “ESTABLISHING THE INSEPARABILITY OF THE HEROES AND YOGINIS” IS THE FOURTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 5. The Ritual of Collecting the Letters of the Root Mantra

f.d: 5. The Ritual of Collecting the Letters of the Root Mantra
de nas thams cad chos 'byung bar/ / sna tshogs lte bar mi shigs dge/ / sngags pas cho ga bzhin du bri/ / chos kun gcig tu bsdu bar bya/ /
And then the source of all phenomena: In the center of a variegated [lotus] Is the indestructible and virtuous one. The mantrika condenses all phenomena into one And writes according to the ritual.
'dir sngags tshig ni 'di yin te/ / A li kA li mnyam byas nas/ / sde tshan la ni yongs bsdoms pa/ /
bzhi bzhi ru ni shes byas la/ / thub pa mchog gi re mig la/ / der gnas dpa' bo btu bar bya/ / 'dod don thams cad sgrub byed pa'o/ /
By knowing the division of the four of four and The chart of the Supreme Able One Abiding there, the hero is collected; Bestowing the supreme attainment, All the desired aims are achieved.

bzhi pa'i lnga pa gang yin dang / / lnga pa yi yang lnga pa dang / / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / dang po'i gsum pa gang yin dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa dgu pa/ / bzhi pa'i dang po gang yin dang / / mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa dang / / de nyid kyi ni gnyis pa dang / /

That which is the fifth of the fourth, As well as the fifth of the fifth. The fourth of the fifth, and That which is the third of the first. Likewise the twenty-ninth And that which is the first of the fourth, The fourth of the semivowels,[19] and The second of that as well.

sum cu pa ni yang dag blang / / de bzhin nyi shu drug pa nyid/ / de dag thams cad legs bsdus la/ / de bzhin brgya yi phyed phyed yang / / de nas sum cu rtsa gsum gzung / / dang po'i dang po nyid dag dang / / mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa dang / / dang po yi ni gsum pa dang / / sum cu rtsa gnyis nyid dag dang / / bzhi pa yi ni lnga pa dang / / lnga pa yi yang bzhi pa dang / / mthar gnas pa yi dang po gang / / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / gsum pa'i dang po gang yin dang / / lnga pa yi yang lnga pa dang / / dang po yi yang dang po dang / / de bzhin bcu gcig pa nyid dang / / de bzhin mkhas pas bcu drug pa/ /

The thirtieth is correctly extracted, Likewise the twenty-sixth. All of these are perfectly assembled. Likewise half of half one hundred. And then take the thirty-third, The first of the first and The third semivowel, and The third of the first itself. The thirty-second itself and The fifth of the fourth, The fourth of the fifth as well, And the first semivowel. The third of the second and That which is the first of the third, The fifth of the fifth, The first of the first as well. Likewise the eleventh itself and Likewise the sixteenth [are extracted] by the adept.

gsum pa'i dang po gang yin dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa drug pa/ / bzhi pa'i gsum pa gang yin dang / / uSh+ma NA yi gnyis pa nyid/ / dang po'i dang po gang yin dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa bdun pa/ / nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa yang ngo / / dang po yi ni gsum pa dang / / lnga pa yi yang bzhi pa dang / / de bzhin sum cu rtsa gcig blang / / bcwa lnga pa ni nyid dag dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa lnga pa/ / dang po'i gnyis pa gang yin dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa drug pa/ / yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / /

That which is the first of the third And likewise the twenty-sixth, That which is the third of the fourth and The second sibilant.[20] That which is the first of the first And thus the twenty-seventh. Again the twenty-eighth, The third of the first, The fourth of the fifth as well. Likewise take the thirty-first As well as the fifteenth itself. Likewise the twenty-fifth And that which is the second of the first. Likewise the twenty-sixth and The thirty-second letter.

uSh+mA NA yi tha ma nyid/ / sum cu rtsa gnyis pa nyid dang / / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / uSh+mA NA yi gsum pa dang / / gzhan yang nyi shu rtsa bdun pa/ / an+tas+thA yi dang po dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa gcig pa/ / an+tas+thA yi gnyis pa dang / / de bzhin yang ni sum cu pa/ / lnga pa yi ni dang po dang / /

The last of the sibilants, And again the thirty-second. The fourth of the fifth and The third of the second. The fourth of the fifth and The third sibilant, Again the twenty-seventh And the first semivowel. Likewise the twenty-first again And the second semivowel. Likewise the thirtieth again And the first of the fifth.

uSh+mA NA yi dang po nyid/ / de bzhin yi ge d+ya nyid dang / / bzhi pa'i dang po gang yin dang / / uSh+mA'i dang po gang yin dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa/ / dang po'i gnyis pa gang yin dang / / gsum pa'i dang po nyid dag dang / / dang po'i gsum pa gang yin dang / / bzhi pa'i bzhi pa gang yin dang / / an+tas+thA yi gnyis pa dang / / gsum pa yi yang lnga pa dang / / yi ge byA ni de nas blang / / dang po yi ni bzhi pa dang / / de nas brgyad pa nyid dag dang / / bzhi pa'i lnga pa nyid dag yin/ / lnga pa yi yang lnga pa dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa bdun pa/ / bzhi pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / slar yang nyi shu rtsa bdun pa/ / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa drug pa/ / nyi shu rtsa lnga yang dag blang / / sum cu rtsa gsum nyid dag dang / / bzhi pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / lnga pa yi ni lnga pa dang / /

Also, the first sibilant and Likewise the letter DYA as well. That which is the first of the fourth And that which is the first sibilant. Likewise the twenty-eighth And that which is the second of the first. The first of the third as well, and That which is the third of the first. That which is the fourth of the fourth, And the second semivowel. The fifth of the third as well. Then the BYA is taken. The fourth of the first Then the eighth itself as well. That which is the fifth of the fourth, The fifth of the fifth as well. Likewise the twenty-seventh, The fourth of the fourth, Again the twenty-seventh, Likewise the twenty-sixth. The twenty-fifth is correctly extracted, The thirty-third as well. The fourth of the fourth and The fifth of the fifth.

bzhi pa yi yang lnga pa dang / / dang po'i dang po nyid dag dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa bdun pa/ / an+tas+thA yi bzhi pa dang / / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa gcig pa/ / uSh+mA NA yi gnyis pa nyid/ / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o/ /

The fifth of the fourth as well, And the first of the first itself. Likewise the twenty-seventh, The fourth semivowel as well. Likewise the twenty-first, The second sibilant itself, Likewise the twenty-sixth.

dang po'i dang po nyid dang ni/ / mthar gnas pa yi gnyis pa nyid/ / gnyis pa yi ni dang po nyid/ / drug pa yi yang gnyis pa'o/ / dang po yi ni dang po dang / / mthar gnas gnyis pa de bzhin te/ / gnyis pa yi ni dang po dang / / bdun pa yi ni gnyis pa dang / / drug pa yi yang gsum pa dang / / bzhi pa yi yang lnga pa la/ / bzhi pa yis ni sbyar bar bya/ / mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa dang / / lnga pa yi yang lnga pa la/ / bzhi pa yis ni gdan du bya/ / lnga pa yi ni dang po la/ / 'og tu me yi gdan dang ldan/ / uSh+mA NA yi gsum de bzhin/ / mthar gnas pa yi dang po yang / / bzhi pa yi ni dang po nyid/ / me yis gdan du byas pa'o/ / bdun pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / drug pa yi yang dang po gang / / ka Shar grags pa'i dang po gzung / / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / mthar gnas pa yi dang po gang / / de bzhin yang ni ril po nyid/ / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / bdun pa yi yang dang po dang / / uSh+mA NA yi bzhi pa gzung / / bdun pa yi ni bzhi pa la/ / rdo rje sems dpas phye ba dag / uSh+mA NA yi bzhi pa nyid/ / 'od byed gdan du byas pa'o/ / bdun pa yi ni bzhi pa la/ / 'og tu yang ni me yi gdan/ / tsheg drag dang ni yang dag ldan/ / lnga pa yi ni gnyis pa dang / / de bzhin nyi shu gnyis pa nyid/ / drug pa yi ni gnyis nyid dang / / de bzhin bcu gcig par ni nges/ / slar yang nyi shu rtsa gnyis gzung / / gsum pa yi ni dang po dang / / bzhi pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / uSh+mA NA yi bzhi pa nyid/ / lnga pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / bdun pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / nyi shu gcig pa de nas btu/ / gnyis pa yi ni dang po dang / / lnga pa yi ni dang por nges/ / gnyis las drug pa'i yi ge'o/ / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / de bzhin ka Shar grags nyid dang / / nyi shu bzhi pa de nas btu/ / slar yang ril po ji bzhin dang / / lnga pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / uSh+mA NA yi gsum pa dang / / mthar gnas pa yi gnyis pa nyid/ / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / slar yang 'od byed sbyin par bya/ / yi ge nyi shu'i 'og tu ni/ / bcu drug pa ni gdan du bya/ / 'og tu me yis gsal byas la/ / lnga pa yi ni lnga pa dang / / mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa dang / / lnga pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / drug pa yi yang gsum pa dang / / mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa dang / / nyi shu lnga pas khyad par dbye/ / bzhi pa yi ni lnga pa dang / / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa la/ / nyi ma'i bu yis khyad par dbye/ / uSh+mA NA yi bzhi pa dang / / 'og tu bcwa lnga pa yi gdan/ / dang po yi yang gsum pa dang / / de nas me yis gdan du bya/ / bdun pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / 'og tu bcwa lnga pa yi gdan/ / uSh+mA NA yi gsum pa nyid/ / lnga pa yi ni dang po la/ / bcu drug pa yis gdan du'o/ / de nas nyi shu gcig pa blang / / bzhi pa yi ni dang po dang / / mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa dang / / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / bzhi pa yi ni dang po dang / / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / gsum pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / dang po yi ni gsum pa dang / / uSh+mA NA yi gsum pa nyid/ / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa gcig pa/ / 'od byed mnyam par gnas pa'o/ / lnga pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / bzhi pa yi ni dang po dang / / gsum pa yi ni gsum pa la/ / me yis steng nas gsal bar bya/ / mthar gnas pa yi dang por gsungs/ / de nas yi ge bcu drug 'og / gsum pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / spyi bor me yi yi ges mtshan/ / de bzhin nyi shu rtsa drug nyid/ / dang po yi ni dang po dang / / gnyis pa yi ni dang po dang / / gsum pa yi ni bzhi pa la/ / bcu gsum pa yis mnan pa'o/ / dang po'i dang po de bzhin te/ / gnyis pa yi ni dang po dang / / gsum pa yi ni bzhi pa yi/ / steng du bcu gsum pa nyid dang / / uSh+mA NA yi bzhi pa la/ / nyi shu bdun pas gdan du bya/ / ya yig brgyad pa'i sa bon la/ / 'od byed kyis ni gsal byas pa/ / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa la/ / bcwa lnga pa yis gdan du bya/ / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa la/ / gsum pa'i lnga pa la ni bskyon/ / ka Sha'i sa bon btus nas ni/ / nyi shu lnga pas gdan du bya/ / ril po mdzes pa btus nas ni/ / yi ge ma yis gdan du bya/ / uSh+mA NA yi bzhi pa nyid/ / bdun pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / ya tshogs brgyad pa'i sa bon dang / / de bzhin sum cu gsum par nges/ / lnga pa'i bdag nyid yongs btus la/ / yang ni de la gnyis par nges/ / gnyis pa yi ni dang po dang / / mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa dang / / de bzhin sum cu rtsa gnyis pa/ / drug pa yi ni gsum pa dang / / bdun pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / drug pa'i gsum pa de bzhin te/ / lnga pa yi ni bzhi pa dang / / drug pa yi ni gsum pa ste/ / gnyis gnyis rkang pa bzhi yin no/ /

rig pa'i rgyal po'i gsang sngags te/ / bya ba thams cad rab sgrub pa'o/ / 'di las shin tu mchog gyur pa/ / 'jig rten gsum na yod min te/ /
he ru ka dpal sngags shes na/ / me ste gzhan dag sog ma 'dra/ / rtsa ba'i sngags su rab tu grags/ /

The secret mantra of the King of Knowledge Accomplishes all activities. There is nothing more supreme Than this in the three worlds.
By knowing the mantra of glorious Heruka Other [mantras] are like dry grass compared to fire. This is the famous root mantra.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge btu ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste lnga pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF COLLECTING THE LETTERS OF THE ROOT MANTRA” IS THE FIFTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 6. The Armor of the Six Heroes

f.d: 6. The Armor of the Six Heroes
gzhan yang yi ge nyi shu gnyis/ / snying po nye snying yi ge bdun/ / ya tshogs brgyad pa'i sa bon dang / / de bzhin gug skyed bcu gnyis kyi/ / yi ge bar ma dor byas la/ / yan lag drug ni he ru ka /

Furthermore there are the twenty-two syllables And the seven syllables of the essence and close essence [mantras]. There is the seed of the eighth of the YA collection, Likewise [adorned] by the twelve ornaments. By taking out the letters between [You obtain] the six branches spoken by Heruka.
dpa' bo drug dang mnyam sbyor ba/ / yi ge re rer yang dag gnas/ / o~M na maHswA hA bau ShaT/ / hU~M hU~M phaT dang yang dag ldan/ / sgrub pos snying por shes par bya/ /
Attached to the six heroes Abiding perfectly in each letter And perfectly endowed with OM NAMA SÖHA BOKAT HUM HUM PHAT. The essence should be known by the practitioner.
dang po snying ga nyid du ste/ / gnyis pa spyi bor shes par bya/ / gsum pa spyi gtsug dag tu sbyar/ / bzhi pa go cha nyid du yin/ / lnga pa mig tu gyur pa ste/ / drug pa mtshon cha zhes byar 'dod/ /

The first is at the heart itself, Know the second at the head, The third correctly placed on the crown of the head, The fourth is the armor itself, The fifth is at the eyes, And the sixth is said to be a weapon.[21]
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las dpa' bo drug gi go cha btu ba'i le'u ste drug pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE ARMOR OF THE SIX HEROES” IS THE SIXTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 7. The Condensed Rituals of the Root Mantra

f.d: 7. The Condensed Rituals of the Root Mantra

de nas dbyangs yig bcu gsum nyid/ / yi ge gnyis pa dag dang sbyar/ / dbyangs yig bcu gcig yang dag ldan/ / yi ge drug pas brgyan par bya/ / dbyangs kyi bzhi pa nyid kyang ni/ / yi ge bdun pa nyid dang sbyar/ / dbyangs yig bcu gcig pa nyid ni/ / mkhas pas yi ge brgyad dang sbyar/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang ldan par/ / yi ge dgu pas brgyan par bya/ / dbyangs kyi yi ge gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge bcu gnyis pa dang sbyar/ / dbyangs yig gnyis par ldan pa ni/ / yi ge nyi shu gcig pa gzung / / mkhas pas yi ge bcu bzhi pa/ / yi ge nyi shu pa dang sbyar/ / dbyangs kyi gsum pa nyid dag ni/ / yi ge bcwa lnga pa dang sbyar/ / dbyangs yig bcwa lngar yang dag ldan/ / yi ge bcu drug pa mdzes bya/ / dbyangs yig gsum pa dang ldan pa'i/ / yi ge bcu bdun pa ru 'dod/ / dbyangs kyi gnyis pa nyid dag ni/ / yi ge bcwa brgyad pa ru sbyar/ / dbyangs yig gi ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge nyi shu gcig par sbyar/ /

And then the thirteenth vowel itself Is joined with the second syllable. The eleventh vowel is perfectly Adorned by the sixth syllable. Also the fourth vowel is Attached to the seventh syllable itself. The eleventh vowel Is skillfully attached to the eighth syllable. The ninth syllable is adorned With the second vowel. The second vowel itself is attached to The twelfth syllable. Taking the twenty-first letter Possessing the second vowel, The adept then joins them to the fourteenth syllable. Taking the twentieth letter And combining it with the third vowel, then Combine them with the fifteenth syllable. The fifteenth of the vowels is perfectly endowed with The beautiful sixteenth syllable. The third vowel is endowed with The seventeenth syllable, which is combined [with it]. The second vowel is Attached to the eighteenth syllable. The second vowel is Attached to the twenty-first syllable.

dbyangs yig lnga pa nyid dang ni/ / yi ge nyi shu gsum par sbyar/ / dbyangs yig bcu gsum pa nyid ni/ / yi ge nyi shu bzhi par sbyar/ / sde tshan dang po blangs nas ni/ / yi ge nyi shu lnga par sbyar/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang ldan par/ / yi ge nyi shu rtsa drug 'gyur/ / nyi shu brgyad pa nyid dag ni/ / dbyangs yig bcwa lnga pa dang sbyar/ / gsum pa'i dang po yang dag ldan/ / 'og ma'i cha ni me dang bcas/ / de bzhin dbyangs yig gnyis par sbyar/ / yi ge nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o/ /

The fifth vowel is Attached to the twenty-third syllable. The thirteenth vowel is Attached to the twenty-fourth syllable. Having extracted the first group [of written letters] Attach it to the twenty-fifth syllable. The twenty-sixth syllable should be Endowed with the second vowel. The twenty-eighth is also Attached to the fifteenth vowel. The twenty-ninth syllable is Perfectly endowed with the first of the third, The part below endowed with fire, And likewise attach the second vowel.

yi ge sum cu rtsa gcig pa/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dag dang sbyar/ / yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis pa/ / dbyangs yig bcu gsum pa dang sbyar/ / yi ge sum cu rtsa gsum pa/ / nyi mar yang dag ldan par bya/ / dbyangs yig bzhi pa nyid dang ni/ / yi ge sum cu bzhir ldan pa/ / 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed yin/ / dbyangs yig lnga pa nyid dag ni/ / sum cu bdun par yang dag ldan/ / mkha' 'gro ma rnams sgrub byed yin/ / sum cu brgyad pa 'di dag ni/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang sbyar ba/ / lha rnams thams cad sgrub pa ni/ / 'di nyid yin par the tshom med/ /

The thirty-first syllable is Attached to the second vowel. The thirty-second is Attached to the thirteenth vowel. The thirty-third syllable should be Correctly endowed with the sun. The fourth vowel endowed with The thirty-fourth syllable Will accomplish all your desired aims. The fifth vowel itself, Perfectly endowed with the thirty-seventh, Accomplishes the dakinis. As for the thirty-eighth, Attach it to the second vowel. Have no doubt this will Accomplish all the deities.

bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa nyid la/ / 'og gi char ni sgrub pa pos/ / me dang sbyar ba bya ba nyid/ / bzhi bcu gsum pa nyid dag ni/ / dbyangs yig lnga pa nyid dang sbyar/ / yi ge bzhi bcu lnga pa ni/ / dbyangs kyi yi ge gnyis par sbyar/ / dbyangs yig lnga pa nyid dag kyang / / bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa ldan pa/ / dpa' bo thams cad rab mchod yin/ / bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa nyid ni/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang sbyar ba/ / 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' mchog /

The forty-second is likewise Attached by the practitioner to fire. The forty-third syllable Is attached to the fifth vowel. The forty-fifth is also Attached to the second vowel. The fifth vowel is also Endowed with the forty-sixth. This is the excellent, supreme offering of all the heroes. The forty-seventh is itself Attached to the second vowel. This is the supreme Vajrasattva.

de bzhin lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa/ / dbyangs yig lnga pa nyid dag gis/ / mdzes pa mchog ni yin par 'dod/ / lnga bcu rtsa gnyis pa nyid ni/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang sbyar ba/ / lha rnams thams cad sgrub byed ni/ / 'di nyid yin par the tshom med/ / de bzhin lnga bcu rtsa gsum pa/ / dbyangs yig bcu gsum pa dang sbyar/ / yi ge lnga bcu rtsa drug pa/ / dbyangs yig drug pa dang yang sbyar/ / dgra rnams nges par gsod byed yin/ / an+tas+thA yi bzhi pa dang / / dbyangs yig gnyis par sbyar bar bya/ / de bzhin bcwa lnga pa dang sbyar/ / dngos grub thams cad sgrub pa yin/ / yi ge lnga bcu rtsa dgur 'gyur/ / yi ge drug cu rtsa gcig nyid/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dag dang sbyar/ / 'di nyid mchog ni yin par bshad/ / de bzhin drug cu rtsa gnyis pa/ / dbyangs yig gsum par sbyar ba ni/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi mchog tu 'dod/ / yi ge drug cu rtsa gsum nyid/ / dbyangs yig bcu gcig yang dag ldan/ / mdzes pa'i yi ge kun mchog nyid/ /

The fifty-first is made Supremely beautiful by combining it With the fifth vowel. The fifty-second itself is Attached to the second vowel. Have no doubt this is the way To accomplish all deities. The fifty-third syllable is Attached to the thirteenth vowel. The fifty-sixth syllable is Correctly attached to the sixth vowel — With it enemies are definitely destroyed. The fourth semivowel is Attached to the second vowel, and Likewise, by attaching the fifteenth [vowel] To the fifty-ninth syllable, All realizations will be attained. The sixty-first syllable is Perfectly endowed with the second vowel. This is explained to be supreme. The sixty-second syllable is Attached to the third vowel, The supreme desire of the dakinis. The sixty-third syllable is also Perfectly endowed with the eleventh vowel, The most beautiful supreme syllable.

de bzhin drug cu rtsa lnga pa/ / rdo rje sems dpas phye ba dag / sa bon 'di ni lha rdzas mchog / grub sbyin thar pa sbyin chen po/ / yi ge drug cu rtsa drug pa/ / dbyangs yig gsum pa dang yang sbyar/ / bya ba kun la grub sbyin par/ / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs/ / yi ge drug cu rtsa bdun pa/ / dbyangs yig gnyis par yang dag ldan/ /

Likewise the sixty-fifth Is split apart by Vajrasattva. This seed is the supreme substance of the gods. The greatest gift is to bestow liberation. The sixty-sixth syllable is Correctly attached to the third vowel and Bestows attainment of all actions According to the speech of the tathagatas. The sixty-seventh syllable is Perfectly endowed with the second vowel.
rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba kun/ / 'di nyid yin par the tshom med/ / drug cu brgyad pa nyid la yang / / der ni yi ge pa sbyar ba/ /
Have no doubt that all of these are The deeds of the yogini! The sixty-eighth as well is Attached to the letter b.
sa bon yi ge 'di yi ni/ / 'og gi char ni brtag par bya/ /
Take this seed syllable And set it in the lower portion.

yi ge bdun cu rtsa gcig pa/ / dbyangs yig gnyis par yang dag sbyar/ / yi ge kun la mdzes pa ni/ / 'di nyid yin par the tshom med/ / bdun cu rtsa bzhi pa nyid ni/ / dbyangs yig gnyis par sbyar ba dag / gdod nas grub pa yin par ni/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal nas gsungs/ / yi ge bdun cu lnga pa nyid/ / ma mo drug pa dang ldan pa/ / 'di ni rnal 'byor rab mchog ste/ / bya ba kun la dam pa yin/ / bdun cu rtsa drug pa nyid ni/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang ldan zhing / / nyi ma yis ni dbye bya ste/ / yi ge pa ni der sbyar bya/ / mchog tu mdzes pa gzhan yod min/ /

The seventy-first syllable Is perfectly endowed with the second vowel. Have no doubt that there is beauty In all these letters! Correctly attaching the second vowel to The seventy-fourth itself, it Is primordially accomplished As the Tathagata taught. The seventy-fifth letter is Endowed with the sixth vowel. This, the excellent, supreme yoga Is supreme of all actions. The seventy-sixth is also Endowed with the second vowel, Split by the sun, and Attached to the letter v. There exists no other more supremely beautiful Than this.

yi ge bdun cu rtsa bdun pa/ / der ni d+ha dang sbyar bar bya/ / sa bon 'di ni lha rdzas mchog / mkha' 'gro ma yi mdzes par 'dod/ / bdun cu rtsa brgyad pa nyid ni/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang ldan zhing / / sa bon 'di ni mchog bzang po/ / rgyu yi mchog ni yin par 'dod/ /

Attach the seventy-seventh syllable To DHA. The beautiful dakinis believe This seed [syllable] is the supreme substance. The seventy-eighth is Endowed with the second vowel. This seed [syllable] is the very best And believed to be the supreme cause.

yi ge brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa/ / bzhi pa'i mtha' yi khyad par byed/ / gdod nas grub byed 'di yin te/ / dngos grub kun la 'jug byed pa'o/ / yi ge brgyad cu rtsa gnyis pa/ / dbyangs yig gnyis pa dang sbyar bya/ /
The eighty-first syllable, Distinguished with the [vowel] after the fourth, Is primordially accomplished. The eighty-second syllable Attached to the two vowels[22] Engages all the attainments.

ma mo rnams las lnga pa nyid/ / de bzhin yi ge brgyad cu brgyad/ / ma mo dag las lnga pa nyid/ / yi ge brgyad cu rtsa dgu pa/ / ma mo rnams las lnga pa nyid/ / de bzhin yi ge dgu bcu pa/ / ma mo dag las lnga pa dang / / yi ge dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa/ / ma mo rnams las gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge dgu bcu rtsa drug pa/ / dbyangs dag las ni gnyis pa dang / / yi ge dgu bcu rtsa dgu pa/ / gdug pa rnams ni skrag byed cing / / sngags pa rnams la bde 'byung byed/ / dbyangs rnams kyi ni bcu gsum pa/ / yi ge gnyis par yang dag ldan/ / dbyangs las bcu gsum pa nyid dang / / yi ge lnga par yang dag ldan/ / gdug pa rnams ni zad byed cing / / mkha' 'gro rnams kyi bde 'bab pa'o/ / dbyangs rnams las ni bcu bzhi nyid/ / yi ge brgyad par yang dag ldan/ / bcwa lnga pa yi gdan du byas/ / dbyangs dag las ni bcu bzhi pa/ / yi ge dgu par yang dag ldan/ / spyi bor thig les mtshan pa'o/ / sgrub po mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni/ / khyad par du ni dga' byed pa'o/ / dbyangs rnams las ni bcu gcig pa/ / bcu gnyis pa yis yang dag ldan/ / spyi bor thig les mtshan pa'o/ / 'byung po thams cad skrag byed cing / / sgrub po rnams la phan 'byung ba'o/ / bcu gcig par ni yang dag ldan/ / yi ge bcu gsum pa nyid la/ / thig les rnam par brgyan pa'o/ / 'byung po thams cad skrag byed cing / / sgrub po rnams la phan 'byung ba'o/ / dbyangs rnams las ni lnga pa nyid/ / yi ge sum cu gnyis par ldan/ / dbyangs rnams las ni gsum pa dang / / yi ge sum cu gsum par ldan/ / dbyangs kyi gnyis pa nyid dang ni/ / yi ge sum cu bzhi par ldan/ / dbyangs rnams las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge sum cu drug par ldan/ / thog ma'i gnyis par yang dag ldan/ / yi ge sum cu rtsa bdun pa/ / dbyangs las gsum par yang dag ldan/ / yi ge bzhi bcu pa la'o/ / ma mo'i bcu gcig yang dag ldan/ / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa/ / dbyangs dag las ni gsum pa nyid/ / yi ge bzhi bcu gnyis par ldan/ / dbyangs dag las ni gsum pa nyid/ / yi ge bzhi bcu bzhi par ldan/ / ma mo las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge bzhi bcu brgyad par ldan/ / dbyangs dag las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge bzhi bcu dgu par ldan/ / ma mo las ni lnga pa nyid/ / yi ge lnga bcu gsum par ldan/ / yi ge lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa/ / thig les kyang ni rnam brgyan pa'o/ / yi ge lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa/ / spyi bor thig les mtshan pa la/ / dbyangs kyi gnyis par sbyar ba'o/ / yi ge lnga bcu rtsa bdun pa/ / spyi bor thig les mnan pa'o/ / dbyangs rnams las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge lnga bcu rtsa brgyad pa/ / ma mo las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge drug cu lnga pa la'o/ / ma mo las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge drug cu brgyad par ldan/ / dngos grub thams cad 'gugs byed cing / / sgrub po rnams la dpal sbyin pa'o/ / ma mo las ni bzhi pa nyid/ / yi ge bdun cu gcig par ldan/ / thig les kyang ni rnam par brgyan/ / ma mo las ni bzhi pa nyid/ / yi ge bdun cu gnyis par ldan/ / sems can thams cad dbang byed pa/ / thig le yis ni mnyam par mnan/ / dbyangs kyi bcu bzhi par nges ldan/ / yi ge bdun cu rtsa gsum pa'o/ / ma mo las ni bcu bzhi pa/ / yi ge bdun cu bzhi par ldan/ / de bzhin thig les rnam brgyan pa'o/ / dbyangs rnams las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge bdun cu lnga par ldan/ / ma mo las ni gnyis pa nyid/ / yi ge bdun cu brgyad par ldan/ / steng du thig les mtshan pa'o/ / ma mo las ni bzhi pa dang / / yi ge bdun cu rtsa dgu pa/ / spyi bor thig les mnan pa'o/ / dbyangs rnams las ni drug pa nyid/ / rta yi rgyal po bskyed pa la/ / thig le nA das rnam brgyan pa/ / dbyangs rnams las ni gsum pa nyid/ / yi ge bcu drug ldan pa'o/ / yi ge'i grangs ni brgya yi steng / / dgu bcu dang ni rtsa brgyad do/ /
'di ni re mig las btus pa/ / he ru ka dpal mgon po yi/ / rtsa ba'i sngags mchog tu shes bya/ /
By extracting [these letters] from the diagram Of the protector, glorious Heruka, Understand the supreme root mantra.
dngos grub kun gyi gnas yin zhing / / mkha' 'gro'i snying ni 'joms pa yin/ / dpal ldan khrag 'thung lha rig rgyal/ / bklags pas grub pa don yod pa/ /
It is the abode of all attainments And destroys the hearts of the dakinis. By reciting the [mantra] of the glorious Drinker of Blood, The King of Wisdom Deities, [you] will accomplish your aims.
yi ge oM ni dang po ste/ / hU~M hU~M phaT ni mtha' mar sbyar/ / rtsa ba'i sngags te sngags 'di ni/ / sgrub pa thams cad grub byed yin/ /
Attaching the syllable OM at the beginning And HUM HUM PHAT at the end, This mantra is the root mantra That bestows all attainments.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las sngags btu ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste bdun pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE CONDENSED RITUALS OF THE ROOT MANTRA” IS THE SEVENTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 8. The Essence of the Reversed Armor and the Ritual of the Condensed Mantra of the Six Dakinis

f.d: 8. The Essence of the Reversed Armor and the Ritual of the Condensed Mantra of the Six Dakinis
de nas rang gi bdag nyid kyi/ / dpa' bo thams cad mnyam sbyor ba/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba yi/ / 'khor lo bde mchog yin par 'dod/ /
Next, the nature of oneself Is unified with all heroes: Heruka Chakrasamvara is asserted To be the net [binding] the dakinis.
hA swA raMb saM la dzA nIkiDA phaT hU~M hU~M kaM ru ru he he badzra shrI oM/ /
HA SÖ RAM BA SHAM LA DZA NI KI DA PHAT HUM HUM KAM RU RU HE HE VAJRA SHRI OM
rig pa'i rgyal po'i snying po ni/ / ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro/ /
This is the essence of the King of Knowledge That has not arisen nor will arise.
Tapha hU~M heM hrIM haM o~M/ /
PHAT HUM HUM HA HA HRIH OM
yi ge pa~M dang ya~M dang ni/ / yi ge ma~M dang hrIM nyid dang / / hU~M dang phaT ces bshad pa ni/ / rnal 'byor ma ni drug tu bshad/ /
The syllables BAM and OM, The syllables MOM and HRIM, And HUM and PHAT, are enumerated. These are explained as the six yoginis.[23]
o~M badzra bai ro tsa nI ye hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/
OM VAJRA BEROTZANIYE SÖHA[24]
mkha' 'gro ma yi rig pa che/ / ma byung 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro/ /
The great knowledge of the dakinis Has not arisen nor will arise.
sa stengs na ni rin chen bzhi/ / phreng ba'i sngags ni dam pa yin/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi rig pa che/ / rig pa'i rgyal po he ru ka /
On this earth there are the four precious [mantras]. This is the sacred mantra rosary. The great knowledge of the dakinis is Heruka, the King of Knowledge.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las go bzlog pa'i snying po dang rnal 'byor ma drug gi sngags btu ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE ESSENCE OF THE REVERSED ARMOR AND THE RITUAL OF THE CONDENSED MANTRA OF THE SIX DAKINIS” IS THE EIGHTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 9. The Ritual Actions of the Root Mantra

f.d: 9. The Ritual Actions of the Root Mantra

de nas rtsa ba'i gsang sngags kyi/ / las mchog go rims ji bzhin du/ / de ni rnam par bshad par bya/ / 'jig rten gsum gang ci yod rnams/ / thams cad skad cig gis 'grub par/ / las rnams thams cad byed pa'o/ /
NEXT, THE STAGES of the supreme actions of the root secret mantra are explained. Whatever exists in the three worlds is accomplished in an instant and all actions are performed.

lha thams cad dang klu thams cad dang gnod sbyin thams cad dang dri za thams cad kyi skye gnas thams cad dran pa tsam gyis gsod par byed do/ / sprin thams cad 'thor ba dang char 'bebs par byed pa dang zlog par byed pa'o/ / rgya mtsho skems par byed do/ / chu bo rgyun phyogs las bzlog ste 'bab par ston no/ / dbang po zlog par byed do/ / gsang sngags 'di bzlas brjod 'bum byas pas sa g.yo bar byed pa dang shing la 'dzegs te gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar byed do/ / sngags thams cad 'phrog par byed pa dang / dngos grub thams cad 'phrog par byed do/ / khrag 'dren par byed pa dang slar yang gtong bar byed do/ / gzugs brgya stong phrag du mar byed do/ / 'dod na snang bar byed cing 'dod na mi snang bar byed do/ / khang bzangs dang shing gi rtse mo la sogs pa phye mar byed do/ / dug bdud rtsir byed pa dang bdud rtsi yang dug tu byed do/ / zla ba chur byed pa dang chu zla bar byed do/ / dri thams cad 'phrog par byed do/ / gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar byed do/ / nam mkha' lding gi gdong dang / 'gro ba 'byin par byas pa zhi ba 'dus pa'i lha mo dang gang zhig kun tu spyod pa'i mi'i mchog de'i lag mthil na yod pa'i dpal gang gis kyang mi 'phrog par 'gyur ro/ / rnam pa de lta bu'i cho ga dang ldan pa'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu thams cad skal bar 'gyur ro/ /

All the gods and all the nagas and all the givers of harm (yakshas) and smell-eaters (gandharvas), in all of the places where they live, by merely remembering it [the root mantra] once, will be killed. All the clouds will disperse, the rain will descend and reverse, and the oceans will dry up. The rivers will change direction and then descend. It can impede Indra. By reciting this secret mantra one hundred thousand times, the earth quakes, you can climb trees, and wherever you wish to go you can go. It captures all mantras and all realizations. It causes blood to flow out and then flow back in again. You can transform into a hundred thousand forms. If you wish you can appear and if you wish you can disappear. The mansion, treetops, and so forth are transformed to dust. You can make poison into nectar and nectar into poison. You can make the moon into water and make the water into the moon. You can capture all scents. You can travel anywhere you desire, like a garuda. Collecting all peaceful goddesses for the supreme person who is engaged in all actions, the power that exists in the palm of your hand cannot be stolen by anyone. Possessing such a ritual will accomplish the fruits of all attainments.

dran pa tsam gyis gsod par byed pa dang me skyed par byed do/ / sa 'og rnam par gshegs par byed pa dang / ser ba 'bebs pa dang yang zlog par byed de/ dran pa tsam gyis glog skyed par byed do/ / lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gar byed du 'jug go/ / gang gis grub pa'i phyir ming nas bzung ste lan cig bzlas na de'i mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro/ / sa ma lus pa rnams la longs spyod par 'gyur ro/ / 'dod na sdud par 'gyur ro/ / bcom ldan 'das 'di la ni brtul zhugs mi dgos/ spyod pa dang smyung ba mi dgos te/ rtog pa'i bya ba cho ga 'dis ci 'dod pa'i las rnams bya'o/ / gal te khros pas lan cig bzlas na bye ba gsod par 'gyur ro/ / zhi bas bzlas na 'tsho bar byed do/ / dur khrod kyi sol ba la lan cig bzlas pas gang la bsnun pa de'i mod la ltung bar byed do/ / thal ba la yongs su bzlas te gang la bsnun na de'i mod la sha zas gzung bar 'gyur ro/ / dur khrod kyi sol ba la lan cig bzlas nas spang leb la sogs pa la mtshan ma gang gi ming bris pa de gdon chen pos bzung bar 'gyur ro/ / a ti muk+ta'i lcug ma la lan cig bzlas nas gang la bsnun pa de de'i mod la rlung gi shugs kyis 'ong bar 'gyur ro/ / gseg ma la lan cig bzlas te gang la brdegs pa de rengs par 'gyur ro/ / gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar 'gyur ro/ / gu gul gyi bdug pa la lan cig bzlas te spos su sbyar na sems can thams cad 'bebs par 'gyur ro/ / lag pa la lan cig bzlas te bkab na nag pos zin pa'i dug sos par byed do/ / mkha' 'gro mas rgyas btab pa la lan cig bzlas pa'i chus de gtong bar byed do/ / ka ra bI ra'i lcug ma la lan cig bzlas pas mngal gang du 'dod pa der 'pho bar 'gyur ro/ /

By merely remembering you can kill or generate fire. You can go beneath the ground and cause hail to fall or drive it away. By merely remembering this mantra, lightning will strike and cause the reflections of all deities to dance. If you recite this mantra once while holding the name of someone, in an instant he will die. You will come to enjoy all the spiritual grounds you desire and assemble all wishes. With this Bhagavan [Heruka] you do not need to observe a special way of acting and you don’t need to fast. Through this ritual of reflection, engage in whatever actions you desire. If it is recited wrathfully once, ten million will be killed. If you recite it peacefully it will [give] life. By reciting it once in the burning charnel grounds, if one strikes someone they will instantly fall. Recite it completely in the ashes [of the charnel grounds]; whomever one strikes, in that instant the flesheaters (pishachas) will seize them. Write a person’s full name on a plank and so forth at night, and if you recite it once in the burning charnel grounds, they will be seized by a planetary spirit.[25] By reciting once on the twig of a poplar tree, whomever one strikes [with it], by the power of the wind they will come. Having recited it once on a pebble, whoever touches it will become stiff with fright and go wherever you wish. Burn gugul incense[26] and recite [the mantra] once and then if you [burn] the incense the [spirits] will possess all sentient beings. Recite it once on your hand, and then if you place that hand on someone who was bitten by a black poisonous snake, that person will be healed. By reciting the dakinis’ seal once on water, that water can destroy whatever you place it upon. By reciting it once on a twig of the karavira tree you can transfer to the womb of whomever you wish.

he ru ka dpal ye shes ni/ / mi shes dngos grub mngon 'dod pa/ / de ni phub ma brdung ba ste/ / gsang sngags 'di ni med pa ru/ / dngos grub dang ni bde ba dag / mi yis thob par mi 'gyur ro/ / gsang sngags 'di ni mi shes par/ / rnal 'byor pa ni mngon 'dod pa/ / de yi ngal ba don med de/ / 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur ro/ / gsang sngags 'di ni 'dod spyod pa'i/ / dngos grub thams cad sbyin byed yin/ / sgrub po sngags dang phyag rgya dag / bder gshegs gsungs pa 'di shes pa/ / bza' btung la sogs tsa ru yi/ / bza' dang btung ba'i ro sogs pa/ / dngos grub thams cad sgrub byed yin/ /

This is the secret mantra of the glorious Drinker of Blood. If one does not know this [practice] yet sincerely desires the attainments, that one will get only the chaff; if one does not possess this secret mantra one will obtain neither attainments nor bliss. For one who does not know this secret mantra yet sincerely wishes to be a yogi, hard work is useless and [he] will not obtain the results. This secret mantra bestows all the attainments for one who enjoys desire; the practitioner of the mantra and mudra is knowledgeable of this teaching of the Sugata: that food, drink, and the other offerings, and the tastes of food, drink, and so forth, will be obtained. By this excellent offering you will receive all the attainments.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las rtsa ba'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste dgu pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL ACTIONS OF THE ROOT MANTRA” IS THE NINTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 10. Accomplishing the Three Bodies and the Ritual of the Essence Mantra

f.d: 10. Accomplishing the Three Bodies and the Ritual of the Essence Mantra
de nas sku gsum bshad par bya/ / khrag 'thung dpal gnyis med sbyor bas/ / gang gis shes pa tsam gyis ni/ / 'dir ni grub par the tshom med/ / sku gsum po ni bshad par bya/ /
And then, the explanation of the three bodies Through the nondual union with the Drinker of Blood, By merely knowing which There will be attainments; Of this you should have no doubt.
chos kyi sku yi lus can du/ / gang tshe sgrub pa po 'gyur ba/ / de ltar legs sems gyur pa la/ / de tshe ye shes nga smra'o/ /
When one becomes a practitioner Endowed with the body of the dharmakaya, Thus perfectly transforming the mind, At such a time I proclaim exalted wisdom.
longs spyod rdzogs pa'i lus can du/ / gang tshe sgrub pa po 'gyur ba/ / de nas mnyam par bzhag pa la/ / longs spyod rdzogs par nga rab smra/ /
When one becomes a practitioner Endowed with the body of the sambogakaya And in meditative equipoise, At such a time I proclaim complete enjoyment.
sprul pa'i sku yi lus can du/ / gang tshe sgrub pa po 'gyur ba/ / de tshe sems de rtse gcig la/ / sprul pa'i skur yang nga smra ste/ /
When one becomes a practitioner Endowed with the body of the nirmanakaya And the mind single-pointed, At such a time I proclaim the emanation body.
ye shes longs spyod rdzogs dang sprul/ / yang dag 'thob par gdon mi za/ / bdag nyid shrI he ru kar ni/ / 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med/ /
Without a doubt you will perfectly obtain The exalted wisdom, complete enjoyment, and emanation [bodies]. Have no doubt that you will Receive this attainment of Shri Heruka.
gsang sngags 'di yi snying po ni/ / gsang ba bshad kyis sgrub po nyon/ /
This is the essence of secret mantra. The practitioner should listen to the explanation of these secrets:

snying po bzlas pas dpag tshad bye ba 'phags par 'gyur zhing 'gro ba dang 'ong bar 'gyur ro/ / gzugs stong phrag du mar byed do/ / khang bzangs dang shing dang khyim la 'dzegs te mkha' 'gro ma rnams dang lhan cig dpag tshad bye ba'i bar du 'gro bar 'gyur ro/ / nam mkha' la 'gro zhing 'ong ba las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro/ / 'dod na snang bar 'gyur zhing 'dod na mi snang bar 'gyur ro/ / 'dod na byis pa dang / rgan po dang / dar la bab pa'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ /

Through reciting the essence [mantra], you can come and go ten million miles and become a superior being. You can transform into many thousands of forms, or ascend to the top of a mansion, tree, or house and [travel] together with the yoginis many thousands of miles away, coming and going in no other way than through the sky. If you wish you will quickly appear and if you wish you will disappear. If you wish to become young, middle aged, or old, you will obtain such forms.

'dod na glang po che dang / ma he dang / ba men dang / stag dang / seng ge dang /khyu mchog dang / byi la dang / ri bong dang / rnga mo'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod na rma bya dang / khyim bya dang / ngang pa dang / ngur pa dang / chu skyar dang / 'ug pa dang / khra dang / bya rgod dang / bya rog gi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ / gang 'dod pa de'i gzugs su byed do/ / tshig 'phrog pa dang / nyan pa 'phrog pa dang / sna 'phrog pa dang / lce 'phrog par byed do/ / gang gi 'dod pa de'i khrag 'dren par byed pa'am/ rengs par byed do/ /

If you wish to become an elephant, water buffalo, wild ox, tiger, lion, bull, cat, rabbit, or camel, you will obtain such forms. If you wish to become a peacock, cock, goose, red wild duck, water fowl, owl, hawk, vulture, or crow, you will obtain such forms. Whatever you wish to become, you will obtain such forms. You can capture words, capture sights, capture sounds, capture scents, and capture tastes. According to your desires you can drain someone’s blood or make them stiff.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las sku gsum grub pa'i snying po'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “ACCOMPLISHING THE THREE BODIES AND THE RITUAL OF THE ESSENCE MANTRA” IS THE TENTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 11. The Ritual of the Characteristics of the Seven-Birthed One

f.d: 11. The Ritual of the Characteristics of the Seven-Birthed One
de nas gzhan yang sgrub pa pos/ / skye ba bdun pa'i bar 'byung ba/ / gang gis bsten pa tsam gyis ni/ / myur du dngos grub la 'jug pa'o/ / dngos grub thob 'gyur bshad par bya/ /

Furthermore, these things will occur: By merely relying [on this practice] The practitioner will be born seven times [as a human]. And it is taught that you will quickly induce the attainments And accomplish all realizations.

skyes bu gang zhig rdul dri zhim par gyur pa dang / bden par smra ba dang / yun ring por mig mi 'dzums pa dang / khro ba med par 'gyur ba dang /kha nas dbugs dri zhim par 'byung ba de ni skye ba bdun du mi'i skye bar gyur pa yin no/ / grib ma bdun pa bya ngang pa'i 'gros can snying rje dang yang dag par ldan pa de bsten na de'i snying ga na ro tsa na yod de/ de blangs la dpal he ru ka'i snying po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas thig le byas na steng du lding bar 'gyur zhing dpag tshad bye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro/ / de bsten pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gsum gyi ye shes can du 'gyur ro/ / dpag tshad bye ba lnga bcur nyin zhag gcig gis 'gro zhing 'ong bar 'gyur ro/ / lha'i lus kyang thob par 'gyur ro/ / dpal he ru ka'i snying po gang zhig shes pa de gang dang gang 'dod pa de dang de ster bar 'gyur ro/ /

The person from whom a sweet scent of perspiration arises, who speaks the truth and has not closed his eyes for a long time, who does not become angry, and whose breath is very delicious, is a person who has taken a human rebirth seven times. His manner of walking is without the seven defilements and he is endowed with flawless compassion. In dependence upon such a person, extracting his heart and reciting the essence mantra of glorious Heruka one hundred and eight times and forming a drop, you will fly, traveling ten million miles. By merely relying on that you will quickly come to possess the exalted wisdom of the three worlds. You will travel back and forth five million miles in one day and one night. You will attain the body of the deity, what is known to be the essence of Heruka. Whatever one desires will be bestowed.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THE SEVEN-BIRTHED ONE” IS THE ELEVENTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 12. The Ritual of the Close Essence Mantra

f.d: 12. The Ritual of the Close Essence Mantra
de nas nye ba'i snying po ni/ / dngos grub thams cad 'jug byed cing / / 'jig rten gsum 'gyur gang cung zad/ / de kun skad cig gis 'grub bshad/ /
Next, the close essence [mantra]: It is taught that all the attainments will be obtained and Everything in all the three worlds Will be accomplished in an instant.
Tapha hU~M hu~M ha ha hrIHoM/ /
PHAT HUM HUM HA HA HRIH OM

'di ni snying po'i nye ba'i snying po'o/ / gsang sngags 'di 'bum bzlas pas 'jig rten gsum yang g.yo bar byed do/ / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / klu dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci rnams 'gugs par byed do/ / rgya mtsho dang / 'bab chu dang / mtshe'u la sogs pa skems pa'am/ gnon par byed do/ / gang du bzlas pa'i gnas der mkha' 'gro ma thams cad sgrub pa po'i mngag gzhug byed par 'gyur ro/ / 'dis chu la yongs su bzlas te bdag nyid kyi mig bkrus na skye ba bdun pa'i mi shes par 'gyur ro/ / tshe zad pa yang 'chi ba bzhin du snang ba dang / tshe ring ba gson par snang bar 'gyur ro/ / mig la mngon par bsngags nas gang la bltas pa de gnon par 'gyur ro/ / dpa' bo shi ba'i rkang mthil gyi pags pa blangs te/ mi'i khrag dang btags te rna ba'i mig sman dang thod par bcug la ldong ros dang / gi'u wang dang / gur gum dang khrag dang bsnos te grib ma la bskams la lcags gsum gyis dkris pa bya ste/ yang de lhag par gnas pa skar ma rgyal la bya ba yang dpal he ru ka'i zhal du bcug la lag pa g.yon pas kha bkab ste/ yang brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na de de'i mod la mi snang bar 'gyur zhing grib ma med par 'gyur te/ lha rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur na/ sa steng gi mi rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos/ de bzhin du kha las bton na ni snang bar 'gyur ro/ / rgyud 'dir mkha' spyod grub pa'i ril bu 'di ni dpa' bo rang nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no/ /

This is the heart of the close essence [mantra]. If you recite this mantra one hundred thousand times, the earth will quake in all three worlds. Gods and demigods, givers of harm, cannibals (rakshasas), nagas, smell-eaters, centaurs (kimnaras), or anything else will be summoned. Oceans, waterfalls, ponds, and so forth can be dried up or taken under control. All the dakinis will serve the practitioner in the place where you recite [this mantra]. By reciting the mantra in that manner, if you wash your own eyes you will gain knowledge of those born as a human seven times; those whose life is exhausted will appear as if dead, and those with a long life will appear with vitality. By reciting the mantra on the eyes, whomever one sees will be suppressed. Take the skin off the soles of the feet of a dead hero and place human blood, ground-up ear, and eye medicine together in a skullcup. Mix antimony, giwang,[27] saffron, and blood together and dry it in the shade wrapped in the three metals to keep it nicely. Prepare it during the month of Gyalda.[28] Put it in the mouth of [yourself as] glorious Heruka and cover your mouth with your left hand. Then, if you recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times in the following moment, you will become invisible and your shadow will disappear and not even the gods will be able to see you. What need is there to mention, then, that people on earth will be unable to see you? Remove it again from your mouth and you will become visible. In this tantra this is the pill attainment of “enjoying the sky” that was taught by the hero himself.

dpal he ru ka'i snying po'i nye ba'i snying po'i sngags 'dis 'dzub mo'i rtses mgo'i thod pa'i sha med par byas la mnyes na de'i khrag 'dren par byed do/ / g.yon pas yang dang yang du mnyes pas ni 'jug par 'gyur ro/ / mngon par bzlas te mgo'i thod par khu tshur bsnun na gang gi ming nas smos te byas pa de'i klad pa 'gas par 'gyur ro/ / gsang sngags rjes su dran la thod pa 'o mas bkang na nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro/ / gi'u wang la bzlas te thig le byas na gang la bltas pa de rgyas btab par 'gyur ro/ / mdzub mo la yongs su bzlas te gang la sdigs mdzub byas pa de de'i mod la ltung bar 'gyur ro/ / sngags bzlas nas rkang pa sa la bsnun na gang gi ming nas smos pa de de'i mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro/ / chu la bzlas te sa la gtor na slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro/ / gsang sngags bzlas pa'i mdzub mo'i rtse mos stong la yang sdigs mdzub byas na bltas pa de thams cad gnon par 'gyur ro/ / tshig gis ni grol bar 'gyur ro/ /

With these mantras — the essence and close essence mantras of glorious Heruka — if you rub the tip of your finger on a fleshless skull, blood will be drawn forth. Rub the skull with the left [finger] again and again, and the blood will reenter. If you press on the skull while reciting clearly, whoever’s name you say, the brain of that person will become ill. With subsequent mindfulness of the secret mantra, fill the skullcup with milk and that one will [again] become well. If you recite [the mantra] over giwang medicine and form a drop, whoever sees that drop will be bound. By reciting [the mantra] over the finger, anyone to whom a threatening mudra is then shown will quickly fall down. When reciting the mantra, press your feet on the ground while saying [their] name and they will die. Recite it in water, then throw the water on the ground and that one will come back to life. Recite this mantra a thousand times or more with fingers pointed, and if accompanied by a threatening mudra, everything you see will quickly be subjugated and, with a word, will again be released.

sme sha can gyi thal ba la bzlas brjod brgya byas te sems can gang rjes su dran pa de la bsnun pa de'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ / sbyin sreg gi me'i thal ba la bzlas brjod brgya byas te gang la bsnun pa de lha nyid kyis kyang mi mthong ngo / / chu la brgya bzlas pas gtor na slar snang bar 'gyur ro/ / thod pa'i phyag rgya kha sbyar bcings la dbugs mi 'byin par gang gi ming nas bzlas pa de smyo bar 'gyur ro/ / skye bo stong yang smyo bar 'gyur ro/ / yid kyis grol bar 'gyur ro/ / gang gi ming nas smos te gtsug pud la lan bcu bzlas te mdud na mkha' 'gro ma thams cad 'gro bar 'gyur ro/ / khang stong du song ste lan brgya bzlas nas spyi bor bcings la mig bgrad de ji srid du bzlas pa de srid du mi snang bar 'gyur ro/ / bkrol na snang bar 'gyur ro/ / gseg ma la mngon par bzlas te/ steng dang 'og dang phyogs mtshams rnams su gtor na lha dang lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po thams cad kyang 'ching bar 'gyur ro/ / mkha' 'gro ma'i sbyor ba thams cad kyang 'phrog par 'gyur ro/ / stan dang mal khri la skyes pa dang / bud med 'du ba la bltas te sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na 'byar bar 'gyur ro/ / yid kyis ni grol bar 'gyur ro/ / gyo mog dang bcas pa la yongs su bzlas te chu bor bcug na rgyun phyogs las bzlog ste 'bab par 'gyur ro/ / gyo mog dang bcas pa de nyid kyis rba rlabs gnon par 'gyur ro/ / yid kyis ni bzlog par 'gyur ro/ / sngags bzlas te steng du blta bzhin du stong bzlas na char chen po gcod par 'gyur ro/ / gzhan gyi dpung mngon du phyogs na bzlas brjod stong byas te g.yul du zhugs pa na mtshon cha brgyas bsnun kyang gnod pa'i tshor ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing mtshon gyis kyang chod par mi 'gyur ro/ / rdo rje'i lus can du 'gyur ro/ /

Reciting these one hundred times in the ashes of a butcher, afterward whichever form one thinks of, by striking a sentient being they will quickly take on that form. Reciting these one hundred times in the ashes of a burned offering, even the gods themselves cannot see whom you strike. If you recite [this mantra] one hundred times in water and then toss it [on him] he will again become visible. Sealing and binding a skullcup shut, without breathing, recite their name and they will quickly become insane and a thousand other beings will become insane as well. You can mentally release them by reciting their name. Taking the hair from the crown of your head, recite ten times and tie it in a knot, and all the dakinis will come. Going to an empty house, recite one hundred times and bind your hair to the top of your head. Open your eyes and as long as you recite the [mantra], you will remain invisible. If you untie your hair, [you] will reappear. Recite [the mantra] perfectly in a skullcup and then if you throw it above, below, or in the cardinal and intermediate directions, gods, demigods, yakshas, cannibals, and smell-eaters, as well as centaurs and serpent spirits (mahoragas), will all be bound. You can steal all the dakinis’ yogas. By seeing a woman and man in bed, if you recite the mantra they will be [forever] joined and united. If you recite the mantra one hundred and eight times you will quickly be able to release them and they will be liberated by your mind. If you recite [the mantra] together with gravel in a skullcup and then enter a river, [it will] cause it to flow upstream and then descend. The skullcup will quickly suppress the waves, which will be overcome by the mind. Recite the mantra and look upward in accordance with the view of emptiness and a great rain will quickly stop. With a host of others coming from all directions recite [the mantra] one thousand times and when battle is engaged if they strike you with weapons, not only will you not be injured but the weapons will not cut [you] and you will [come to] possess the vajra body.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF THE CLOSE ESSENCE MANTRA” IS THE TWELFTH CHAPTER.
