f.d: 33. The Ritual of the Secret Offering and Offering Respect

de nas sgrub po'i mchog kun ni/ / sbyor ba kun la med pa'o/ / bza' dang bca' dang nya sha sogs/ / nus pa ji bzhin bya ba ste/ / med par gyur kyang bza' ba ni/ / lnga po nyid du bya ba yin/ / bza' dang bca' ba rgya che ba/ / rtag tu mtshan mo nyid du bya/ / de nas pho nya rab sbyin zhing / / khyad par du ni sgrub pa po/ / rang gi pang du mgo bzhag la/ / dpa' bo gnyis med rab tu mchod/ / ma 'am yang na sring mo 'am/ / bu mo'am yang na chung ma gnyen/ / rnam pa 'di lta'i cho ga yis/ / bcings pa las ni rab grol bya/ / de nas sngags 'di 'grub 'gyur te/ / ji srid 'byung ba yod par du'o/ / slob dpon lus su legs gnas te/ / sgrub pa po las mchod pa len/ / dpa' bo rnams kyi stan dag dang / / phyag rgya nyid du the tshom med/ / sgrub po shin tu mnyam bzhag pas/ / glu dang gar la sogs pa bya/ / ji srid lus can thams cad kyang / / rnal 'byor ye shes zhen ma gyur/ / de srid 'khor 'gyur zhing / / sdug bsngal mya ngan gyis g.yengs 'gyur/ / dngos po kun gyis sgrub pa pos/ / de nas phyag rgya mchod par bya/ / mchod pas mchod par 'dod pa ste/ / brnyas pa yis ni nges par sreg / rnal 'byor rgyud du mi rnams kyi/ / phyag rgya chen po dang po 'grub/ / rab tu 'bad pas mchod par bya/ / phyi nas dpa' bo rnams kyis ni/ / dpa' bo nyid la spyad par bya/ / de ltar mchod byas de nas ni/ / sa 'og sgrub po langs pa dang / / zhi ba nyid dang rgyas pa dang / / dbang dang dgug pa dag dang ni/ / gsad dang bskrad pa la sogs dang / / rmugs dang rengs pa de bzhin te/ / dbye ba nyid dang tshar gcod dang / / las kyi dngos grub mchod par bya/ / gang ci'ang rung ba'i las gyur la/ / nyon mi mongs par 'grub 'gyur te/ / the tshom med par sgrub pa po'i/ / dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur/ /

Next, not all the supreme practitioners Are [realized] in all yogas And are able to consume to the extent of their abilities, Food, drink, fish, meat, and so forth. Even if you don’t have these you should regard them As the five [nectars][65] and eat them. Extensively partake of food and drink And always perform at night, After which the messenger should be bestowed. In particular the practitioner should Place his head in her lap and make perfect Offerings to her as the nondual hero. Embrace with mothers as well as sisters or Daughters or one’s wife. Undertaking this according to the ritual, One will be liberated from bondage. After that, one will accomplish the mantra As long as it arises. Abiding perfectly in the body of the master, I, the hero, will accept the offerings From the practitioner. Have no doubts that the abode of The heroes are the mudras themselves. The practitioner with good concentration Should sing, dance, and so forth. As long as all living beings do not Cherish the wisdom of yoga, Living beings will continue to circle in samsara and Suffering and misery will continue to flow. The practitioner should offer All of his belongings to the mudra. By offering that which one covets, Or [doing so] with contempt, one will definitely be burned. The persons of yoga tantra should Make offerings with perfect effort. The yogi offers all things to The primordially accomplished Mahamudra. Later the heroes should Practice heroism itself. Thus having made offerings, The practitioner [will be able] To go underground and Resurrect [the dead]. He [will attain] peace and increase, Power and summoning, Killing, separating, and so forth. Making beings dull and rigid And other such things such as Dividing and annihilating. Having offered the attainment of actions, Whatever actions are appropriate Will be accomplished without trouble. Have no doubt that the practitioner Will attain all these realizations.

Next, the extensive ritual called The “wheel of the net of the dakinis.” Have no doubt that whatever actions are Undertaken by the practitioner are quickly [accomplished]. All the heroes and yoginis Must abide in the centers of the lotuses, Entering between the eyebrows And thus abiding in the central channel. [Offer] food and burned offerings To the parched mouth of the hero Earnestly with the five burned offerings Of meat and blood. And then ignite the fire, Offer the nine fire sacrifices, And place them in a blazing ocean. The wheel should face all directions, Likewise the four faces of the powerful hero and The abode of the hero. On the petals are four female messengers, The nondual bliss of all heroes. Through such a ritual Bestow Khandaroha outside, Abiding in their own forms And viewed as being in the centers of the mandalas, Clarified in these mandalas. You should follow these stages correctly. Thus in the Ocean of Knowledge [This was] briefly taught by the hero. Oneself is unified with the nondual messengers. Have no doubt you will accomplish this.

d.crumb: 35. The Ritual of the Actions of Nonduality and Cheating Untimely Death

f.d: 35. The Ritual of the Actions of Nonduality and Cheating Untimely Death

de nas las kyi rab mchog ni/ / ji bzhin rim gyis mtshon pa ste/ / mchod pa gnyis med sbyor ba'i bdag / las ni so sor sbyar bar bya/ / gang dag rab grub byed pa'i sngags/ / de yi dbye ba rim bzhin bshad/ / kha dog pho nya sogs sngags gang / / mda' yi shugs kyis yongs su 'khor/ / phan tshun mdud rgyud dpa' bo ni/ / yul nyid kyis ni phye ba'o/ / sa bon phreng bas de nas gzung / hU~M ni mtha' ru gnas pa yin/ / bsgrub bya 'gog par gyur pa ni/ / gom pa gcig kyang mi 'gro'o/ / kha sbyar sbyar bar gyur pa dang / / rdo rje lu gu rgyud bcings pas/ / rdo rje dbye ba nyid dang ni/ / de bzhin bung ba ltar 'khor bya/ / lcags kyu nyid kyis dgug pa dang / / gtun shing gis bskyod de bzhin te/ / rdo rje nyid kyis 'debs par bshad/ / dbug la mdas ni sbyar bya ste/ / dus min 'chi ba blu ba la/ / yan lag kha T+wAM ga dang sbyar/ / thod pa'i mchod yon snod du ni/ / zhal du mtshon cha nges par sbyar/ /

Next, the supreme and excellent actions That symbolize the appropriate stages, The offerings with the nature of the nondual union, Applied to the individual actions are The perfect accomplishing actions of the mantra. Their divisions will be explained sequentially. The mantra of the messengers, their colors, and so forth Turn with the force of an arrow, Back and forth by the bow of secret mantra. The distinction is made according to their placement, Holding a rosary of seeds with HUM attached at the end. Snatching the object of accomplishment, He will never go further than one step. Facing each other in union, Bind them with the vajra chain. Separate them with the vajra, Likewise turn them like a bee. Summon them with a hook, Churn them in the manner of a pestle. It is said they are struck by a vajra. Attaching the arrow to the breath[66] [You will be] victorious in cheating untimely death. Attaching the khatvanga staff to the limbs, The skullcup offering vessel Is the weapon definitely attached to the face.

f.d: 36. The Offering of Suchness and the Ritual of Action

de nas phyag rgya'i mchod chen dang / / sngags kyi dgod pa rab tu grags/ / myur du dngos grub byed par ni/ / phyag rgya'i mchod 'di the tshom med/ / mtshan ma gnyis la sngags sbyar te/ / mkha' 'gro dpa' bo gnyis med pa/ / snying po rnams kyis de bzhin du/ / sngags pas mkha' 'gro ma la sbyar/ / blo ldan mkha' 'gro ma bsrub bya/ / dag pa'i lus ni rang 'dod pa/ / dpa' bo mchod pa rnams byas nas/ / las ni 'bad pa nyid kyis bya/ / rnam dbye rang dgas sngags pa ni/ / phyin ci log tu nges par sbyar/ / tshar gcod phan 'dogs don rnams la/ / las kyi dngos por rnam par sgom/ / de nyid dbye bar phye nas ni/ / rtsa yi lam du sbyar bar bya/ / rab tu sgrub pa'i sbyor don la/ / phyi rol ji bzhin nang de bzhin/ / 'di yis myur du lha dang ni/ / lha min mir bcas bsgrub par bya/ /

And then the great offering of the mudra, Famed as the arrangement of the mantra,[67] Quickly performing the attainments, Have no doubt about this offering of the mudra. Attach the mantra to the two signs [male and female], The hero and dakini are nondual. The essence [mantra] should be done likewise And thus conjoin the dakini with the mantrika. Churning the devout dakini, The ritual of eating subdues the mudra. With the power of the action and weapon and Likewise with the essence [mantra] One should likewise unite with the dakini.[68] Her pure body is one’s own desire. By making offerings to the hero You should make effort in this action. The mantrika investigates with delight And should definitely employ the reversal. For the purpose of annihilating and benefiting, Meditate on the entity of actions. By making the classifications of suchness, Unify the path of the channels and Perfectly accomplish the meaning of union. Just as it is outside, it should be inside as well. By this you will quickly accomplish Gods and demigods, together with humans.

f.d: 37. The Ritual of Oneself Attaining Inner Power

de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba/ / gzugs ni gnon pa'i cho ga ste/ / phan tshun sbyar ba'i gsang sngags ni/ / mkha' 'gro ma dang gcig tu sbyar/ / bza' ba zos mid de nas ni/ / bzlas pa'i mthar ni skyug par bya/ / mtshan mo bdun ni rdzogs pa dang / / bza' dang btung ba dag la sbyar/ / 'di yis ji srid 'tsho yi bar/ / dbang du 'gro bar the tshom med/ / ser skya'i mar ni 'thungs nas su/ / bzlas pa'i mthar ni skyug par bya/ / de yis rang gi gdong bskus na/ / gal te rtag tu khros gyur pa/ / mthong ba tsam gyis dbang du 'gyur/ / til mar sA lu btags pa dang / / ldan pas lus ni bskus gyur cing / / snum khur sngags pas byas nas ni/ / bza' ba la ni rab tu sbyar/ / gal te las 'di ma btang na/ / ji srid 'tsho bar rtag dbang 'gyur/ / til nag dag ni zos nas su/ / ske tsher bcas pa skyugs pa dang / / ru rta bshang ba dang ldan pa/ / las skyes lto ba'i srin bu ni/ / rang gi khrag dang btags nas ni/ / rang gi khu ba nyid dang sbyar/ / bza' btung mig sman gos la ni/ / byug pa nyid du rab tu sbyar/ / 'di yis ji srid 'tsho yi bar/ / dbang du 'gyur bar gdon mi za/ / ba lang sha sreg sbyin sreg ni/ / khrag gis bskus na lha rnams ni/ / de mod dbang du 'gyur ba'am/ / gal te ma 'ongs 'chi bar 'gyur/ / bdag nyid de yi mdun du ni/ / bsgoms nas mkhas pas sbyin sreg bya/ / sbyin sreg mthar ni gtor ma bya/ / khams gsum skad cig gis 'gugs pa/ / mtshan bdun gyis ni 'grub par 'gyur/ / 'jig rten gsum na rnyed dka' ba'i/ / dam tshig spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni/ / rtag tu rang sngags sbas pa yis/ / rab tu 'bad de gsang bar bya/ / sbas don rnyed par mi 'gyur zhing / / skal ba dman pas 'grub mi 'gyur/ / bsod nams chung ba'i sgrub pos kyang / / nga mnyes byas pas rnyed par 'gyur/ /

And then a further explanation of The ritual of overpowering [others’] bodies. The mutual embrace of the secret mantra Is applied to the dakinis in the same way. Whatever food you eat Should be vomited at the end of recitation and Completed in seven nights; Apply this to food and drink. Through this, for as long as one lives Have no doubt you will [bring others] under your control. Drink light yellow butter and Vomit it at the end of recitation. If you then apply this to your face, If you become angry with someone, By merely looking at them you will gain control. Crushing sesame oil and wild rice and Anointing the body with them, If the mantrika then carries this oil This is the excellent way to prepare your food. If you don’t abandon this action, For as long as you live you will always have control. Through [those beings] eating These pure black sesame seeds Anointed with black mustard seeds, Together the medicinal root ruta,[69] expelled from the anus, And an intestinal worm born from karma,[70] Prepared with one’s own blood and semen,[71] And applying the ointment perfectly [to their] Food, drink, eye medicine, or clothing, For as long as you live Undoubtedly [they] will come under [your] power. Burning bull meat in the burned offering And anointing the deity with that blood, In that moment [the deity] comes under one’s power. If it does not come it will die. Place the [meat] in front of that very being And through meditation skillfully perform the burned offering. At the end of the burned offering offer the tormas. In an instant the three worlds are summoned; In seven nights the attainments will be accomplished. In the three worlds it is difficult to find The characteristic of one who practices the commitments. By always keeping one’s mantra hidden, Making excellent effort and keeping it secret, Not finding the hidden meaning Those of lesser fortune will not accomplish it. Even the practitioner of little merit Will discover it by pleasing [me].[72]

f.d: 38. The Ritual of the Abode of the Secret Hero and the Place of Accomplishing the Yogini

de nas brda ni mkha' 'gro ma'i/ / lus kyi mtshan nyid gang yin dang / / dpa' bo'i yan lag dbye ba ni/ / grub par gyur pa de 'grub 'gyur/ / dpa' bo'i dbang phyug mi 'dri zhing / / rnam pa kun du sba bar bya/ / gang gi thad du'ang mi gdon te/ / g.yon pa'i kun spyod sgrub pa pos/ / gsang ba'i mtshan nyid mkha' 'gro yi/ / sngags rnams bag med pas 'don na/ / de la nga ni mi lta ste/ / mkha' 'gro stong phrag du ma yis/ / ngan pa'i bdag nyid can de za/ / dam tshig 'joms shing ngan spyod de/ / bram ze gsod par the tshom med/ / sdig spyod rmongs pa'i bdag nyid can/ / bslus gyur ngan pa'i bdag nyid de/ / mkha' 'gro ma yis zos gyur kyang / / de la nga ni skyob mi byed/ / gsang ba pa yi nang na ni/ / sgrub po de ni phyugs dang 'dra/ / bla ma dam tshig la 'khu ba/ / sangs rgyas 'jig rten de las lhung / / he ru ka dpal lta dka'i rgyud/ / gang zhig srung bar byed pa ni/ / mkha' 'gro mar bcas dge sdong zhes/ / de la nga ni rjes su 'dzin/ / bla ma la ni bsnyen bkur byed/ / gsong por byed pa'i sgrub pa po/ /

Next are the signs and the dakinis, What the characteristics of their bodies are, and The distinctions of the limbs of the hero By which the attainments are accomplished. Do not draw the powerful hero. Keep every aspect hidden and Do not recite it in front of anyone. The practitioner engages in all actions with the left, Which is the secret characteristic of the dakini; If [he then] indiscreetly recites the mantra I will not look upon him. This evil-natured one will be eaten By many thousands of dakinis. The one who destroys the commitments And engages in bad actions, And who without a doubt is killing brahmins, This confused and wicked being, This evil one, will become ransom And will be eaten by the dakinis. I will not protect you from that. Among the secret beings, The practitioner who damages the guru’s commitments Is like a sacrificial animal And has fallen from the world of the Buddha. The one who protects the Tantra of glorious Heruka, so meaningful to behold, Will be cherished and cared for by the dakinis. I will benefit the practitioner who Acts respectfully and sincerely Toward the guru.

mkha' 'gro ma la rtag dga' ba/ / de la dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur/ / sgrub pa po ni dpa' nyid 'gyur/ / khams gsum mkha' la rgyu ba'i bdag / sgrub po dpa' bo nyid 'dod pa/ / thams cad du ni mchod par 'gyur/ / de ni rnal 'byor la rab 'jug / yang dag sbyin pa'ang rig par 'gyur/ / he ru ka yi brtul zhugs 'dzin/ / slob dpon dpa' bo mthong gyur na/ / mthong zhing mthong zhing kun tu dga'/ / sgrub pa pos ni sngags 'di yis/ / dpa' bo'i rtsa ba'i gsang sngags mchog / lan bdun du ni brjod par bya/ / rab sngags hU~M la sogs pas phye/ / de rnams 'bad de phyag byas na/ / sangs rgyas la sogs thams cad mchod/ / rtag pa nyid du dpa' chen dang / / rol par ldan par the tshom med/ / de yi thugs kar gnas phag mo/ / nga dang dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma/ / pho nya rnams dang lhan cig bcas/ / de dang gang zhig legs skyes pa/ / srog chags bsod nams mthong ba yin/ / 'bab chu'i 'gram dang rgya mtsho dang / / ri bo dang ni bzhi mdo dang / / lteng ka dang ni khron pa mtshe'u/ / khang stong dang ni lam srang dag / thams cad du ni mkha' 'gro ma/ / kun tu zhen par lta la gnas/ / 'jigs pa chen po dur khrod du/ / mkha' spyod de bzhin sa 'og dang / / ro langs kyang ni du ma zhig / 'jigs pa'i gzugs dang stobs chen pos/ / de dang lhan cig dpa' bo che/ / ci bde bar ni rol par mdzad/ / ri sul tshang tshing gsang ba dang / / rnal 'byor ma dang gsang ba'i mi/ / phyogs ni de dang de dag tu/ / sgrub pa po dang sa steng rol/ /

The dakinis will always be delighted; Such is the source of all realizations. This practitioner himself becomes a hero; He will fly throughout the three realms, and All the desires of the hero, the practitioner, Will transform into offerings. Engaging in that yoga Offered purely, you will develop knowledge By maintaining the conduct of Heruka. If the practitioner of this tantra Sees the master as the hero, Seeing and seeing with every joy, By proclaiming this supreme root secret mantra Of the hero seven times, The excellent mantra with HUM and so forth, Then undertaking that practice with perseverance Offered to all the buddhas and so forth, And always to the great hero, Have no doubt that [the hero] will be playful. Vajravarahi abides in their heart together with Myself, the hero, the yogini, And the messengers. They will see the merit of those beings and The living beings of excellent birth. Rivers, oceans, and ponds, Mountains, crossroads, A pool, a spring, and a small lake, A thousand cities, and narrow streets: In all of these places the yogini Abides, looking at them all with passion. Simultaneously the great hero Plays with bliss In a terrifying body of great strength In the charnel grounds of great fear, Enjoying the sky, and likewise underground, With zombies and in smoke. In a valley and a secret forest, In all of these places The yogini and secret people Play with the practitioner.

f.d: 40. The Powerful Actions of the Five Lineages and Teachings on Mahamudra

da ni rab tu bshad bya ba/ / gang gis sa stengs dbang du 'gyur/ / dpa' bo'i sngags kyi zla ba yis/ / rnal 'byor cho gar gnas pas 'grub/ / sgron ma myos byed bcas pa dang / / nya yi sha dang ldan par ni/ / dpa' dbang gnas skabs thams cad du/ / nyi ma bdun gyis sgrub pa po'i/ / mtshan mo'i sbyin sreg byed la gzhol/ / dngos grub rgya chen stsol bar 'gyur/ / brgya dang rtsa brgyad ldan nyid kyis/ / thun gsum du ni sgrub byed na/ / rgyal po dpung dang bcas par ni/ / nyin bdun gyis ni dbang du 'gyur/ / phyed kyis dpa' bo blon po ste/ / de yi phyed kyis blon po yi/ / rgyal phran la ni sum cu gnyis/ / bsreg pa'i rim gyis sbyin sreg bya/ / nyi shus bram ze nyid la ni/ / nyi ma bdun gyis sbyin sreg bya/ / de bzhin rgyal rigs dag la bdun/ / sbyin sreg lnga po rje rigs la/ / dmangs rigs la ni sbyin sreg gsum/ / tha ma la ni sbyin sreg gcig / de ltar dpa' bos rigs rim gyis/ / zla ba gcig ni yang dag spyad/ / sngags kyi nus pa sgrub pa pos/ / 'gro ba thams cad dgug par bya/ / dpa' bos cho ga snga ma yis/ / 'dod pas bsten na thob par 'gyur/ / sa steng 'dod pa'i dbang phyug bzhin/ / dpal ldan skal pa bzang por 'gyur/ / sgrub po mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi/ / yid 'ong 'gyur bar gdon mi za/ /

This is the best explanation By which earthlings can be subjugated. Reciting the mantra of the hero, it is Accomplished in one month by abiding in the ritual of yoga. [For this purpose offer] intoxicants and lamps, Together with fish and meat To the powerful hero in all states. The practitioner who performs the burned offering For seven days at night with hand and mouth Will receive extensive attainments. By performing one hundred and eight [burned offerings], If accomplished during the three times of the day, The king together with his army Will be subjugated in seven days. By half [as many offerings], a great hero, and By half of that, a person of high status. A petty king [requires] thirty-two [burned offerings], One should thus perform the burned offering in stages. By offering the burned offering twenty times Over seven days [one will subjugate] a brahmin. Likewise seven [offerings are required] for the ruling class (kshatriya), Five burned offerings for the noble class (vaishya), and Three burned offerings for the common class (shudra). One burned offering [is required] for the lowest of beings. Thus if the hero performs this perfectly in stages For one month, By accomplishing the mantra of power All migrators will be summoned. The hero, through the previous ritual, Will accomplish all of his wishes, Or [he] will become the Lord of Desire on earth, Or [he] will become glorious and fortunate. Undoubtedly the practitioner Will charm the dakinis.

d.crumb: 41. The Ritual of the Arrangement of the Twenty-Four Mandalas

f.d: 41. The Ritual of the Arrangement of the Twenty-Four Mandalas

de nas las kyi mchog rab ni/ / gang gis shes na sgrub pa pos/ / dbang dang dgug dang dbye ba dang / / gsad dang bskrad pa la sogs dang / / rmugs dang rengs par bya ba dang / / rmongs dang de bzhin phur bus gdab/ / tshig 'phrog lkugs par 'gyur ba dang / / 'on dang de bzhin long ba dang / / ma ning nyid du bya ba dang / / gzugs ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste/ / las chen bcu gnyis 'di dag ni/ / rtag tu sgrub pa po yis bsgrub/ / dngos grub sgrub pa po la ni/ / dran pa 'grub 'gyur gdon mi za/ / thams cad bla ma'i gnas la sogs/ / mkha' 'gro mas ni thams cad khyab/ / ye shes ldan pa'i rang skye gnas/ / yul dang yul du mngon par skye/ / rdo rje dkyil 'khor gtso mo yin/ / de rnams mkha' 'gro ma ru bshad/ / ku lu ta dang dgon pa dang / / sin+d+hu'i yul dang grong khyer dbang / / gser gyi gling dang sau rASh+Ta/ / de bzhin lha yi khyim dang ni/ / yi dgas grong dang kha ba'i gnas/ / kAny+tsi'am lam+bA ka yi yul/ / ka ling+ga dang ko sa la/ / tri sha ku ne o tre dang / / kA ma rU pa mA la wa/ / lha mo'i mkhar dang rA ma'i dbang / / go da ba ri arbu ta/ / au D+yan dzA lan+d+ha ra dang / / pul+lI ra ma la ya sogs/ / yul 'di dag gi bu mo gang / / dpa' bo gnyis med rnal 'byor ma/ / de kun 'dod pa'i gzugs can te/ / yid kyi shugs kyis 'jug pa yis/ /

Next, the supreme actions By which the practitioner with knowledge can Control, summon, and divide, Kill, expel, and shake, Immobilize and make stiff, Confuse, and likewise plant the stake, Steal the words, make [someone] stupid, Deaf, and blind, Make [someone] a hermaphrodite, Or completely change shape. These twelve great actions Are always accomplished by the practitioner, And the realized practitioner should Have no doubt that the realizations Will be attained through mindfulness. At all the supreme places and so forth The dakinis are all-pervasive. Endowed with exalted wisdom of their own birthplace, They are born in country after country As the queens of the vajra mandala. And then the explanation of the dakinis: [They are in] Kuluta and Maru, The lands of Sindhu and Nagara, Suvarnadvipa, Saurashtra, Grihadevata, Pretapuri, Himalaya and Kanchi, The lands of Lampaka and Kalinga, Koshala and Trishakune, Otre and Kamarupa, Malawa and Devikota, Rameshvara and Godavari, Arbuta and Oddiyana, Jalandhara, Pulliramalaya, and so forth. All the girls of these lands Are nondual with the hero and yogini. They have desirous forms and Will enter through the power of mind.[73]

rnal 'byor ma drug ku lu tar/ / mya ngam yul na ma mo rnams/ / sin+d+hu'i yul na lA ma ste/ / rigs kyi gtso mo na ga rar/ / lam+bA ka dang sau rASh+Ta ra/ / rigs kyi lha mo rnams yin no/ / yi dgas grong dang nags chen por/ / mkha' 'gro rU pi ka ru bcas/ / kha ba'i ri dang kAny+tsir ni/ / byis bcas ma ru bshad pa ste/ / pAny+tsa la yi yul dag na/ / khyim gyi lha mo ka ling+gar/ / brtul zhugs 'dzin pa rnams yin no/ / ko sa lar ni sha za ba/ / yi dgas grong du de bzhin du/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro sbom dbang phyug / tri sha ku ner dum skyes ma/ / bul+lIr ma la ya de bzhin/ / gser rir sme sha can rigs skyes/ / bud med stong phrag nyi shu gcig / lhag ma gzhan dag ji snyed pa/ / dpal ldan he ru ka yi ni/ / 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor ma yin no/ / he ru ka dpal sbyor ba che/ / de yi dkyil 'khor gtso mo yin/ / mkha' 'gro nyi shu rtsa bzhi 'dis/ / rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'jig rten gsum/ / 'gro ba kun ni 'di yis khyab/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi dam tshig 'di/ / sprul pa sgom pa nyid yin te/ / bsam gtan la sogs gang ci'ang rung / / sa steng na ni rdzogs 'gyur ba'o/ / g.yon gyi spyod pa gcer bu yis/ / mtshan mo rtag tu mnyam bzhag pas/ / skyes pa'am gal te g.yon pa kun/ / rnal 'byor ma kun dpa' bo 'gro/ / phyag rgya gar gyi mchod pa yis/ / rang byung rtag tu mchod na ni/ / ma lus lus pa med grub cing / / g.yon pa'i mchod pa la rab 'jug /

The six yoginis are in Kuluta, The mothers in the land of Maru. Lama [dakinis] are in the land of Sindhu. The lineage of the principal mother is in Nagara. In Lampaka and Saurashtra Are the goddess lineage. In Pretapuri are Nak Chenmo[74] Together with the Rupini dakinis. In the mountain of Himalaya and Kanchi Is said to be Sabalika. And in the lands of Panchala, Grihadevata, and Kalinga Are the goddesses who maintain the conducts. These are explained as the childish girls.[75] In Koshala are the carnivores. Likewise in Pretapuri is The large and powerful Dorje Khandro (Vajradakini). In Trishakune are Khandaroha. Likewise in Pulliramalaya and The Golden Mountain [76] there are Twenty-one thousand women Born into the lineage of butchers. However many other places there are They are the yoginis of the mandala of The glorious Heruka. Shri Heruka, the great churner, And the principal mothers of that mandala, These twenty-four dakinis, Pervade all migrators in the three worlds, All things animate and inanimate. This commitment of the dakinis Is the illusory meditation. With perfect concentration and Whatever else is appropriate, it Should be brought to completion on this earth. Always concentrating with the mantra and Wearing the night sky, If one begins from the left All the yoginis and the hero will be delighted. By offering the dance and mudra And continuously offering the self-arisen, Everything without exception will be attained By undertaking offerings from the left.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i dkyil 'khor dgod pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa gcig go //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF THE ARRANGEMENT OF THE TWENTY-FOUR MANDALAS” IS THE FORTY-FIRST CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 42. The Ritual of the Laughing Mantra and the Illusory Form of the Yogini

f.d: 42. The Ritual of the Laughing Mantra and the Illusory Form of the Yogini

de nas dpa' bo me tog chu/ / 'thungs nas sngags 'di rjes dran bya/ / rtag tu 'di ltar bya ba nyid/ / phyag rgya lhan cig sgrub pa pos/ / mtshan mo rtag tu sha bza' ba/ / sngags 'di nyid kyis lan gsum bsngags/ / myur du bde ba 'thob par 'gyur/ / 'thungs dang de bzhin byin pa dang / / reg nas bzhag na gtso mo che/ / bden pas tshangs par spyod pa dang / / thog mthar bzhad pa'i phyag rgya yis/ / blta ba'i bsnyems pa drags ldan pa/ / mtshan mo'ang de bzhin nyin mo ni/ / 'dis ni bzhad pa dag tu bya/ / gzugs dang las kyi gsang ba gang / / ji ltar gnas pa dpa' bo nyon/ / rtag tu de yi mchi ma 'byung / / dad pas de yi spu yang ldang / / rdo rje la ni 'gom mi byed/ / de bzhin gcer bur mchod pa ste/ / 'dod pa'i dbang phyug thams cad kyi/ / phyag rgya'i tshogs kyi rim pa nyid/ / dbugs 'byin skul dang rgod pa dang / / sgeg pa'i gar ni ngo mtshar bas/ / sna tshogs gang dag mdun byed cing / / phyag rgya sngags ni rjes dran bya/ / ha ha he he rnam brgyad bzhad/ / sna tshogs dbang phyug mchog tu dga'/ / hA hA zhes bya 'di nye bar/ / rtag tu mchi ma 'byung ba dang / / de nyid kyis de dgar 'gyur zhing / / bsam gtan gyi sngags legs par sbyor/ / gtso mo rnams dang dpa' bo ni/ / spu ldang ba dang lhan cig bde/ / rdo rje 'gom par mi bya ba/ / g.yon pas yongs su brtags pa yin/ /

Next, the hero having drunk flower water Should remember this mantra. The practitioner dances[77] in this way Together with his mudra. By always eating meat at night And [reciting] the mantra three times He quickly attains bliss. Offer drinks in the same way, Touching and smiling at The great principal mother. While practicing brahmin’s conduct and Laughing at the beginning and end with the mudra, This famous [goddess] looks proudly. In this way, at night as well as during the day One should always be laughing. The hero listens in such a place To all the secrets of body and actions. Always crying, The hair rises out of faith, Not mounting the vajra And likewise making offerings naked. These are the stages of All the powerful goddesses of desire, With the collection mudras. With exhalations, exhortations, and laughter, The marvelous dance, And a variety [of other means], induce desire By remembering mantra and mudra and Laughing eight times HA HA HE HE. The supreme joy of the various powerful [goddesses], Saying HA HA they draw you near. A tear falls[78] and Through that you will fall in love, The perfect union of mantra and concentration. The hairs of the principal mothers And the hero rise together in bliss. Do not mount the vajra [Of those who] examine the left.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las bzhad pa'i sngags dang mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyi sgyu ma'i cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa'o// //

d.crumb: 43. The Ritual of Accomplishing the Actions of the Close Essence [Mantra]

f.d: 43. The Ritual of Accomplishing the Actions of the Close Essence [Mantra]

de nas spyan ras gzigs bshad de/ / dpa' bo dang ni gnyis med mi/ / gnas kyi dbye ba cho ga shes/ / sgom la rtag tu mngon dga' ba'o/ / lam gyi bzhi mdo 'am khyim dag gam/ / dpa' bo'i gnas dang ri bor ni/ / mkha' 'gro ma yis dam tshig gnas/ / ring po nas kyang gzigs par 'gyur/ / phyag rgyas gcer bur mchod pa yi/ / lag pas go 'phang dam pa ste/ / gos nyid kyis ni bkab pa'am gzhan/ / 'dod pa rnams kyis gos mi 'gyur/ / de bzhin skra grol gtsor gyur pas/ / las rnams thams cad brtsam par bya/ / rtsa ba'i sngags dang de bzhin gzhan/ / phyogs bcing bar ni 'jug pa yis/ / lha dang lha yi tshogs kyis kyang / / ma mthong bar ni mchod par gyis/ / snyim pa me tog gis bkang ste/ / mkha' la spyod la gyen du 'thor/ / me tog de dag ma lhung zhing / / me tog sa la ma mthong na/ / gnas kyi khyad par la gnas dang / / mkha' la 'gro ba stong phrag gi/ / gnas la dbang ni byed par 'gyur/ / ngag gi dbang phyug ma rnams dang / / ngag gi dbang phyug 'gugs par 'gyur/ / lha dang lha yi gtam shes shing / / rim pa ji lta bzhin du'o/ / skar ma'i rgyu ba shes par 'gyur/ / grong dang grong rdal de bzhin dgon/ / grong khyer dang ni bzhi mdo dang / / shing gcig dang ni dpa' bo'i khyim/ / ri rtse dang ni mtshan drung du/ / snying po'am nye snying rtag dran na/ / lha dang mi yis mthong mi 'gyur/ / de bas yul phyogs 'di dag tu/ / sgrub pa po ni rtag tu gnas/ / yi ge bdun gyi bdag nyid can/ / shing rtser kha dog dmar bsams nas/ / myur du lhung ba mi phyed par/ / sa rnams kyang ni gzhan du min/ / bdag gi lus la rnam bkod de/ / sa la ku sha'i stan du nyal/ / yi ge bdun gyis bdag nyid sngags/ / brgya rtsa brgyad ni nyid du bzlas/ / rmi lam du ni bya ba kun/ / yid la 'dod pa ston par 'gyur/ / dus min 'chi dang bcom dang nyams/ / bya ba kun tu gang gyur dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag kyang / / thams cad rmi lam dag tu ston/ / de bzhin sngags bzlas ral gri chu/ / mthe bo mar me me long la/ / sngags pa bdag nyid rtag rnal 'byor/ / pra se na ni 'bebs par byed/ / bsgoms nas lan bdun bzlas brjod pas/ / dge dang mi dge ston par 'gyur/ /

Next, the explanation of Chenrezig,[79] Who is nondual with the hero, Who knows the ritual for distinguishing the place And continuously delights in meditation. At a house, crossroads, The abode of the hero, or a mountain, One is seen by the dakinis as abiding in the commitments Even from a long way off. Offer a naked [action] mudra. Through this action you will[80] Attain the state of sacredness. Clothes and other coverings Should not be worn by the desirous ones. Thus having let down your hair Commence all actions. [With] the root mantra as well as others Bind [those] dwelling in the directions. The act of offering should not be seen by The gods or the collection of demigods. Both hands full of flowers Should be offered toward the sky. If those flowers do not fall And are not seen on the ground, A thousand dakinis Abiding in this particular place Will be subjugated. The goddess of powerful speech And the lord of speech will be summoned; Therefore gradually one will Come to know conversations of the gods And know the movement of the stars. In towns as well as in isolated places, Those which are underground,[81] The cities and crossroads, A tree and the abode of the hero, Or on the peak of a mountain and in the sky, By always remembering the essence and close essence [mantras] Gods and men will not see you. Through that, the practitioner can always Stay in these regions. The nature of the seven-syllable mantra[82] Visualized as red at the top of a tree, [That tree] will quickly fall without breaking But not in other places. Place [the mantra] on your body And sleep on a cushion of kusha grass. Then one should recite the seven-syllable mantra One hundred and eight times. All the activities in your dreams Will be revealed according to your wishes. You will destroy untimely death And all actions will be fulfilled. A variety of others as well Will be shown in your dreams. Also recite the mantra over a sword, water, Your thumb, a butter lamp, or a mirror. By the mantra yoga of oneself You will cause the descent of the prasena.[83] While meditating repeat the recitation seven times And virtue and nonvirtue will become apparent.

de nas dpa' bo'i yi ge bdun/ / sngags dgod dbye ba nyid kyis te/ / nyi ma'i dbus su bsams nas ni/ / stong gi bar du bzla bar bya/ / shel gyi rnam pa lta bur ni/ / nad kyis gdungs la bstan par bya/ / mthong ba tsam gyi mod la ni/ / nad kun 'jig par the tshom med/ / nad las rnam par grol 'gyur na/ / ston ka'i dus kyi zla ba 'dra/ / zla ba'i dbus su rnam bkod cing / / lag pa g.yon par 'khor lo nyid/ / yi ge shel gyi mdog ltar snang / / nad rnams kun la dgod par bya/ / rims dang gdon sogs brjed byed dang / / gzer sogs kun dang mdze can dang / / dug gis zin sogs nad rnams dang / / nad kun the tshom med par ni/ / zla gzugs yi ge bsams nas ni/ / phyogs bcur rnam par 'byed bar 'gyur/ / mtshan mo gsang ba la gnas te/ / go mAng sa ni mngar gsum btags/ / yig bdun gsang sngags shes pa dang / / stong phrag brgyad du sbyin sreg byas/ / sngags pa nang par dus su ni/ / gser srang stong ni rnyed par 'gyur/ / sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu yis ni/ / yul 'khor dam pa rnyed par 'gyur/ / yang na gsang sngags rgyal po ni/ / gnas ni gang du bsams pa dang / / de dang der ni de yi tshe/ / skye bar 'gyur bar gdon mi za/ / dkar po yis ni zhi bar 'gyur/ / nag pos skad cig dag gis gsod/ / dmar pos dbang du 'gyur ba ste/ / 'phral du nges par 'gugs par 'gyur/ / ser pos thams cad gnon 'gyur te / 'di ni bstan bcos nges pa yin/ / ser pos dpung ni gnon pa dang / / gru dang 'khrul 'khor glang po gnon/ /

And then divide and arrange The seven-syllable mantra of the hero. Imagine it in the center of a sun disk And recite it up to a thousand [times] And it will appear [as clear] as a crystal. [If you] show this to those who are afflicted with illness, By merely seeing it [the disease] will be cleared. Have no doubt all illness will be destroyed and One will be liberated from that illness Like an autumn moon. Arrange a wheel on the left hand In the center of the moon and The seven syllables that appear like the color of crystal. Placed upon any diseases, The contagious diseases, spirits, And so forth will be obliterated, As well as all pains and so forth, leprosy, Poisons, illnesses, and so forth. Have no doubt that all illnesses Will be cast to the ten directions Through imagining the letters on the moon [disk]. In a secret place at night Crush beef[84] with the three sweets, Knowing the seven syllables of the secret mantra and Performing eight thousand burned offerings; In the morning the mantrika Will acquire a thousand measures of gold. By doing ten thousand burned offerings [He will] acquire a sacred land. Whatever place he thinks of, And at any time, Have no doubt he will take rebirth there And become a king of secret mantra. With white [all] becomes peaceful, With black you can kill in an instant, With red you can subjugate And summon in an instant, and With yellow all will be subdued. This is the definitive [meaning] of the teachings. With yellow you can subdue an army, Overcoming its boats, machines, and elephants.

dkar po bsams pa tsam gyis ni/ / 'chi ba nges par slong bar 'gyur/ / sbrul chen brgya yis zin pa ni/ / de yang myur du slong bar byed/ / dug gis brgyal ba rnams mthong nas/ / rab tu sad pas sad par 'gyur/ / rims dang gdon dang brjed byed ni/ / lag pa mthong bas 'jigs par 'gyur/ / rgyan po g.yul du khu tshur bcings/ / yid la rtag tu zlos byed na/ / khu tshur ma bkrol de srid du/ / bya ba thams cad bsgrub par 'gyur/ / dgra bo gal te lag na ni/ / mtshon cha 'phyar bar byed pa yang / / ji srid khu tshur ma bkrol bar/ / mtshon cha gtong bar mi nus so/ / gzhan yang bya ba thams cad ni/ / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed/ / 'bras bu me tog 'dab ma dang / / so rtsi de bzhin zas rnams la/ / lus kyi sbyor ba dang po ste/ / de bzhin gnyis pa nus pa yin/ / gsum pa dag ni ngag nyid do/ / bzhi pa dmigs par mi 'gyur te/ / sngags kyi rgyal pos 'grub par 'gyur/ / sa gzhi shing dang bcas pa dang / / rgya mtsho ska rags btags de la/ / 'dir ni 'grub par the tshom med/ / khams gsum rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bar/ / dmod 'debs phan 'dogs nus pa yin/ /

By merely thinking of white The dead are revived. One who has been captured by one hundred ghosts Is also quickly revived. By seeing [someone] who has Fallen unconscious due to poison, He will be perfectly awakened and arise. By seeing one’s hand, contagious diseases, Spirits, and epilepsy[85] become terrified. While constantly reciting [it] mentally Throwing dice or fighting with a closed fist, As long as your clenched fist is not loosened All activities will be accomplished. Even if an enemy Lifts up a weapon in his hand, As long as your clenched fists are not opened He will be unable to strike you. Thus all actions are Likewise accomplished with Fruit, flower petals, Betel nut, and other foods. The first is the union of the body, The second is power, The third is speech, The fourth is unobservable; [these are all] Accomplished by the King of Mantras. You will have the power to benefit or curse The animate and inanimate [beings] of the three realms, In the earth together with the trees, Or in the ocean or a bound sash, Have no doubts about these attainments.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las nye ba'i snying po'i las sgrub pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF ACCOMPLISHING THE ACTIONS OF THE CLOSE ESSENCE [MANTRA]” IS THE FORTY-THIRD CHAPTER.

f.d: 44. The Ritual Actions of the Seven Syllables of the Six Dakinis

de nas pho nya la brten te/ / yi ge bdun pa dang ldan pa/ / gang du las la yang dag brtsams/ / de yi mod la myur du 'grub/ / yi ge bdun pa'i cho ga yis/ / rnal 'byor ma drug rnam par dgod/ / 'khor lor legs par gnas pa drug / rnam pa de lta'i cho ga yi/ / g.yon pa nyid du bskul dang bcas/ / gang gis gzung 'dzin bsams nas ni/ / kha nas gsang sngags rgyal po zlos/ / gang la lag pa de bstan pa/ / de ni nges par 'gugs par 'gyur/ / tsan+dan dmar po'i rdul dang ni/ / de bzhin ske tshe lan tshwa dang / / bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes la/ / gcig tu byas nas brtag par bya/ / lag pa gnyis kyis mnyes nas ni/ / rnal 'byor ma la sbyin sreg bya/ / mtshan mo sme sha can me 'am/ / dur khrod me la phye ma bsreg / bsgrub par bya la mngon phyogs te/ / sbyor ba 'di ni brtsam par bya/ / ji srid brgya yi bar du bzlas/ / des ni nges par 'gugs par 'gyur/ / bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid dang / / nor dang skye bo dbang du 'gyur/ / sbyor ba 'di ni grub pa ste/ / gzhan du na ni nga mi smra/ / rdul de nyid ni blangs nas su/ / lcags phye dang ni rnam par bsres/ / dur khrod ras la btums nas ni/ / lan bdun bzlas la bzhi mdo ru/ / sor brgyad tsam du sa brkos la/ / dgra yi ming dang bcas par ni/ / gang gi ming smos sbas gyur pa/ / de ni myur du gnon par 'gyur/ / phye ma de nyid bzlas nas su/ / 'bad de ba yi 'o ma yis/ / de ni slar yang gsos gyur na/ / 'grub pa nyid du the tshom med/ / phye ma de ni blangs nas ni/ / myos byed lnga dang ldan pa ru/ / de ni dur khrod ras kyis bcing / / dgra yi ming yang bri bar bya/ / bzlas brjod lan brgya byas nas ni/ / dur khrod du ni nges sbas na/ / bsgrub bya smyo ba nyid du 'gyur/ / bton pa nyid kyis thar bar 'gyur/ / bton nas ba yi 'o ma yis/ / 'bad pas de bzhin bkru bar bya/ / slar yang gso ba de dag ni/ / 'grub pa nyid du the tshom med/ /

Then rely on a messenger Endowed with the seven-syllable mantra Through which actions are correctly undertaken And quickly accomplished in an instant. With the ritual of the seven syllables, Arrange in the center of your hand[86] The six dakinis, perfectly abiding in A wheel endowed with a signal in the left [hand]. Visualizing that which has his form From the mouth one recites the king of secret mantras; The one to whom that hand is shown Will definitely be summoned. [Mix] the dust of red sandalwood And likewise black mustard seeds and salt In the footprint made in the ground by The object of accomplishment.[87] Grind it together and Soften it with both hands. Perform a burned offering to the yogini At night and burn it to dust in the fire of a butcher Or in a charnel ground fire. Moving toward the object of accomplishment And undertaking this yoga, When you complete one hundred recitations, He will definitely be summoned. When one accomplishes this, his self-nature, His wealth, and living beings will be subjugated. Accomplish these preparations; I do not say otherwise. Take that very powder and Mix it together with iron powder. Wrapping it in cloth from the charnel ground Recite [the mantra] seven times at a crossroad And dig eight finger-widths into the ground And hide it together with the name of your enemy. The person whose name you say Will quickly be overcome By reciting over that very powder. If you enthusiastically [cleanse] it with milk, He will again come to life; Have no doubt this will be accomplished. Take that powder and Bind it with cloth of the charnel grounds Possessing the five intoxicants and Write the name of your enemy. If you hide that in the charnel grounds And say the recitation one hundred times, The victim will become crazy. By casting it out [he] will be released. By enthusiastically cleansing it With the milk of a cow He will again come to life. Have no doubt that [this] will be accomplished.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las rnal 'byor ma drug gi yi ge bdun gyi las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa'o// //

d.crumb: 45. The Ritual of the Six Yoginis, the Attainments of Speech, and the Prophecy

f.d: 45. The Ritual of the Six Yoginis, the Attainments of Speech, and the Prophecy

de nas las kyi rab mchog ni/ / ngag gi dngos grub byed pa'o/ / ka ra bI ra'i me tog dmar/ / brgya rtsa brgyad ni blangs nas su/ / 'bad de ba yi 'o ma dang / / bzlas brjod brgya yang bya ba yin/ / lan re bzlas pa'i me tog gis/ / ling ga'i spyi bor bsnun par bya/ / de ltar shin tu mnyam bzhag pas/ / nyi ma bdun du bya ba yin/ / de nas nyin zhag bcu gcig par/ / me tog dag ni blangs nas su/ / chu bo chen por song nas ni/ / re re nas ni chu la dor/ / de dag thams cad rim bzhin du/ / lan re bzlas nas rab tu bya/ / chu bor me tog tha ma ni/ / rgyun las bzlog ste rab 'bab na/ / chu dang bcas par blangs nas ni/ / sos ma reg par de 'thungs na/ / gsang ba'i rgyud las byung ba yi/ / sgrub po'i tshig ni 'grub par 'gyur/ / de nas skye gnas brgya bcings la/ / brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas nas ni/ / sngags pa bsgrub byar mngon phyogs na/ / bsgrub par bya ba'i lto bar gnas/ / de la yid kyi gnas bzhin du/ / blo ldan thun gsum mthe'u chung bskyod/ / bram ze gsod pa dag gis kyang / / zhag bdun brgya byin sogs nges 'gugs/ / tsan+dan dmar po'i rdul las ni/ / bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs byas la/ / tsha ba gsum gyis lus la bsku/ / spra tshil gyis kyang rab tu byug / sgrub pa po yi gsang gnas su/ / zangs ma'i khab kyis phug nas ni/ / seng ldeng mdag me du med la/ / mkhas pas nyi ma bdun du bsro/ / lan brgya bzlas te bzlas pa'i mthar/ / mi yi bdag po mdun na 'don/ / btsun mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa ni/ / nges par 'gugs par byed pa yin/ / mi yi bdag po 'khor bcas pa/ / gro ga'i 'dab mar bri bya ba/ / gi wang dag gis bris nas ni/ / ming dang spel nas gang la ni/ / mngon par phyogs te brgya bzlas nas/ / seng ldeng me la de gdungs shing / / dur khrod me steng grub phyir bshad/ / ji srid spra tshil ma zhu'i bar/ / bsros par gyur na rgyal po ni/ / 'khor los sgyur dang bcas par yang / / nges par 'gugs par 'gyur ba yin/ /

Next, the excellent supreme actions that Accomplish the realizations of speech. Take one hundred and eight Red karavira flowers And vigorously [rinse] them with cow’s milk.[88] Recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times and With each recitation hit the head of the penis.[89] Continue performing in this way With perfect concentration for seven days. Then, after eleven days Take the flowers, Go to a great river, Take them all one by one And throw them in the water, Perfectly reciting as you take each one. If the last flower tossed in the water Reverses its descent and travels upstream, And if you take that together with some water, And drink it without biting, The practitioner will accomplish the Speech arisen from the Secret Tantra. Next, bind the vagina mudra[90] And recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times With the mantrika facing the object of accomplishment. On the stomach of the object of accomplishment, Set the mind accordingly, then The adept moves his little finger During the three times of the day. Even if one kills a brahmin After seven days Indra and so forth are definitely summoned. With the powder of red sandalwood On an image of the object of accomplishment Rub its body with the three spices And anoint it with beeswax. The practitioner pierces its Secret place with a copper needle. The skilled one should warm it for seven days With the smokeless charcoal of a khadira tree.[91] At the end of one hundred recitations The king, minister, And the queen together with their retinues Will definitely all be summoned. Write the name of the king together with his court On the leaf of a birch tree, Writing with the tip of a finger of a corpse And drawing with mental stabilization, then Recite it a hundred times facing [his] direction. It is said that to gain accomplishment, recite it In a charnel ground fire of acacia wood. As long as the beeswax [image] does not melt But becomes warm, the king, Together with a chakravartin king, Will also definitely be summoned.

bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes las/ / tsan+dan dmar po nyid dang ni/ / dur khrod lhag ma thal bas spyos/ / sgrub pa po yis gcig bsdus la/ / seng ldeng me ni du med la/ / rab tu 'bad pas bsro bar bya/ / rdul de lag pa gnyis kyis ni/ / mnyes nas sbyin sreg byas nas ni/ / ji srid du ni bsregs pas 'grug / rdul de blangs nas ma yengs par/ / dbugs mi 'byin par sbas na ni/ / brgyal zhing sems dang bral 'dra la/ / rmongs shing nyon mongs pa nyid dang / / rlung gi shugs kyis 'ongs nas ni/ / sgrub pa po yi steng du lhung / / phyugs sam yang na pho nya mo/ / mkhas pa yis ni dbye ba yin/ / de nas las kyi pho nya mor/ / bya ba 'di ni 'dzin pa nyid/ / ka ra bI ra'i lcug ma ni/ / rlan bcas dpung pa'i tshad mnyam blangs/ / 'bar 'gyur ro bsreg me la dor/ / ji srid de ni ma tshig pa/ / myur du song ste de blangs la/ / rig pa lan bdun bzlas nas ni/ / gang zhig bzlas te bskor na ni/ / de ni de yi skad cig la/ / skyes pa'am bud med rang gzugs can/ / rlung gi shugs kyis 'ong bar 'gyur/ / ka ra bI ra'i me tog dmar/ / brgya bzlas rgyal gyi sbyor ba las/ / sgrub pos gi'u wang gis byugs la/ / me tog chu la gnas pa la/ / chu bo chen por zhugs nas ni/ / lte ba man chod chur bcug ste/ / lag pa sbyar ba'i dbus gnas la/ / rig pa stong du bzlas nas ni/ / lag pa gnyis kyis phyer brlags te/ / chu dang bcas par btung bar bya/ / de nas sgrub pa po de yis/ / tshig gi dngos grub thob par 'gyur/ /

The practitioner should Take dust from the footprint of The object of accomplishment, Add red sandalwood and Grind it with the leftover Ashes from the charnel grounds. Vigorously dried in the flames Of smokeless acacia charcoal, Take that dust and soften it With your two hands and perform the burned offering. By taking that powder, [they] will remain unmoving; Hide it, and [they] will be tormented, Fall unconscious, become senseless, Confused and deluded, and [they] Will come with the force of the wind And throw [themselves] at the practitioner. [Make them into] A sacrificial animal or else a female messenger[92] As discerned by the practitioner. Then the activities of messengers Will be captured by these actions. Take the branch of a moistened karavira tree The measure of your forearm, and upon it The practitioner should write the mantra Together with whatever is to be accomplished. Toss it into the flames of a burning corpse And as long as it is not burned up, Quickly go and retrieve it. By reciting the knowledge [mantra] seven times And circumambulating while reciting, In that very instant A beautiful man or woman will be Drawn to you by the power of the wind. The practitioner takes a red karavira flower, Prepared during the lunar conjunction with Gyal (Pushya) with one hundred recitations, And smears it with [blessed] cow product And places it in flower water. One enters the force of a great river Up to the navel and, Standing in the center with your hands cupped, Recites the knowledge [mantra] a thousand times. Filling both hands, Drink this [flower] together with the water. Through this the practitioner Will obtain the attainment of speech.

rgyal po'am rgyal po'i chung ma ni/ / yid kyis nges par 'gugs par 'gyur/ / lhar bcas lha min mi rnams ni/ / myur du dbang du byed par 'gyur/ / khros pas tshig gis gsod 'gyur zhing / / dbye dang bskrad pa nyid kyang byed/ / sgrub pa po yi tshig nyid kyis/ / tshar gcod par ni byed par 'gyur/ / tshig tsam gyis ni chu bo dang / / shing rta 'khrul 'khor rgya mtsho dang / / glang po rta dang de bzhin sprin/ / skyes bu'am yang na bya yang gnon/ / yid kyis yid la gang 'dod pa/ / tshig gis thams cad byed par 'gyur/ / dgug pa yi ni sbyor ba dag / bud med thams cad rmongs byed pa/ / kar bI ra'i me tog ni/ / dmar po yang dag blangs nas su/ / rig pa lan brgya bzlas pa dag / skye gnas dbus su gzhug par bya/ / me tog de ni kha sbyar byas/ / gsang ba'i gnas su nges par sbyar/ / gnyis med ye shes rnal 'byor ldan/ / sngags pas brgya phrag gcig tu bzlas/ / skye gnas dbus kyi me tog de/ / sgrub pa po yis gcig blangs la/ / me tog gis ni gang bsnun pa/ / de ni mod la dbang du 'gyur/ / brgyal zhing sems dang bral ba dang / / yan lag tshigs kun gzhan dbang ste/ / mngon 'gyur sems ni zlog pa ru/ / skad cig gis ni dbang du byed/ / 'di ni yid ches dngos grub ste/ / don yod dbang du byed pa yin/ /

Thus will a king and queen Definitely be summoned by the mind and Gods together with demigods and men Will quickly be subjugated. [You can] kill with wrathful words; So too can dividing and expelling Both be accomplished with words. By mere words, rivers and Chariots, machines, and oceans, Oxen, horses, and likewise clouds, People, or even birds can be suppressed. All beings and all wishes Will all be accomplished by the mind. Next, the application of summoning And copulating with all women. Properly take the red karavira flower and Recite the knowledge [mantra] a hundred times And place it in the center of her vagina And enclose that flower. Definitely arrange it in [her] secret place. Endowed with the yoga of the nondual exalted wisdom, Recite the mantra a hundred times over The flower in the center of [her] vagina. The practitioner should extract one [flower]. Whoever is struck by that flower Will instantly come under your control and Fall unconscious and senseless. All of her limbs and joints Are controlled by another, as well as The collection of limbs and other powers; Her confidence[93] is reversed And instantly she comes under your power. This is the attainment of confidence And the meaning of subjugation.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las rnal 'byor ma drug dang tshig gi dngos grub lung bstan pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF THE SIX YOGINIS, THE ATTAINMENTS OF SPEECH, AND THE PROPHECY” IS THE FORTY-FIFTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 46. The Ritual of the Actions of the Five HA Syllables

f.d: 46. The Ritual of the Actions of the Five HA Syllables

de nas yi ge ha lnga ni/ / las rnams thams cad sgrub byed pa/ / gang zhig shes pa tsam gyis ni/ / myur du dngos grub rab 'jug pa'o/ / haM hau ho hai haH yi ge ha lnga lag pa yis/ / bskul dang ldan pas mnyes na ni/ / kha nas kyang ni khrag 'dzag cing / / dgra bo de yi mod la 'chi/ / rang gi khrag ni thod gnas pa/ / srin lag gis khrag mnye bar bya/ / ji srid skams kyi bar du ste/ / des ni bsgrub bya rnam par 'jig / gal te khro bo 'bar ba dang / / mig dmar ba yis bzlas na ni/ / dpung tshogs bzhon par bcas pa yi/ / rgyal po myur du 'chi bar byed/ / byi la dang ni ne'u le dang / / khwa dang wa dang chu skyar ni/ / mkha' 'gro ma la stobs can sbyar/ / 'di dag myur du 'grub yin par/ / rgyud 'di la ni the tshom med/ / ri bong la sogs spu las ni/ / srad bu byas te lan stong bzlas/ / gang gi mgul du bcings gyur pa/ / de ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur/ / lag par bzlas brjod stong byas te/ / ka ra bI ra'i me tog dang / / yi ge re re mngon bzlas la/ / sbrum ma la ni reg gyur na/ / mngal ni rnam par 'pho 'gyur te/ / gtang na thar bar 'gyur ba yin/ / gang la sdigs mdzub byas te 'chi/ / slar yang 'tsho bar byed pa yin/ /

Next, by merely knowing the five syllables That accomplish all actions You will quickly attain the realizations. HAM HOU HO HAI HAH The five signal HA syllables are Softened by the hand. When blood comes from his mouth In that instant the enemy dies. Taking one’s own blood and Rubbing a skull with the ring finger, As soon as it dries You will destroy the object of accomplishment. If one is blazing with anger And recites with reddened eyes, The king will quickly die together with His army and his mount. A cat, a jewel-spitting mongoose, A raven, fox, and water fowl: Preparing the powerful dakinis, These are quickly attained. Have no doubts about this tantra. Make a thread of rabbit hairs And recite [the mantra] a thousand times. Whoever’s neck it is tied to Becomes like that. Reciting [it] a thousand times in the hand and While reciting each letter, Take the karavira flower. If you touch a pregnant mother The child is expelled from the womb And when released there is liberation. To whomever one makes A threatening mudra, that one will die, And again that one will be brought back to life.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las yi ge ha lnga'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF THE ACTIONS OF THE FIVE HA LETTERS” IS THE FORTY-SIXTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 47. The Ritual of All the Actions of the Mantra of the Dakini of All the Buddhas

f.d: 47. The Ritual of All the Actions of the Mantra of the Dakini of All the Buddhas
de nas yang dag bshad bya ba/ / mkha' 'gro kun gyi snying po ste/ / 'di ni brjod pa tsam gyis kyang / / dngos grub thams cad skyed byed yin/ /
Next, a further perfect explanation, The essence of all the dakinis. By merely reciting this All the realizations will be born.

de nas mkha' 'gro ma'i rig pa chen po bzlas na rigs thams cad dbang du byed par 'gyur ro/ / rtag tu bzlas brjod byas pas ni dpal chen po bskyed par 'gyur ro/ / mi rus kyi rgyu la phur bu sor drug pa byas la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas nas gang gi sgor sbas pa de'i rigs rgyud rnams gcod par 'gyur ro/ / zhing dang ra ba dang ma he dang glang po che dang / rta'i gnas su brkos te sbas na thams cad brlag par 'gyur ro/ / de nas rgyal po'am rgyal po'i blon po dbang du bya bar 'dod na rgyal po'i sgor sa las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan sor brgyad pa byas la mkhas pas bzhag nas nyin zhag dang po la ma tu lung ga'i me tog dang 'bras bu rnams dang ku su ma bsres pas sbyin sreg brgya stong byas na de dbang du 'gyur ro/ / sngags 'di nyid kyis dgug pa dang / gnon pa dang / skems pa dang / rmongs pa dang / rmugs pa dang / tshig 'phrog pa dang / long bar byed pa dang / dig pa nyid dang / slar gtong bar byed do/ / de nas skyes pa bud med du bya bar 'dod na skyes pa'i ro'i me tog dang / ka ga an di ka'i 'bras bu dang / khwa'i sen mo dang / rkang pa'i 'og gi pags pa cha mnyam par byas la ri bong gi khrag dang btags te/ ril bu bcu gcig byas la grib ma la skam mo/ / de bzhin du zhag bzang po la lag pa la bcings te nyi ma bcu gnyis pa la gang gi spyi bor phye ma bzhag pa de bud med du 'gyur ro/ /

Next, if one recites the great knowledge [mantra] of the dakinis, one will accomplish the subjugation of all lineages. If one constantly recites [the mantra], great glory is generated. With a ritual dagger made of human bone six finger [widths] in length, recite it one hundred and eight times. [Whoever’s] doorway you hide it in, his lineage will be annihilated. [Bury it] in a field for water buffalo, elephants, or horses, dig in that place, and if it is hidden there, they will all be destroyed. And then if one desires that the king or the king’s minister be controlled, the adept should make a mirror image of him from clay, eight fingers long, and hide it in the doorway of the kingdom. On the first day mix lunga flowers[94] together with fruits and saffron and perform one thousand burned offerings and he will be subjugated. By this mantra one can summon, subdue, confuse, emaciate, bewitch, steal words, blind, and intoxicate, as well as dispel. And then, the actions to perform if one wishes to be born as a woman: Assemble flowers and the fruit from a kakandaki tree and equal portions of a crow, [namely] the claw, the skin from the lower part of the feet, and the blood, as well as the blood of a rabbit. Grind them up into eleven pills, which are then dried in the shade. Similarly, on a good day bind them to your hands, and whomever’s head it is placed upon, on the twelfth day they will become a woman.

de nas skyes pa khyir bya bar 'dod na rgyal gyi lcags ne'u le'i mgo bor bzhag la mtshan mo bdun gyi bar du brgya stong sbyin sreg byas la nyin zhag brgyad pa la gur kum dang / mnyam por sbyar te lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas nas phye ma'i sbyin sreg byas la de'i thal ba gang gi spyi bor bzhag pa de khyir 'gyur ro/ / slar gso ba ni mtshan mo'i dus su mkha' 'gro ma rnams la mchod pa chen po byas te/ gtor ma byin na de'i 'og tu rnal mar 'gyur ro/ / rdzas rdzas ma yin par bya bar 'dod na/ gser shing gi 'bras bu sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas na rdzas ma yin par 'gyur ro/ / a ru ra'i sbyin sreg byas na rnal mar 'gyur ro/ / de nas smyo bar bya bar 'dod na bya chen po'i gnas kyi sbyin sreg byas na nyi ma bdun pa la smyo bar 'gyur ro/ / slar bzlog pa ni 'bras kyi phub ma'i sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro/ / byi la'i spu zla ba gzas zin pa'i tshe bsdus la gang gi ming nas smos nas sngags kyi sbyin sreg byas nas thal ba de gang gi spyi bor bzhag pa de byi lar 'gyur ro/ / slar bzlas na rnal mar 'gyur ro/ /

Then, if one wishes to be born a dog, you should take Gyal (Pushya) skymetal[95] and place it on the head of a jewel-spitting mongoose and perform eight thousand burned offerings over seven nights.[96] On the eighth day, with equal portions of saffron, recite [the mantra] one hundred and eight times and perform a burned offering with that powder. The one upon whose head you place that dust will become a dog. To restore him again, at night time make a great offering to the dakinis and offer tormas and he will transform back to his natural state. For one who desires to become material or immaterial, offer a hundred and eight burned offerings of the fruit of a golden tree and one will become immaterial. If one performs a burned offering of arura fruit, he will return to his natural state. It is said that if one wishes to make [someone] crazy, perform the burned offering in the place of a great bird.[97] If you do this, then on the seventh day [he] will become crazy. If you wish to restore him, offer rice husks in the burned offering and he will be pacified. Perform a burned offering with the hair of a cat during a lunar eclipse while saying that person’s name together with the mantra. Take the ash [from the burned offering] and place it on their head and they will become a cat. Recite it again and he will return to his natural state.

bya rog gi rgyus pa la srad bu byas pa bzung la mngon par bzlas te gang gi mgul du bcings pa de bya rog tu 'gyur ro/ / gang dang gang gi rgyus pas srad bu byas pa la mngon par bzlas te mgul du bcings pa de de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin du khwa dang thi ba dang rma bya dang chu skyar dang / 'ug pa dang / khra dang bya rgod kyi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ / ba lang gi spu las srad bu byas la lan brgyad brgya bzlas brjod byas te mgul du bcings na de ba lang du 'gyur ro/ / rkang bzhi pa la sogs pa gang dang gang gi spu las srad bu byas la mngon par bzlas te mgul du btags na de de'i gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ / bkrol na thar bar 'gyur ro/ / 'bras so ba la bzlas la nor gyi bdag po chen po'i khyim du bcug la lhag mas bdag nyid dbang bskur na mtshan bdun gyis so ba thams cad 'gugs par 'gyur ro/ /

With a string made of crow intestines, perform the recitation. Whomever’s neck you tie it around will become a crow. Anyone whose neck is bound with whatever intestines that have been [blessed] with [mantra] recitation will become just like that [aspect]. Likewise, they will take on the form of a dove, peacock, water fowl, owl, hawk, vulture, or dog. With a string of ox hair, say the recitation one hundred and eight times, and then if it is tied around someone’s neck they will transform into an ox. If a thread of hair made from any four-legged animal and so forth is bound to the neck of another, they will transform into that [animal]; if untied, they will become liberated. Recite it on unhusked grain and put it on the house of a great being, and then bestow empowerments upon oneself with the remnants for seven nights and all of his grain will be summoned.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags kyi las thams cad kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF ALL THE ACTIONS OF THE MANTRA OF THE DAKINI OF ALL THE BUDDHAS” IS THE FORTY-SEVENTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 48. The Ritual of the Secret Abode of All the Heroes and Yoginis

f.d: 48. The Ritual of the Secret Abode of All the Heroes and Yoginis

de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba/ / mkha' 'gro kun gyi dge ba gang / / snying po rnal 'byor ma kun gyi/ / 'dod don thams cad sgrub byed pa'o/ / gang zhig dran pa tsam gyis ni/ / 'jig rten gsum po g.yo byed cing / / rjes su dran pa tsam gyis kyang / / yang dag dngos grub rim gyis so/ /

Next, the further explanation of The virtuous dance of all the dakinis.[98] The essence of all the yoginis Accomplishes all the desired aims, Which by merely remembering Shakes the three worlds, And by mere subsequent mindfulness One will perfectly accomplish the stages.
hA swA Tapha hU~M hU~M ye nI r+NaN badzra ba ye nI ki DA d+d+ha bu rbas o~M/
HA SÖ PHAT HUM HUM YE NI NA WA VAJRA YE NI KI DA BUDDHA SARWA OM

sngags 'di bklags pas 'grub pa ste/ / las rnams kun byed dge ba yin/ / mkha' 'gro rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / / khaN+Da ro ha lA ma sogs/ / mkha' 'gro ma ni thams cad kyi/ / sngags ni 'di nyid yin par grags/ / sa 'og yang na mtho ris sam/ / de bzhin mi yul dag tu yang / / las ni gang dag yod pa dag / sngags kyis de dag thams cad bsgrub/ / dngos grub kun byed dge ba yin/ / dngos grub thams cad rab stsol ba/ / 'di las shin tu mchog gyur med/ / 'jig rten gsum na ci yang med/ / gang phyir 'di ni bla na med/ / las rnams thams cad sgrub byed yin/ / mkha' 'gro ma ni kun gyi gnas/ / mdor bshad rgyas par ma yin no/ / me tog 'bras bu sna tshogs kyis/ / ri bo bzang po bri bya zhing / / de yi steng du rtag bsgom pa/ / mkha' 'gro de bzhin lA ma dang / / khaN+Da ro ha rnal 'byor ma/ /

By reciting this mantra you will receive attainments, It is the accomplishment of all virtuous actions Of the dakinis. This mantra is famed as The essence of the yoginis [such as] Khandaroha, Lama, and so forth. The dakinis and yoginis, Below the ground as well as in the heavens, Likewise those in the lands of men And whatever actions there are, Through this mantra they are all accomplished. This is the virtuous means of attainments Bestowing all attainments. Other than this, there is nothing more sublime Existing in the three worlds. For which purpose this is unexcelled. All the actions will be accomplished And the excellent method of the deity is revealed. [Now] I will explain the abode of All the dakinis, briefly but not extensively. One should draw an excellent mountain With a variety of fruits and flowers. Continuously meditate that upon these are The dakinis such as Lama, Khandaroha, and Dakini.

dpa' bo rnams kyi dpa' bo nyid/ / ha ha he he zhes bya ba/ / dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi yi/ / mkha' 'gro dra ba'i bde mchog yin/ / rdo rje sems dpa' rnam snang mdzad/ / de bzhin pad+ma gar dbang dang / / shrI he ru ka nyid dang ni/ / mkha' snying dang ni rta mgrin nyid/ / rin chen rdo rje stobs po che/ / mig mi bzang dang 'jigs byed dang / / rdo rje bzang dang rab bzang dang / / rdo rje hU~M mdzad dpa' chen po/ / de bzhin rdo rje ral pa can/ / myu gu can dang rdo rje'i lus/ / rdo rje'i 'od ni nyid dag dang / / 'od dpag med dang lha yi dgra/ / de bzhin mche ba rnam gtsigs dang / / keng rus keng rus chen po dang / / thong pa'i dum bu la sogs pa/ /

The hero of the heroes Saying HA HA HE HE, Heruka is the net of the dakinis, Of the twenty-four heroes: Dorje Sempa (Vajrasattva), Nam Nang (Vairochana), Pema Karwang (Padmanarteshvara), Pel Traktung (Shri Heruka), Khanying (Akashagarbha), and Tamdrin (Hayagriva), Rinchen Dorje (Ratnavajra), Tobpoché (Mahabala), Mik Misang (Virupaksha), Jikché (Bhairava), Dorje Sangpo (Vajrabhadra), Rabsang (Subhadra), Dorje Humdze (Vajrahumkara), Pawoche (Mahavira), Dorje Relpachen (Vajrajatila), Myuguchen (Ankurika), Dorje Lü (Vajradehaka), Dorje Öd (Vajraprabha), Ödpakme (Amitabha) and the Lhayi Dra (Suravairi), Likewise, Chewa Nampartsik (Vikatadamstrina), Kengru (Kankala), Kengru Chenpo (Mahakankala), Thöpay Dumbu (Khandakapala), and so forth.

dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi yis/ / 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad khyab/ / dpa' bo rnams dang mkha' 'gro nyid/ / rnal 'byor ma ni rab gtum sogs/ / bya ba kun la sgrub pa pos/ / 'khor lor bzhugs par blta bar bya/ / grub 'dod shin tu mnyam bzhag pas/ / 'khor lo'i bdag nyid rtag tu bsgom/ / sngar bshad pa yi cho ga yis/ / mkha' 'gro dra ba'i bde mchog brjod/ / 'khor lo chen po grub kun gnas/ / de bzhin dngos grub kun gyi gzhi/ / 'di ni sangs rgyas bye ba dang / / dpa' bo bye bas legs par gsungs/ / mkha' 'gro ma ni re re yi/ / 'khor ni bye ba dag tu 'gyur/ / rnal 'byor ma ni mkha' 'gro nyid/ / gzugs can ma dang dum skyes ma/ / de bzhin lA ma la sogs ni/ / dngos grub kun byed dge ba yin/ /

The twenty-four heroes, The heroes and dakinis Pervade all these migrators. The yoginis, Rabtuma (Prachanda) and so forth Should be seen as abiding in the mandala. In all actions performed, the practitioner, Desiring power, should continuously meditate With excellent meditative concentration On the nature of the mandala. The ritual previously explained, Proclaimed by Heruka, the net of the dakinis, Abiding in all the attainments of the great mandala, Is the basis of all attainments. It was perfectly explained by the ten million Buddhas and ten million heroes. Each of the dakinis Is always attended by ten million Yoginis and dakinis: The yoginis and dakinis Suk Chenma (Rupini) and Dum Kyema (Khandaroha), Likewise Lama, and so forth. These accomplish the virtuous actions of the practitioner.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las dpa' bo dang mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi gnas gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'o// //
FROM THE SPEECH OF GLORIOUS HERUKA, “THE RITUAL OF THE SECRET ABODE OF ALL THE HEROES AND YOGINIS” IS THE FORTY-EIGHTH CHAPTER.

d.crumb: 49. The Ritual of Accomplishing the Complete Exchange of Form of the Seven-Birthed One

f.d: 49. The Ritual of Accomplishing the Complete Exchange of Form of the Seven-Birthed One

de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba/ / ji bzhin cho gas phyugs bsgrub bya/ / gang gis shes pa tsam gyis ni/ / myur du dngos grub thob 'gyur ba'o/ / sngags pas 'bras kyi phye ma las/ / rim bzhin du ni phyugs gzugs bya/ / mi dang ru sbal rnga mo dang / / bong bu spyang ki rta la sogs/ / de ltar sna tshogs phag dag ste/ / phyugs 'di dag tu shes par bya/ / mtshan nyid ji ltar gyur pa dang / / 'di rnams las ni bshad par bya/ / skye ba gcig dang skye ba gnyis/ / gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga nyid dam/ / skye ba drug dang bdun gyur pa/ / phyugs rnams su ni gdon mi za/ / gang gi kha yi dri zhim zhing / / mig mi 'dzums par rnam par blta/ / bden par smra zhing mthong na dga'/ / rtag tu dam chos dgar 'gyur zhing / / rang gi skye ba shes pa dang / / lus kyi dri ni rtag tu zhim/ / mtshan nyid 'di dag ldan par ni/ / skye ba bdun du 'byung ba yin/ / de ni zos pa tsam gyis ni/ / lha yi gzugs ni 'dzin par 'gyur/ / mnams pa'am reg pa tsam gyis sam/ / gang zhig thig le byed pa de/ / mod la 'grub par 'gyur ba ste/ / 'di ni rang dga'i gzugs 'chang 'gyur/ / de yi snying ka'i ro tsa na/ / mkhas pa yis ni blangs nas ni/ / snying po'i sngags ni bzlas nas su/ / de yi thig le bya ba yin/ / sems can gang dang gang gi ni/ / gzugs su byed par 'dod pa na/ / de dang de yi gzugs su ni/ / thig les 'gyur bar the tshom med/ / mkhas pas shing lo khu ba ni/ / ro tsa nar bcas blangs nas su/ / dpral bar thig le byas na ni/ / de gzugs 'gyur bar the tsom med/ / phyugs nyid kyi ni ba spu yis/ / lag pa spyi bor bcing bar bya/ / de yi yan lag lngar ldan zhing / / de yi spu dang rnam bsres pa/ / lag pa spyi bor bcings na ni/ / de yi gzugs 'gyur the tsom med/ / rnal 'byor pa ni bsgoms shing zlos/ / mi rnams nus pa ldan yin yang / / dka' zhing nyon mongs la dga' ba/ / dngos grub lam ni 'gog pa yin/ / glang po rta dang bong bu dang / / ru sbal rnga mo phag dang wa/ / khwa dang 'ug sogs bya rgod dang / / khrung khrung khra dang sa ra la/ / gzugs bzang ba dang gzugs ngan dang / / lha yi gzugs su de 'gyur ro/ / rnal 'byor dpa' chen rang dga'i gzugs/ / skye 'gyur 'di la the tsom med/ / 'di bas shin tu mchog grub pa/ / 'jig rten gsum na yod ma yin/ /

Next, further explanation according to The ritual for accomplishing the sacrificial animal, By merely knowing which The realizations are quickly attained. The mantrika should make the form of a sacrificial animal With rice powder according to the stages: A person, a turtle, and a camel, A donkey, a wolf, a horse, and so forth, And likewise a mottled pig. One should know these sacrificial animals. From these I will explain the actions In accordance with their characteristics. One birth and two births, Three, four, or five, Six rebirths or seven, Have no doubt these are the sacrificial animals.[99] Whoever has a sweet taste in their mouth, Looks without blinking, Speaks the truth, and looks [upon others] with love, Always delighting in the holy Dharma; He knows his own birth, His body always smells sweet: The one endowed with these characteristics Is the one arisen for seven births. By merely eating Smelling or touching that You will transform into the form of a god. Make that into a drop and You will instantly receive attainments And will quickly arise in that form. The adept takes the heart And recites the mantra. By reciting the essence mantra On that, make it into a drop, and Whatever the form of that living being Have no doubt you will be transformed Into that aspect through this drop. The adept takes the sap of a tree And places the drop on the forehead; Whatever form you wish for Have no doubt you will transform into that form. Bind your hands and the crown of your head With the hair of the sacrificial animal. If you mix his hairs Together with his five limbs[100] and Bind it to the hands [and] the top of the head, Have no doubt you will change into that form. Through meditation and recitation on yoga, Possessing human potential yet Delighting in the austerities and delusions, This will block the path to realizations. Elephants, horses, and donkeys, Turtles, camels, pigs, and foxes, Crows, owls, and so forth, vultures, Cranes,[101] falcons, and a curlew, Assuming good forms and bad forms Or the form of a god, Have no doubt that the yogi is the Great hero who will assume this form. Through this you will accomplish the utmost supreme That does not exist in the three worlds.
dpal he ru ka'i nges par brjod pa las skye ba bdun pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs yongs su brje ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa'o// //
