d.crumb: CHAPTER 9. Arrangement of Mantras

f.d: CHAPTER 9. Arrangement of Mantras

athātaḥ saṃpravakṣyāmi saṃpuṭodghātalakṣaṇaṃ || yena vijñātamātreṇa sādhakaḥ siddhim āpnuyāt || sādhyasya nābhimūle tu hastenotpāṭayed vratī || (1) herukapratirūpeṇādhyātmakakrūracetasā bhāvanāmātrakenaiva buddho 'pi naśyate dhruvaṃ || (2)

de nas kha sbyar 'byed pa yi/ / mtshan nyid yang dag rab tu bshad/ / gang gis rnam par shes tsam gyis/ / sgrub pos dngos grub thob 'gyur ba/ / bsgrub bya'i lte ba'i rtsa ba la/ / brtul zhugs can gyi lag pas gdon/ / he ru ka mnyam rnal 'byor gyis/ / nang gi ma rungs sems kyis ni/ / 'di ni bsgoms pa tsam gyis ni/ / sangs rgyas kyang ni nges par 'jig /

Now I shall expound that method of rending the enveloped [life-force], the mere concentrated visualisation of which attains his goal for the practitioner. The holder of the Vow should rend with the hand the base of the navel of the one to be destroyed, whilst assuming a nature similar to that of Heruka by being in an extremely fierce state of mind. By the mere emanation of this even a Buddha is definitely destroyed.

de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kha sbyar ni rnam par shes pa dang lus dag gi'o/ / 'byed pa ni tha dad du byed pa ste/ bsam gtan gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o/ / dngos grub ni khros pa'i las kyi dngos grub bo/ / 'khrugs shing zhes bya ba ni shin tu rngam pa'o/ / ma rung ba ni gsod pa'i sems so/ / bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'o/ / de nyid ni tsam zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gis so/ / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la/ sangs rgyas la sogs pas yang dag par bsrungs kyang ngo / /

saṃpuṭaṃ (the enveloped): Refers to the consciousness and body which are united. udghāta (rending): Refers to the rending of consciousness and body. dhyāna (concentrated visualisation): This is the unique feature of this practice. siddhi (accomplishment): Here refers to the'accomplishment of the goal of fierce rites. ādhyāta (extremely): Means being extremely cruel. krūra (fierce): Refers to the mind intent upon killing. bhāvanā (emanation): Refers to the method of emanation that is going to be described in the next three verses. mātra (mere): Means just by this method of emanation. buddho ’pi (even a Buddha): This implies that even a person who is well protected is destroyed.

māraṇaṃ kriyate kṛpayā śrāvayitvā gurau munau || śāsanāyāpacārī ca gurubuddhasya nāśakaḥ || (3) yatra dṛṣṭvā yathārūpam adhomukhaṃ tu bhāvayet || raktam udvamantañ caiva • kampayantaṃ samūrddhajaṃ || (4) tasya mārge sūcīṃ dhyāyāt praviśantīṃ vahnirūpiṇīṃ || hṛdaye hutāśanabījaṃ • dṛṣṭvā mārayet tatkṣaṇāt || (5)

bstan la gnod pa byed pa dang / / bla ma sangs rgyas 'jig pa ni/ / bla ma thub pa la zhus nas/ / snying rjes gsad par bya ba nyid/ / ji ltar phyugs kyi gzugs mthong nas/ / khrag ni skyugs pa nyid dang yang / / 'dar zhing mgo skyes grol ba dang / / kha ni 'og tu rnam par sgom/ / de yi lam du khab ni me'i/ / gzugs can 'jug par bsam pa ste/ / snying gar byin za'i sa bon nyid/ / dmigs nas skad cig gsod par byed/ /

After having announced the intention to the guru and accomplished beings, perform with mercy the rite of killing of one who is a non-believer of the teachings of the Buddha and the detractors of the gurus and Buddhas. One should emanate such a person, visualising his form as being upside down, vomiting blood, trembling and with hair in disarray. Imagine a blazing needle entering his back. Then by envisioning the seed-syllable of the Fire element in his heart he is killed instantly.

mthong nas zhes bya ba ni dran nas so/ / ji ltar gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzugs kyis so/ / khab ni zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i khab bo/ / me'i gzugs can ni 'bar bar 'gyur ba'o/ / byin za'i sa bon ni re pha rab tu 'bar ba'o/ / dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms nas so/ /

dṛṣṭvā (visualising): Means imagining. yathārūpaṃ (his form): Means imagining his form as described. sūcīṃ (needle): Refers to a vajra needle. vahnirūpiṇaṃ (blazing): Means fiery. hutāśanabījaṃ (seed-syllable of the Fire element): Refers to the seed-syllable raṃ. dṛṣṭvā (envisioning): Means conceiving in the mind the seed-syllable as being aflame.
asmin tantre na hotavyaṃ • mudrābandhakriyā na ca || paṭhitasiddhaṃ mahātantraṃ • dhyānamātreṇa sidhyati || (6)
rgyud 'di la ni sreg blugs med/ / phyag rgya bcing dang bya ba'ang med/ / rgyud chen bklags pas 'grub pa nyid/ / bsam gtan tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur/ /

In this tantric practice there is no need for fire-sacrifices and the performance of hand-gestures. This great tantric technique is effective on just being recited and one can accomplish merely by concentrated visualisation.
bklags pas 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don ni 'grub par bden no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o/ /
paṭhitasiddhaṃ (effective on just being recited): Means the recitation of the mantra causes the desired effect.
rahasyaṃ paramaṃ vakṣye • śṛṇu devī varānane || bhavasya śodhanaṃ ramyam avikalpasiddhidāyakaṃ || (7)
rtog med dngos grub sbyin pa po/ / srid pasbyong ba nyams dga' bar/ / gsang ba mchog ni bshad bya yis/ / nyon cig lha mo bzhin bzangs ma/ /
Listen O beautiful Goddess, I shall tell you that supreme secret which is the delightful purification of phenomenal existence and which gives the accomplishment of the nonconceptual state.
gsang ba ni skal ba med pa'i sems can gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro/ / mchog ces bya ba ni ngal ba med pa nyid mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'o/ / rtog med ces bya ba ni the tshom med pa'o/ /

rahasyaṃ (secret): It is a secret because it is beyond the grasp of unworthy non-initiates. paramaṃ (supreme): It is supreme because the desired goal is easily accomplished. avikalpa (non-conccptual state): Refers to a state without doubts.

paśya devī mahāratnaṃ jvālāmālākulaṃ vapuḥ || ayogyaḥ syād aviddhena viddhaḥ san rucidāyakaḥ || (8) tadvat saṃsārakaṃ ratnaṃ • pañcakāmagunaiḥ yutaṃ || aviśuddhaṃ viṣatāṃ yāti • viśuddhaṃ pīyūṣavad bhavet || (9)

rin chen gzi brjid 'bar ba yi/ / phreng ba 'khrugs pa lha mo ltos/ / ma phug pas ni sbyor bral 'gyur/ / phug pas dga' ba sbyin pa'o/ / de ltar 'khor bar 'dod pa yi/ / yon tan lnga ldan rin chen nyid/ / ma dag pas ni dug tu 'gro/ / dag pas bdud rtsi lta bur 'gyur/ /

Behold, O Goddess, the great gem which is the body surrounded by a circle of flames. A gem is useless when uncut but when cut it gives delight. Likewise the gem of phenomenal existence, which is united with the five desires, when not purified becomes poisonous and when purified becomes nectar-like.

rin chen zhes bya ba ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'o/ / rin chen des ci zhig ce na/ lus zhes bya ba gsungs te/ gnyug mar gnas pa'i lus so/ / ltos zhes bya ba ni lha mo skye zhes bya ba'o/ / 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen pos 'bar ba'o/ / phreng ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma bco lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi rtsa'o/ / 'khrugs pa ni de'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas pa'o/ / sbyor bral 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la/ ma phug ces bya ba ni so sor ma phug pa ste/ mi shes na ni 'khor ba pa nyid du 'gyur te/ ji ltar rin po che ma phug pa rgyan gyi las thams cad la mkho ba ma yin pa de bzhin du/ lus 'di yang mi shes na ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi nus pa yin no/ / rab tu phug pas ci zhig byed ce na/ dga' ba sbyin pa po zhes bya ba gsungs te/ mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed ces bya ba'o/ / de ltar zhes bya ba lus ji lta ba de ltar 'khor ba'i rin po che yang yin no/ / bdud rtsi ni mi gnas pa'o/ /

mahāratnaṃ (the great gem): Refers to the wish-fulfilling gem. What is this gem? This is said: vapuḥ (body): Refers one’s own body. paśya devi ...jvālā (behold O goddess ... flames): ‘flames’ refers to the flame of Great Bliss. mālā (circle): Refers to the nāḍīs which arc of the nature of the fifteen Yoginīs. ākulaṃ (surrounded): Means the nāḍīs arc well established in the body. ayogyaḥ syād aviddhena (useless when uncut): ‘Uncut’ means not cut and polished, the ignorance of phenomenal experience being similar to that. Just as an uncut gem is unfit for use in any kind of jewelry, likewise ignorance of the nāḍīs docs not lead to the attainment of the enlightened state. What the cut gem does is said by: nicidāyakaḥ (gives delight): Means becomes a desirable object, tadvat (likewise): As is the body so is the gem of phenomenal existence. pīyūṣaṃ (nectar): Refers to the nectar of immortality.

saṃsāraṃ herukākāraṃ • jagaduttāraṇam prabhuṃ || yena rūpeṇa saṃbhūtaṃ tad ahaṃ vacmi śṛṇvatāṃ || (10) kṛpayā locane rakte kṛṣṇāṅgo maitricittataḥ || saṃgrahavastucatuṣkena catvāraś caraṇāḥ smṛtāḥ || (11) aṣṭāsyāṃ vimokṣā aṣṭau śūnyatā ṣoḍaśa bhujāḥ || mudreṇa pañcabuddhāḥ syuḥ kruddho duṣṭavineyataḥ || (12) māṃsena Pukkasī khyātā Śavarī raktena kalpitā || Caṇḍālī śukram ity uktaṃ Ḍombī ca medamajjayoḥ || carma bodhyaṅgasaptan tu • asthi satyacatuṣṭayaṃ || (13)

'khor ba'i rnam pa he ru ka/ / 'gro ba sgrol ba'i gtso bo nyid/ / gang gi gzugs kyis 'gyur ba nyid/ / de ni nga yis smra yis nyon/ / snying rje'i spyan ni dmar po la/ / byams pa'i thugs la yan lag gnag / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yis ni/ / zhabs ni rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod/ / zhal brgyad rnam par thar pa brgyad/ / phyag ni stong pa bcu drug nyid/ / gug skyed kyis ni sangs rgyas lnga/ / gdug pa 'dul phyir khro bo nyid/ / sha ni puk+ka sI ru brjod/ / de bzhin khrag ni ri khrod me/ / gdol ba mo ni khu bar brjod/ / g.yung mo rkang dang tshil bu dag / pags pa byang chub yan lag bdun/ / rus pa bden pa bzhi po nyid/ /

Listen, I shall speak of how the phenomenal manifests as aspects of the form of Heruka, the Lord who is the saviour of the world. The blood-shot eyes are because of mercy; the black body is from the attitude of friendliness; the four feet are from the four methods of conversion; the eight faces are the eight Vimokṣas; the sixteen arms are the sixteen Voidnesses; the Five Symbolic Ornaments are the Five Buddhas and Wrath is for the subduing of the wicked. The meat is Pukkasī, blood Śavarī, semen Caṇḍālī, fat and marrow Ḍombī, skin the seven limbs of Enlightenment and bones the Four Noble Truths.

gang gi gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi'o/ / zhabs ni gshegs par byed pa'o/ / rnam par thar pa ni rnam par thar pa rnams so/ / gug skyed ces bya ba ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'i tshad rnams so/ /
yena rūpeṇa (how): Means by what principle. caraṇāḥ (feet): Refers to the feet. vimokṣā: Refers to the eight aspects of the Release. mudrā (the Symbolic Ornaments): Refers to the circlet etc.
devy uvāca / mantroddhāraṃ bhavet kīdṛk kathayasva mahāsukha || yena mantreṇa jantūnāṃ karmāṇi yānti siddhitāṃ || (14)
bdag med mas gsol ba/ sngags btu ba ni ji ltar 'gyur/ / gang gi sngags kyis skye bo yi/ / las kyi dngos grub 'gyur ba nyid/ / bde ba chen pos bshad du gsol/ /
The Goddess asked: Please tell me, O being of Great Bliss, what is the order of seed-syllables of those mantras by means of which men attain accomplishment of the various rites.
sngags btu ba'i zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i zhu ba'i tshigs bcad do/ /
mantroddhāraṃ ityādi (order of seed-syllables of... mantras etc.): This verse is the question of the Goddess.
bha[ga]vān āha mahāvajrī vajrasāravapur mahān || śṛṇu devi mahābhāge mantraṃ te kathayāmy ahaṃ || (15)
bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can chen po/ rdo rje snying po gzi brjid chen pos bka' stsal pa/ sngags ni khyod la ngas bshad kyis/ / lha mo shes rab chen mo nyon/ /
Bhagavān, the great Adamantine One, the great one whose body is the essence of the Vajra, replied: Listen O auspicious Goddess, I shall tell you the mantra.
bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po'i tshig go/ / lha mo shes rab chen mo nyon/ /zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'o/ /
bhagavān aha ityādi (Bhagavān... replied etc.): These are the words of the writer of this tantra. śṛṇu devī ityādi (Listen O ... Goddess etc.): These are Bhagavān’s words.
ādau vairocanaṃ dattva • uṣmāṇāñ ca caturthakaṃ || pukkasīśobhanaṃ divyaṃ śūnyākrāntaṃ śuklavarṇaṃ || svāhāntaṃ niyojayet || anena lakṣajāpena stambhayej jagat sarvadā || (16)

dang por rnam par snang mdzad sbyin/ / uSh+mA rnams kyi da ki pa la/ / puk+ka sIs brgyan stong pas mnan/ / mdog dkar mthar ni swA hA sbyar/ / 'dis ni bzlas pa 'bum gyis ni/ / 'gro ba rtag tu rengs par byed/ /

The mantra is composed of the Vairocana seed-syllable first, then the fourth sibilant with Pukkasī and the white Sūnya and svāhā at the end. By reciting this mantra one hundred thousand times the world is paralysed.
rnam par snang mdzad ni oM mo/ / uSh+ma rnams kyi bzhi ba ni yi ge ha'o/ / puk+ka sI ni u'o/ / stong pa ni thig le'o/ / mthar ni swA hA zhes bya ba ni mthar swA hA zhes sbyar ba'o/ /

vairocanaṃ (the Vairocana seed-syllable): Is the seed-syllable oṃ. uṣmāṇañ ca caturthakaṃ (the fourth sibilant): Is the letter ha. pukkasī: Refers to the vowel ū. śūnyaṃ: Is the sound ṃ. svāhāntaṃ (svāhā at the end): Means at the end the word svāhā is placed.
ādau varṇādhipaṃ dattva tadanu khecariṃ tataḥ || svāhāntaṃ yojitaṃ kṛtvā buddhān api vaśīkaret || (17)
dang por yi ge'i bdag po bzhag / de rjes mkha' spyod ma de nas/ / mthar ni swA hA sbyar byas nas/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyang dbang du byed/ /
First the Chief of Letters, then Khecarī and Svāhā at the end. This subdues even Buddhas.
yig 'bru'i bdag po ni oM mo/ / mkha' spyod ma ni aM ngo / /
varṇādhipaṃ (Chief of Letters): Is oṃ. khecarīṃ: Refers to aṃ.
vedānām ādimaṃ dattvā prathamasya dvitīyakaṃ || śūnyaṃ svāhāntaṃ yojayed buddhānām apy uccāṭayet || (18)
rig byed rnams kyi dang po sbyin/ / dang po yi ni gnyis pa la/ / stong bcas mtha' ni swA hA sbyar/ / sangs rgyas kyang skrod shes rab can/ /
The first of the Vedas, then the second of the first [group of consonants] with a Sūnya and svāhā at the end. This drives away even Buddhas.
dang po yi ni gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni kha'o/ /
prathamasya dvitīyakaṃ (second of the first): Is kha.
ādau vairocanaṃ dattva dvitīyasya tṛtīyakaṃ || ra-yuktaṃ vāribhūṣitaṃ śūnyaṃ svāhāntasaṃyuktaṃ || dveṣayet sarvamānuṣān || (19)
dang por rnam par snang mdzad sbyin/ / gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa la/ / rwa dang ldan zhing chu mas brgyan/ / stong bcas swA hA yang dag ldan/ / mi rnams thams cad sdang bar byed/ /
First Vairocana, then the third of the second along with ra, Van and śūnya and svāhā at the end. This causes hatred in all men.
gnyis pa yi ni gsum pa zhes bya ba ni dza'o/ / b+ha ris zhes bya ba ni i'o/ /
dvitīyasya tṛtiyakaṃ (third of the second): Is ja. vāri: Is i.
ādau varṇeśvaraṃ dattvā pañcamasya tṛtīyakaṃ || saśūnyaṃ ḍākinīyuktaṃ svāhāntam abhicārukaṃ || (20)
dang po yi ge'i dbang phyug bzhag / lnga pa nyid kyi gsum pa la/ / stong pa mkha' 'gro ma dang ldan/ / mthar ni swA hA mngon spyod che/ /
First the Chief of Letters, then the third of the fifth with Sūnya and Ḍākinī and svāhā at the end. This is the mantra for Mesmerising.
yig 'bru'i dbang phyug ni o mo/ / lnga pa nyid kyi gsum pa ni yi ge ba'o/ / mkha' 'gro ma ni yi ge u'o/ /
vaṃeśvaraṃ (Lord of Letters): Is oṃ. pañcamasya tṛtīyakaṃ (third of the fifth): Is ba. ḍākinī: Refers to u.
varṇajyeṣṭaṃ punar dattvā HŪṂ-kāraraktasaṃnibhaṃ || svāhāntaṃ kārṣayet sadya rambhādīnān tilottamāṃ || (21)
yang ni yi ge'i thu bo sbyin/ / hU~M ni khrag dang 'dra ba yi/ / mthar ni swA hA thig le mchog / dga' bzang ma sogs rtag tu 'gugs/ /
First the eldest of the letters, then the red hūṃ followed by svāhā at the end. This instantly attracts Rambhā, Tilottamā and the other [celestial maidens].
yig 'bru'i thu bo ni oM mo/ /
varṇajyeṣṭha (eldest of the letters): Is oṃ.
ādau mohakulaṃ dattva GHU-kāraṃ saṃprayojayet || svāhāntaṃ ca punaḥ kṛtvā mārayet suramānuṣān || (22)
gti mug rigs ni dang por sbyin/ / g+hu ni yang dag rab tu sbyar/ / mthar ni swA hA yang byas na/ / lha dang mi rnams gsod par byed/ /
First the Mohakula, then ghu and svāhā at the end. This kills gods and men.

prathamasya prathaman tu vajraḍākinīyogitaṃ || ādau vairocanaṃ dattvā • antasthānāṃ dvitīyakaṃ || (23) vajraḍākinīsaṃyuktaṃ punaḥ prathamasyāgrakaṃ || vajraḍākinīsaṃyuktaṃ antasthānāṃ tṛtīyakaṃ || (24) punas tenaiva saṃyuktam upari caurībhūṣitaṃ || HRĪḤ-kāraṃ yojayet tatra svāhāntaṃ punar ācaret || kurukullāmantraḥ / (25)

dang por rnam par snang mdzad bzhag / dang po nyid kyi dang po la/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang sbyar/ / mthar gnas pa yi gnyis pa la/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang ldan/ / yang na dang po'i rtse mo la/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang ldan/ / mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa la/ / yang ni de nyid yang dag ldan/ / steng du chom rkun ma yis brgyan/ / de rjes hrIHyis rnam par sbyar/ / mthang yang swA hA spyod pa nyid/ / ku ru kul+le'i sngags so/ /

At the beginning Vairocana, then the first Of the first with Vajraḍākinī, then the second of the semi-vowels with Vajraḍākinī, then the first of the first with Vajraḍākinī, then the third of the semi-vowels with Vajraḍākinī, then the third of the semi-vowels with Caurī, then hrīḥ and svāhā at the end. This is the Kurukullā mantra.

gti mug rigs zhes bya ba ni oM mo/ / dang po rnams kyi dang po ni yi ge ka'o/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni yi ge u thung ngo / / mthar gnas pa'i gnyis pa ni ra'o/ / mthar gnas gsum pa ni la'o/ / tsau rI ma ni o'o/ /

prathamasya prathamaṃ (first of the first): Is ka. vajraḍākinī: Is u. antasthānāṃ dvitīyakaṃ (second of the semi-vowels): Is ra. antasthānāṃ tṛtīyakaṃ (third of the semi-vowels): Is la. caurī: Refers to e.

OṂ-kārādicaturthasya tṛtīyaṃ caurībhūṣitaṃ || antasthānāṃ caturthakaṃ picuvajraprayojitaṃ || (26) uṣmānāñ ca caturthakaṃ pukkāsyāś ca vibhūṣitaṃ || śūnyakrāntaṃ triguṇitaṃ pañcamasya dvitīyakaṃ || tṛtīyasya prathamaṃ svāhāntaṃ hevajrasya hṛdayaṃ / (27)

oM ni dang po bzhi pa yi/ / gsum pa chom rkun ma yis brgyan/ / mthar gzhas pa yi bzhi pa la/ / pi tsu badzra sbyar pa dang / / uSh+mA rnams kyi bzhi pa la/ / puk+ka sI yis rnam par brgyan/ / stong pas mnan cing sum 'gyur nyid/ / lnga pa yi ni gnyis pa dang / / gsum pa'i dang po mthar swA hA/ / kye'i rdo rje'i snying po'o/ /

The heart mantra of Hevajra is: oṃ followed by the third of the fourth with Caurī, then the fourth semi-vowel, then piccu vajra, then thrice, the fourth sibilant with Pukkasī and Śūnya, then the second of the fifth with the first of the third and svāhā at the end.

bzhi pa'i gsum pa da'o/ / mthar gnas bzhi pa ni wa'o/ / uSh+ma rnams kyi bzhi pa ni ha'o/ / puk+ka sI ni dbyangs kyi drug pa'o/ / lnga pa nyid kyi gnyis pa ni pha'o/ / gsum pa'i dang po ni yi ge Ta'o/ /

caturthasya tṛtīyaṃ (third of the fourth): Is da. antasthānāṃ caturthakaṃ (fourth semi-vowel): Is va. uṣmānāñ ca caturthakaṃ (fourth sibilant): Is ha. pukkasī: Refers to u. pañcamasya dvitīyakaṃ (second of the fifth): Is pha.

vairocanādijvalajvalayojitaṃ / pañcamasya caturthaṃ tu antasthānāṃ prathamena yuktaṃ ghasmarībhūṣitaṃ || (28) uṣmānāñ ca caturthakaṃ vajraḍākinībhūṣitaṃ || śūnyākrāntaṃ triguṇitaṃ pañcamasya dvitīyakaṃ || tṛtīyasya prathamaṃ svāhāntaṃ caturbhujasya mantraḥ / (29)

snang mdzad dang por dz+wa la gnyis/ / sbyar nas lnga ba'i bzhi pa la/ / mthar gnas rnams kyi dang po ldan/ / g+hasma rIs ni rnam par brgyan/ / uSh+mA rnams kyi bzhi pa la/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yis brgyan/ / stong pas mnan cing sum 'gyur nyid/ / lnga pa yi ni gnyis pa dang / / gsum pa'i dang po mthar swA hA/ phyag bzhi pa'i sngags so/ /

The mantra of the four-armed Hevjara is: Vairocana first, then jvala jvala, then the fourth of the fifth with the first semivowel which is with Ghasmarī, then thrice, the fourth sibilant with Vajraḍākinī and Śūnya, then the second of the fifth with the first of the third and svāhā at the end.
lnga pa'i bzhi pa ni b+ha'o/ / mthar gnas pa'i dang po ni ya'o/ /
pañcamasya caturthaṃ (fourth of the fifth): Is bha. antasthānāṃ prathamaṃ (first semi-vowel): Is ya.

vairocanādi prathamasya {ca} prathamam abhyantaragaurīśobhitaṃ || tṛtīyasya {ca} prathamam abhyantaragaurībhūṣitaṃ || (30) dviguṇīkṛtya pañcamasya tṛtīyaṃ dvitīyasya tṛtīyaṃ vahnibhūṣitaṃ HŪṂ-kāratrayayojitaṃ / pañcamasya dvitīyaṃ tṛtīyasya prathamaṃ svāhāntaṃ ṣaḍbhujasya mantraḥ / (31)

dang por rnam snang dang po yi/ / dang po nang gi dkar mos brgyan/ / gsum pa nyid kyi dang po la/ / nang gi dkar mos rnam par brgyan/ / nyis 'gyur lnga pa'i gsum pa dang / / gnyis pa'i gsum pa me yis brgyan/ / hU~M gi rnam pa gsum sbyar nas/ / lnga pa nyid kyi gnyis pa dang / / gsum pa'i dang po mthar swA hA/ / phyag drug pa'i sngags so/ /

The mantra of the six-armed Hevajra is: Vairocana first, then twice the first of the first with the inner Gaurī followed by the first of the third with the inner Gaurī, then the third of the fifth, then the third of the second with Vahni, then hūṃ thrice, then the second of the fifth, then the first of the third and svāhā at the end.
g+hasma rI ni yi ge o'o/ / dang po'i dang po ni ka'o/ / nang gi gau rI ni i'o/ / gsum pa nyid kyi dang po ni Ta'o/ / lnga pa'i gsum pa ni ba'o/ / gnyis pa'i gsum pa ni dza'o/ /

abhyantaragaurī (inner Gaurī): Refers to i. tṛtīyasya prathamam (first of the third): Is ta. pañcamasya tṛtīyaṃ (third of the fifth): Is ba. dvitīyasya tṛtīyaṃ (third of the second): Is ja. vahni: Is raṃ.

vairocanādicaturthasya prathamaṃ hutāśanasaṃyuktaṃ vetālīvibhūṣitaṃ / antasthānāṃ tṛtīyakaṃ ghasmarībhūṣitaṃ / prathamasya prathamam antasthānāṃ prathamena yuktaṃ vajrābhūṣitaṃ / KṢA-kāraṃ caurībhūṣitaṃ / pañcamasya prathamaṃ / uṣmāṇāṃ caturthakaṃ vajraḍākinībhūṣitaṃ / śūnyākrāntaṃ triguṇitaṃ phaṭ svāhāntaṃ dvibhujasya / (33)

dang po rnam snang bzhi pa yi/ / dang po byin za yang dag ldan/ / ro langs ma yis rnam par brgyan/ / mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa la/ / g+hasma rI yis rnam par brgyan/ / dang po yi dang po la/ / mthar gnas pa yi dang po dang / / rdo rje ma yis rnam par brgyan/ / k+Sha ni chom rkun ma yis brgyan/ / lnga pa nyid kyi dang po dang / / uSh+mA rnams kyi bzhi pa la/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yis brgyan/ / stong pas mnan cing sum 'gyur te/ / phaT dang mthar ni swA hA nyid/ / phyag gnyis pa'i sngags so/ /

The mantra of the two-armed Hevajra is: Vairocana at the beginning, then the first of the fourth with Hutāśana and Vetālī, then the third semi-vowel with Ghasmarī, then the first of the first along with the first semi-vowel and Vajrā, then kṣa with Caurī, then the first of the fifth, then thrice the fourth sibilant with Vajraḍākinī and Śūnya, then phaṭ and svāhā at the end.

bzhi pa'i dang po ni ta'o/ / byin za ni re phA'o/ / be tA lI ni e'o/ / mthar gnas pa'i gsum pa ni la'o/ / dang po'i dang po ni ka'o/ / mthar gnas pa'i dang po ni ya'o/ / rdo rje ma ni a'o/ / tsau rI ni ai'o/ / lnga pa'i dang po ni pa'o/ /

caturthasya prathamaṃ (first of the fourth): Is ta. hutaśanaṃ: Refers to ra. vetālī: Refers to ai. antasthānaṃ tṛtīyakam (third semi-vowel): Is la. prathamasya prathamaṃ (first of the first): Is ka. antasthānāṃ prathamaṃ (first semi-vowel): Is ya. vajrā: Refers to a. caurī: Refers to e. pañcamasya prathamaṃ (first of the fifth): Is pa.

nairātmyā prathamasya prathamaṃ dvitīyasya prathamaṃ tṛtīyasya prathamaṃ caturthasya prathamaṃ pañcamasya prathamam antasthānāṃ prathamam uṣmāṇāṃ prathamaṃ vairocanādisvāhāntaṃ / purakṣobhanamantro lakṣajāpaḥ / (34)

bdag med dang po'i dang po dang / / gnyis pa nyid kyi dang po dang / / gsum pa nyid kyi dang po dang / / bzhi ba yi ni dang po dang / / lnga pa yi ni dang po dang / / mthar gnas rnams kyi dang po dang / / uSh+mU rnams kyi dang po nyid/ / dang por rnam snang mthar swA hA/ / grong khyer dkrug pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa ni 'bum mo/ /

The mantra to cause a city to tremble, which should be recited one hundred thousand times, is: Vairocana at the beginning, then Nairātmyā, then the first of the first, then the first of the second, then the first of the third, then the first of the fourth, then the first of the fifth, then the first semi-vowel, then the first sibilant and svāhā at the end.

bdag med ma ni a'o/ / dang po'i dang po ni ka'o/ / gnyis pa'i dang po ni tsa'o/ / gsum pa'i dang po ni Ta'o/ / bzhi pa'i dang po ni ta'o/ / lnga pa'i dang po ni pa'o/ / mthar gnas pa'i dang po ni ya'o/ / uSh+ma rnams kyi dang po ni sha'o/ /

nairātmyā: Refers to a. prathamasya prathamaṃ (first of the first): Is ka. dvitīyasya prathamaṃ (first of the second): Is ca. tṛtīyasya prathamaṃ (first of the third): Is ṭa. caturthasya prathamaṃ (first of the fourth): Is ta. pañcamasya prathamaṃ (first of the fifth): Is pa. antasthānaṃ prathamam (first semi-vowel): Is ya. uṣmāṇāṃ prathamaṃ (first sibilant): Is śa.
antasthānāṃ dvitīyan tu KṢA-kāradvayaṃ / madhye punar antasthānāṃ dvitīyakaṃ / HŪṂ-kāratrayaṃ vairocanādi PHAṬ-kāravidarbhitaṃ svāhāntaṃ / bhūmiśodhanamantraḥ / (35)

mthar gnas rnams kyi gnyis pa dang / / k+Sha yi rnam pa nyis 'gyur nyid/ / hUM gi rnam pa gsum dang ldan/ / dang por rnam snang phaT nyid kyi/ / rnam pa nang bcug mthar swA hA/ / sa sbyangs pa'i sngags so/ /
The mantra for the purification of the site is: Vairocana at the beginning, then twice the second semi-vowel with kṣa, then hūṃ thrice, then phaṭ and svāhā at the end.
mthar gnas pa'i gnyis pa ni ra'o/ /
antasthānāṃ dviuyaṃ (second semi-vowel): Is ra.
vairocanādi tadanu vajrā HŪṂ-kārāntaṃ khānapānādhiṣṭhānamantraḥ / (36)
dang por rnam snang de rjes su/ / rdo rje ma yi mtha' ru hUM/ / bza' ba dang btung ba byin gyis brlab pa'o/ /
The mantra for the empowerment of food and drink is: Vairocana at the beginning, the vajrā and hūṃ at the end.

vairocanādi tadanu A-kāro mukhaṃ / uṣmāṇān tritīyakaṃ / antasthānāñ caturthakam upari vahnibhūṣitaṃ || dharmāṇāṃ / tadanu vajrā cādyanutpannatvāt • OṂ ĀḤ HŪṂ PHAṬ SVĀHĀ sarvabhautikabalimantraḥ / (37)

dang por rnam par snang mdzad nyid/ / de rjes a ka ro mu kha~M/ / uSh+mA rnams kyi gsum pa dang / / mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa ni/ / steng du me yis rnam par brgyan/ / d+harmA NA~M de rjes rdo rje ma/ / byin la dra nu t+pan+na twA ta/ / oM AHhU~M phaT swA hA/ / 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags so/ /

The mantra for all the demi-gods is: Vairocana at the beginning, then akāro mukhaṃ, then the third sibilant, then the fourth semi-vowel with Vahni above it, then dharmāṇāṃ, then Vajra followed by ādyanutpannatvāt oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.
rdo rje ma ni a'o/ /
vajrā: Refers to ā.
mantroddhārapaṭalo navamaḥ ||
kye'i rdo rje las sngags btu ba'i le'u ste dgu pa'o// //
Thus ends the Ninth, the chapter regarding the Arrangement of the Mantras.
dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rnal 'byor rin po che'i phreng ba las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o// //
Thus ends the Ninth Chapter of the Second Part of the Hevajra Pañjikā known as the Yogaratnamālā.

d.crumb: CHAPTER 10. Recitation of Mantras

f.d: CHAPTER 10. Recitation of Mantras
athāto Vajrasattvākhyaḥ sarvadharmaikasamvaraḥ || Nairātmyāṃ cumbayitvā tu jāpaviṣayaṃ prakāśate || (1)
de nas chos kun sdom gcig pa'i/ / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes byas gsungs/ / bdag med ma la 'o mdzad nas/ / bzlas pa'i yul ni rab tu dbye/ /
Then the one Concealed Essence of all natures who is known as Vajrasattva, after kissing Nairātmyā, expounded upon the subject of mantra recitation.
de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la/ sdom gcig pa zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i sdom pa'o/ / bzlas pa ni bzlas brjod do/ / de'i yul ni phreng ba'o/ /

ekasaṃvaraḥ (the one Concealed Essence): Refers to the one without a second, the best of essences. jāpavisayaṃ (subject of mantra recitation): Here ‘subject’ refers to the related subject of the beads of the rosary used while reciting mantras.

sphaṭikena stambhanaṃ jāpyaṃ • vaśye ca raktacandanaṃ || riṣṭikayābhicārukaṃ • vidveṣaṃ niraṃśukais tathā || (2) uccāṭanam aśvahaḍḍenākarṣaṇaṃ brahmāsthinā || varṣārpaṇaṃ gajāsthikaiḥ māraṇaṃ mahiṣasya ca || (3)

shel gyis rengs pa'i bzlas pa nyid/ / dbang la tsan+dan dmar po nyid/ / lung tang gis ni mngon spyod nyid/ / ni raM shus ni sdang ba la/ / rta yi rus pas skrod baM nyid/ / bram ze'i rus pas 'gugs pa nyid/ / glang po'i rus pas char pa la/ / ma he yis kyang gsad pa la/ /

The recitation of the mantra for the rite of Paralysing should be performed by using crystal beads; for Subduing red sandalwood beads; for Mesmerising soap-tree wood beads; for Causing hatred human bone beads; for Driving away horse bone beads; for Attracting beads of Brahmin’s bone; for Causing Rain elephant bone beads and for Killing buffalo bone beads.
ma he yis kyang zhes bya ba ni ma he'i rus pa'i phreng bas zhes bya ba'i don to/ /
mahiṣasya (buffalo): Means with a rosary made of buffalo bone beads.
las so so'i dam tshig bya ba bstan pa'i phyir
Now the different sacraments for the various rites are mentioned:

stambhane kṣīrapānaṃ tu vaśye svacchandam ācaret || māraṇe sihlakaṃ caiva • ākṛṣṭau ca catuḥsamaṃ || (4) vidveṣe śālijaṃ proktaṃ uccāṭane kasturikā || athavā antaśvam ādiśvaṃ nādiṃ gādiṃ hādiṃ tathaiva ca || (5)

rengs pa 'o ma'i btung ba nyid/ / dbang la rang gi 'dun pas spyad/ / gsad pa la ni sih+la nyid/ / dgug pa la ni bzhi mnyam nyid/ / sdang la sA lu skyes pa brjod/ / bskrad pa nyid la gla rtsir brjod/ / yang na mtha'i shwa dang / dang po'i shwa dang / na dang po dang / ga dang po dang / ha dang po nyid kyang de bzhin no/ /

Whilst performing the rite of Paralysing milk is drunk; whilst Subduing use the sacrament of one’s own desire; whilst Killing, female sexual fluids; whilst Attracting, the excrements; whilst Causing hatred, human flesh and whilst Driving away urine. Or else use [the flesh of] horse, dog, man, ox and elephant.
rengs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o/ /
stambhane ityādi (Paralysing etc.): The meaning is clear.
jāpapaṭalo nāma daśamaḥ ||
kye'i rdo rje las bzlas pa'i le'u ste bcu pa'o// //
Thus ends the Tenth, known as the Mantra Recitation Chapter.
dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rnal 'byor rin po che'i phreng ba las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu pa'i 'grel pa'o// //
Thus ends the Tenth Chapter of the Second Part of the Hevajra Pañjikā known as the Yogaratnamālā.

f.d: CHAPTER 11. Means to Attain the Innate
gāḍheṇāliṃgya Hevajraṃ saṃpīḍyādharaṃ dantakaiḥ || Nairātmyā pṛcchate tatra dehināṃ kularūpakaṃ || (1)
kye'i rdo rje la dam 'khyud cing / / tshems kyis ma mchu btsin nas ni/ / lus can rnams kyi rigs kyi gzugs/ / de la bdag med mas zhus pa/ /
After intensely embracing Hevajra and biting his lips, then Nairātmyā asked regarding the characteristics of the families of human beings.

bhage liṅgaṃ pratiṣṭhāpya • ityāha cakranāyakaḥ || dehināṃ svakulaṃ vakṣye • prajñāpāramite śṛṇu || (2) anāmikāmūle yasya striyo vā puruṣasya vā || navaśūkaṃ bhaved vajram Akṣobhyakulam uttamaṃ || (3) Vairocanasya bhavec cakraṃ • Amitābhasya paṅkajaṃ || Ratnasaṃbhavo mahāratnaṃ • khaḍgaṃ karmakulasya ca || (4)

b+ha gar ling ga gzhag nas ni/ / 'khor lo'i 'dren pas 'di skad gsungs/ / lus can rang gi rigs bshad kyis/ / shes rab pha rol phyin ma nyon/ / bud med dam ni skyes pa yi/ / gang gi srin lag rtsa ba la/ / rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa/ / mi bskyod pa yi rigs mchog nyid/ / rnam snang mdzad kyi 'khor lor 'gyur/ / dpag med mgon gyi 'dam skyes nyid/ / rin chen 'byung ba'i rin chen nyid/ / las kyi rigs kyi ral gri nyid/ /

The Chief of the Circle, establishing his sexual organ in her sexual organ, said: Listen, O Perfection of Wisdom, I will speak of the family appropriate for different individuals. A man or woman who has a nine-pointed Vajra at the base of the ring finger belongs to the supreme Akṣobhya Family; one with a circle to the Vairocana Family; one with a lotus to the Amitābha Family; one with a great gem to the Ratnasaṃbhava Family and one with a sword to the Karma Family.
dam 'khyud ces pa la sogs pa la/ 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o/ / mi bskyod pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa de'i rigs so/ /
ityāha (said): He said what follows in the verse. akṣobhyakulaṃ (Akṣobhya Family): Refers to Akṣobhya’s Family.

yo hi yogī bhavet kṛṣṇo • Akṣobhyas tasya devatā || yo hi yogī mahāgauro • Vairocanaḥ kuladevatā || (5) yo hi yogī mahāśyāmo • Amoghas tasya devatā || yo hi yogī mahāpiṅgo Ratneśaḥ kuladevatā || (6) raktagauro hi yo yogī Amitābhaḥ kuladevatā || śvetagauro hi yo yogī tasya [Vajra]sattvakulaṃ bhavet || (7)

rnal 'byor pa gang nag po che/ / de yi lha ni mi bskyod pa/ / rnal 'byor pa gang dkar po che/ / de yi lha ni rnam snang mdzad/ / rnal 'byor pa gang sngo bsangs che/ / de yi lha ni don yod nyid/ / rnal 'byor pa gang ser po che/ / rin chen bdag po rigs kyi lha/ / rnal 'byor pa gang dkar dmar nyid/ / 'od dpag med pa rigs kyi lha/ / rnal 'byor pa gang dkar dang ser/ / de ni sems dpa'i rigs su 'gyur/ /

Akṣobhya is the deity appropriate to a yogī who is black; Vairocana is the family deity of a yogī who is very white; Amoghasiddhi is the deity of a yogī who is grey-black; Ratneśa is the family deity of a yogī who is very yellow; Amitābha is the family deity of a yogī who is pink and a yogī who is shining white belongs to the Sattva Family.
sems pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs so/ /
sattvakulaṃ (Sattva Family): Refers to the Family of Vajrasattva.
jantavo nābhimantavyā • na viheṭhyā yogapāragaiḥ || tathāgatānāṃ kulās te syū rūpam āśritya sāṃvṛtaṃ || (8)
skye bo rnal 'byor mthar phyin pas/ / nga rgyal mi bcag tho mi btsam/ / kun rdzob gzugs su gnas nas ni/ / de rnams bde gshegs rigs su 'gyur/ /

The perfected yogis neither hold dear nor have contempt for any one. All beings belong to the families of the Five Buddhas but by the fact that beings are embodied they appear as relative and limited.
strīṇāṃ lakṣaṇaṃ caiva • yathā puṃsi tathaiva ca || tāsām api kulās te syuḥ saṃvṛtyācārarūpataḥ || (9)
bud med rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni/ / ji ltar skyes pa der bzhin no/ / kun rdzob tha snyad tshul las ni/ / de yi rigs su'ang de 'gyur ro/ /
The distinguishing characteristics for women are the same as those for men and their Families also are the same and exist in terms of the relative viewpoint.
de rnams zhes bya ba ni bud med de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can no/ /
tāsāṃ (their): Means of women. te (those): Refers the Buddhas.

tatra tuṣṭo mahāvajrī bhagaliṅgasya cumbanāt || Nairātmyām bodhyām āsa śṛṇu devi prapūjanaṃ || (10) udyāne vijane deśe • ātmāgārantareṣu ca || nagnīkṛtya mahāmudrāṃ • pūjayed yogāvit sadā || (11) cumbanāliṅganaṃ kṛtvā bhagasparśan tathaiva ca || vṛṣaṇaṃ naranāsāyāḥ pānam adharamadhusya ca || (12) madanāṅgakaraiḥ karma bolavān kurute sadā || dolāṅgakurpareṇāpi • suprasāritakais tathā || (13) muhurmuhuḥ kāmayed vajrī • adha ūrdhvaṃ nirīkṣayet || prāpnoti vipulāṃ siddhiṃ • sarvabuddhasamo bhavet || (14) karpūraṃ pīyate tatra • madanaṃ caiva viśeṣataḥ || balasya bhakṣaṇan tatra • kuryāt karpūrahetunā || (15)

b+ha gar ling ga'i 'o mdzad nas/ / de la rdo rje che mnyes nas/ / bdag med ma yis go mdzad pa/ / lha mo rab tu mchod pa nyon/ / tshal dang skye bo med gnas dang / / bdag gi khyim gyi nang du yang / / gcer bu phyag rgya cher byas nas/ / rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu mchod/ / 'o dang 'khyud pa byas nas ni/ / de bzhin b+ha gar reg pa nyid/ / skyes pa'i sna ni gzhib pa nyid/ / ma mchu'i sbrang rtsi btung ba nyid/ / rtag tu myos pa'i mtshan ma las/ / bo la ldan pas lag pas bya/ / khyogs dang brla zhes bya ba dang / / de bzhin shin tu bkal ba yi/ / yang yang rdo rjes 'dod pa bya/ / steng dang 'og tu lta ba nyid/ / dngos grub rgyas pa thob pa ste/ / sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam par 'gyu+ur/ / de la ga bur btung bar bya/ / de la ga bur rgyu yi phyir/ / sha ni bza' ba nyid du bya/ / khyad par du ni chang nyid do/ /

Then, the Great Adamantine One, satisfied with the mutual kissing of each other’s sexual organs, made Nairātmyā aware of the following: Listen, O Goddess, to the propitiating service. In a garden in a lonely place or within the inner chamber of one’s own house, making the Mahāmudrā consort naked, the wise yogī should always serve her. He should kiss and embrace her and stimulate her sexual organ. The vagina should be aroused and the nectar of her lips should be drunk. The yogī whose sexual organ is aroused should erotically mark and activate her with his hands. With the Swing, with the Knee and with the Wide-open, thus the adamantine yogī should repeatedly make love and should gaze below and above. Then the yogī will attain numerous powers and become equal to all the Buddhas. Semen is to be drunk there and especially wine. Meat should be eaten there for the benefit of semen.

bdag med ma la'o mdzad pa/ /zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o/ / myos pas ni bde ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o/ / mtshan ma'i zhes bya ba ni de'i don du sen mo 'debs pa'o/ / lag pas zhes bya ba ni sor mo gnyis kyis bskyod pa la sogs pa'o/ / rdo rje ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rengs par gyur pa'i rdo rjes so/ / 'phyang thag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang bskur ba bzhi po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi man ngag gi bya ba rnams gsungs pa yin te/ 'phyang thag dang 'dra bas 'phyang thag go/ / steng phyogs na gnas pa'o/ / 'di ni byed pa po bud med yin te/ mdun dang rgyab tu bud med kyis/ / dal gyis gsang gnas 'phyang ba yis/ / mtshan ma'i steng na mnyam gnas pa/ / 'phyang thag 'dra bar rab tu grags/ / bla zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir byed pa po skyes bu yin te/ bud med pus mo bslangs nas ni/ / g.yas dang g.yon pa'i dpung pa la/ / steng du sbyar ba'i byed pa yis/ / phan tshun mngon phyogs gnas pa'o/ / shin tu brkyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la/ ngang pa'i gshog pa'i rnam pa ltar/ / brkyang bar gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis/ / shin tu brkyang bar gyur pa yin/ / 'gyel bar gyur pa dag gir grags/ / de bzhin zhes bya ba ni kha ba gsungs te/ 'gyel ba'i rkang pa steng 'og tu/ / dbyug pa bzhin du gang gnas pa'i/ / zur dang rgyab tu cung mnan pa/ / khab kyi byed pa zhes byar brjod/ / ga pur rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ga pur 'phel bar byed pa'i ched du'o/ /

bodhayāmāsa (made ... aware): Means he addressed. madanaṃ (erotically): Refers to the excitement arising from the Great Bliss. aṅka (mark): Refers to the scratching with the nails. karaiḥ karma (activate... with his hands): Refers to stimulating with two fingers and so on. bolavān (the yogī whose vajra is aroused): Refers to the yogī with an erect penis. dola ityādi (with the Swing etc.): The postures for instructing upon the essential characteristics of the four consecrations are mentioned. ‘Swing’ refers to the movement to and fro of the woman on top as the active partner. “The woman swings back and forth her hips whilst seated on top of the male genitals. This is known as the Swing posture.” kurpara ityādi (Knee etc.): In this posture the man is the active partner. “The active male partner [should enter the woman] whilst they face each other after the placing the woman’s knees up and uniting the right with the left hand.” suprasārita (Wide-open): “Like the wings of a swan ready to fly, extend both the thighs and legs of the woman wide apart.” tathā (thus): Here ‘thus’ implies the Needle posture which is: “[The woman is] lying face downwards with her feet straight like a stick and her back bent upwards slightly is the Needle posture.” karpūrahetave (for the benefit of semen): Means for the increase of semen.
sahajārthapaṭalo nāmaikādaśaḥ ||
kye'i rdo rje las lhan cig skyes pa'i sbyor ba don gyi le'u zhes bya ba ste bcu gcig pa'o// //
Thus ends the Eleventh, the chapter regarding the Attainment of the Innate.
lhan cig skyes pa'i don byed pa'i khyad par gang du ston pa'i le'u la yang de skad ces bya'o/ /
sahajārtha (the Attaining of the Innate): The subject matter of this chapter is the method for attaining the Innate.
dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rnal 'byor rin po che'i phreng ba las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa'o// //
Thus ends the Eleventh Chapter of the Second Part of the Hevajra Pañjikā known as the Yogaratnamālā.
CHAPTER 12. Instruction for the Four Consecrations
athāto vajrī caturo 'bhiṣekān kathayām āsa ||
de nas rdo rje can gyis dbang / / bzhi pa'i tshigs bcad bka' stsal pa/ /
Then the Adamantine One spoke regarding the four consecrations.
de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ni dbang bzhi'i tshigs bcad kyi man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab gtad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o/ /
tathā ityādi (then etc.): Then the Adamantine One spoke the verses which contain the appropriate instructions to be given to the disciple when assigning Wisdom during the four consecrations.
mahāvajraṃ mahāghaṇtāṃ • gṛhna vajrapratiṣṭhitaḥ || vajrācāryasya adyaiva kuru śiṣyasya saṃgrahaṃ || (1)
rdo rje rab gnas rdo rje nyid/ / che dang dril bu chen po bzung / / de ring rdo rje slob dpon 'gyur/ / slob ma bsdu ba nyid du gyis/ /
O you who are firmly established in the Vajra, take hold of the great Vajra and the great Bell and today itself perform the admission of the disciple into the [fold] of the Vajra Master.
rdo rje rab gnas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang nyid du rnam par gnas pa'o/ /
vajrapratiṣṭhitaḥ (firmly established in the Vajra): Means firmly established as a bearer of the Vajra.
yathā buddhair atītais tu • sicyante bodhiputrakāḥ || mayā guhyābhiṣekeṇa sikto 'si cittadhārayā || (2)
ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyis/ / byang chub sras rnams dbang bskur ba/ / bdag gis gsang ba'i dbang gis ni/ / sems kyi rgyun gyis dbang bskur ro/ /
Just as the Buddhas of previous times consecrated the Sons of Enlightenment, so are you consecrated by me with the flow of Enlightened Consciousness in this Secret Consecration.
byang chub ni shes rab bo/ / de'i sras ni byang chub sems dpa'o/ /
bodhiputrakāḥ (the Sons of Enlightenment): Here ‘Enlightenment’ refers to Wisdom and her ‘sons’ are the Bodhisattvas.
ratidāṃ siddhidāṃ devīṃ viśvarūpāṃ manoramāṃ || gṛhṇa gṛhṇa mahāsattva gṛhītvā pūjanaṃ kuru || (3)
lha mo dga' sbyin gnas sbyin me/ / sna tshogs gzugs can yid 'ong ma/ / khyer cig khyer cig sems dpa' che/ / khyer la mchod pa dag tu gyis/ /
Take, O great Being, take this delightful goddess who is beautiful, the bestower of erotic delight and the bestower of the ‘state’. Taking her perform the service.
dga' ba ni brtse ba'o/ / gnas ni byang chub kyi sems so/ /
ratiḥ (erotic delight): Means delightfully satisfying. sthānaṃ (state): Refers to the state of Enlightened Consciousness.
idaṃ jñānaṃ mahāsūkṣmaṃ vajramaṇḍaṃ nabhopamaṃ || virajaṃ mokṣadaṃ śāntaṃ • pitā te tvam asi svayaṃ || (4)
ye shes 'di ni ches phra zhing / / rdo rje nam mkha'i dkyil lta bu/ / rdul bral thar sbyin zhi ba nyid/ / khyod rang yang ni de yi pha/ /
This Knowledge is most subtle, the essence of the Vajra, space-like, undefiled, bestows liberation and is tranquillity. You are yourself your own procreator.

'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la/ ches phra zhing zhes bya ba ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro/ / rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so/ / dkyil ni snying po'o/ / nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lta bu ste snang ba med pa'i sems can rnams so/ / rdul bral zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad pa'o/ / mthar phyin zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las 'das pa nyid do/ / zhi ba nyid ces bya ba ni gnod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro/ / khyod rang nyid ni khyod kyi tha/ /zhes bya ba ni khyod nyid so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro/ /

mahāsūkṣmaṃ (most subtle): This is because this Knowledge is beyond the range of the phenomenal. vajra (the Vajra): Vajra refers to the Buddhas, maṇḍaṃ (essence): Refers to the essence of the Buddhas, nabhopamaṃ (space-like): ‘Space-like’ because it is devoid of any projections. virajaṃ (undefiled): ‘Undefiled’ because afflictions are consumed. mokṣadaṃ (bestows liberation): It bestows liberation because this Knowledge transcends the phenomenal existence. pitā te tvam asi svayaṃ (you are yourself your own procreator): This is so because it becomes evident to the disciple in his own experience.

vajrapadmādhiṣṭhānamantraḥ || OṂ padmasukhādhāra mahārāgasukhaṃdada || caturānandasvabhāga viśva HŪṂ HŪṂ HŪṂ kāryaṃ kuruṣva me || (5) OṂ vajra mahādveṣa caturānandadāyaka || khaga mukhaikaraso nātha HŪṂ HŪṂ HŪṂ kāryaṃ kuruṣva me ||

rdo rje dang pad+ma byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags ni/ oM pat+mu su khAd+hA ra ma hA rA ga su khaM dad tsatwA rA nan+da b+hA ga pi shwa hU~M hU~M hU~M kAr+YaM ku ru Sh+wa me/ oM badzra ma hA dwe Sha tsa turA nan+da dA ya kaHkha ga mu khai ka ra so nA tha hU~M hU~M hU~M kAR+yaM ku ru Sh+wa me/

Now the mantra for the empowerment of the Vajra and the Lotus: Oṃ Lotus, receptacle of Bliss, the one who grants the bliss of Great Passion, many are the blessings of your four Joys, hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ, please fulfill my desires. Oṃ Vajra, O one of great wrath, the one who gives the four Joys, the singular delight of the entrance to Space, O Lord, hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ, please fulfill my desires.
rdo rje pad+ma byin gyis brlabs pa ni rang gis byin gyis rlob pa'o/ / rin chen rnal 'byor rnams kyi phreng / /
vajrapadmādhiṣṭhānaṃ (the empowerment of the Vajra and the Lotus): Refers to the mantra by which the Vajra and the Lotus are empowered.
śirasi OṂ-kāraṃ • hṛdi HŪṂ-kāraṃ • kiñjalke Ā-kāraṃ || (6)
spyi bor ni oM gyi rnam pa/ snying gar ni hU~M gi rnam pa/ ze 'bru la ni AH'i rnam pa'o/ /
Oṃ in the head. Hūṃ in the heart. Ā in the Lotus.
mahātantrarājamāyākalpo dvitīyaḥ ||

rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po sgyu ma'i brtag pa zhes bya ba brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis las phyung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kye'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sdom pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rdzogs so// //
Thus ends the Illusion Part, the second part of the Great Regal Tantra.
dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i 'grel byas pas/ / bsod nam bsags pa gang yod des/ / 'gro kun nyon mongs kun bral shog /
Let the merit accrued from composing this Hevajra Pañjikā, which is a garland of the jewels of Yoga, be for the removal of the afflictions of all beings.
dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rnal 'byor rin po che'i phreng ba las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so// //
Thus ends the Yogaratnamālā of the Paṇḍitācārya Śrī Kāṇhapāda.
